He was booked under sections 295A (deliberate and malicious acts, intended to outrage religious feelings of any class by insulting its religion or religious beliefs), 298 (uttering words, etc., to hurt religious feelings of any person), 153A (by words or by signs or by visible representations or otherwise, promotes or attempts to promote, on grounds of religion, race, place), 505 (1)(B) (intent to cause fear or alarm among the public, or any section of the public whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the State or against public tranquility) of IPC and section 67 of the IT Act.

Title: Cops on toes as Bajrang Dal man among four killed in Bihar
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Four people, including a Bajrang Dal activist, were killed in separate incidents in the state in the last 24 hours, police said on Thursday.

Hajipur SDPO Raghav Dayal said the body of 36-year-old Neeraj Kumar, a Bajrang Dal activist, was recovered from a well at Adalbari under the Hajipur town police station in Vaishali district on Thursday. Neeraj had gone missing from Anjan Peer locality of Hajipur town on Wednesday.

Police said Neeraj, a resident of Kadamghat locality of Hajipur town, had left his studio at Anjan Peer with some of his acquaintances on Wednesday for arbitration in a land dispute. His family members started searching him when he didn’t return home late in the night. Earlier, a missing case was lodged with the Town police station.

On Thursday morning, Neeraj’s body was recovered from the well located on the premises of a guava orchard at Adalbari. The body bore bullet injuries and his throat was slit with a sharp-edged weapon. Police recovered nine empty cartridges from the spot, which suggested that the criminals shot Neeraj after slitting his throat with a sharp-edged weapon.

The SDPO said one Pappu Singh, a resident of Kadamghat at Hajipur, has been made accused in the case. “Raids are on to arrest Pappu,” he said, adding dispute over a plot of land was probably the reason behind the murder.

In another incident, a 35-year-old man, Surendra Kumar Singh, was shot dead by unidentified armed criminals near Patiasa Chowk under the Ahiyapur police station area in Muzaffarpur late on Wednesday night. Police said the incident took place around 9pm when Surendra was returning to his native village Manjhauli under Bochaha police station in the district from his work.

Surendra, who worked at the office of a cloth merchant, was rushed to the SKMCH where he died during treatment. DSP (town) Ram Naresh Paswan said personal enmity was the reason behind the killing.

In Rohtas, unidentified criminals killed a 36-year-old woman, Sunita Devi, at Girgharia Mor under the Shivsagar police station area around 4am on Thursday. SHO of Shivsagar police station Satyendra Kumar Satyarthi said the woman was attacked with a country-made weapon when she was asleep in her room. “The reason behind the murder is yet to be ascertained,” the SHO added.

In another incident in Rohtas district, criminals shot dead one Nitish Yadav at Neema village under the Suryapura police station area on Thursday evening. Police said the deceased had criminal antecedents and he was released from jail recently. The killing sparked tension in the area and armed forces were deployed to bring situation under control.

(With inputs from Muzaffarpur)

Title: Ahmedabad: Retired teacher loses purse to bus door handle, gets it back
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

AHMEDABAD: A 72-year-old retired teacher, breathed a massive sigh of relief when she was handed back her purse, which contained Rs 55,000 cash and 60g of gold jewellery, after a nerve-wracking two-hour wait.

Pushpa Solanki had boarded bus No. 13/1, going from Ranip to Isanpur, at Gandhi Ashram. When she got off at the Lal Darwaja bus station, her purse snagged on the door handle.

“Before I could do anything, the unaware driver closed the door and the bus sped away. I tried to yank the purse off but was not successful. As I ran behind the bus shouting for help, I fell down. Some other conductors and drivers at the bus stand gathered around and took me to the control cabin.”

Solanki said that control cabin officials called the Vadaj control and got the phone number of the driver, Girish Rathod, and conductor, Dilip Patel. After checking Rathod, said that the purse was still on the bus and would be handed over at Lal Darwaja when they returned from Isanpur.

“I waited till the bus returned. After two hours, the purse was handed over to me. I checked it contents and found everything in order, the cash and jewellery too,” she said. The control cabin staff took pictures. Solanki said it was her luck and the honesty of the driver and conductor that she got her belongings back.

Title: Battle between those who think & those who hate: Arundhati Roy
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Arundhati Roy

KOLKATA: Author-activist Arundhati Roy , while delivering a speech at a city film festival on Thursday, said she was amazed at the solidarity and courage shown by students and women, who have been leading the protests against implementation of NRC and CAA since the bill was passed in November.

“Within days of the Citizenship Amendment Act being passed, the students rose. AMU, Jamia, JNU, Jadavpur University . They showed us what courage and solidarity mean. They showed us that this is a battle between those who know how to think and those who know how to hate,” she said.

She stressed that the most exciting thing about the ongoing protests is that they are led by women. “It is a liberalization for young women who are out on the road protesting,” said the author of ‘God of Small Things’ during the hour-long talk at the 7th Kolkata People’s Film Festival at Uttam Mancha in south Kolkata.

Roy said the real purpose of an all-India NRC, coupled with CAA, is to threaten and destabilize the population by casting it into a maze of bureaucracy and documentation, that nobody, least of all the poor, can hope to have. She also strongly criticized the internet ban in Kashmir, wondering if a fire-walled internet is in the country’s future.

“It is meant to create a tiered citizenship, in which one set of citizens has no rights and lives at the mercy of another — a modern caste system which will exist alongside the ancient one, in which Muslims are the new Dalits,” she said.

She appealed to the audience to boycott NPR and NRC. “This government is in its second term and has a brute majority in Parliament. We have to prevail on the CMs of non-BJP states to refuse to implement CAA, NRC and NPR. India has a choice. Deep federalism or the risk of balkanization,” she said.

Title: NPR is nothing but NRC in disguise, says Kanhaiya Kumar
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Kanhaiya Kumar at the meeting on Thursday evening

KOLKATA: “Today they are coming for your citizenship, tomorrow they will come after your property and then they will snatch your voting rights,” said Kanhaiya Kumar while addressing a nearly 15,000-strong crowd in the packed Debashree cinema hall ground near Barrackpore railway station on Thursday evening. The National Population Register ( NPR ) is NRC in disguise, he alleged.

In the afternoon, several posters with derogatory statements against Kumar were found pasted near Titagarh Tata Gate off BT Road, near Barrackpore railway station and in an area leading to the meeting venue. Police later pulled some of these down. The agitators got into a scuffle with cops when a team from Titagarh police station arrived the spot.

“Some BJP supporters who were found putting up posters and banners containing filthy language against Kanhaiya Kumar were caught red-handed,” an officer said. After the eight persons were arrested, another group of BJP supporters gheraoed Titagarh police station demanding their immediate release. When police tried to disperse the agitators, the BJP men put up a road block on BT Road near Titagarh police station for over half an hour. Sensing trouble, a tight security arrangement was made for Kumar’s meeting.

BJP MP Arjun Singh, however, said, “Police had falsely implicated BJP supporters and arrested them. We are not bothered with Kanhaiya Kumar. The protest was against the false charges by police.”

Kumar, later, received a rousing welcome by the crowd.

“The Indian Constitution does not differentiate between its people based on religion, birth, language or caste. This new citizenship law, therefore, is unconstitutional and illegal,” he said, adding, “Their NRC brahmastra in Assam backfired. They tried to throw out Muslim infiltrators, but ended up making 12 lakh Hindus foreigners in their own country. They are using NPR as a ploy to evade the NRC issue. The NPR will try to identify doubtful citizens. These people will be asked to furnish additional documents, which they most likely will not be able to. And then they will use the NRC trick.”

Title: Parties in Bihar gear up to celebrate Karpoori birth anniversary today
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

A statue of former Bihar CM and towering extremely backward caste (EBC) leader, Karpoori Thakur in Patna.

PATNA: Various political parties are gearing up to celebrate the birth anniversary of former CM and towering extremely backward caste (EBC) leader from the state, Karpoori Thakur in a big way on Friday.

The occasion has gained special significance this time as the state assembly elections are due in October-November. Mainstream political parties have been making efforts to woo the predominant EBC sections who together constitute around 30% of the state’s population.

While the EBC wing of the JD(U) will celebrate the function at Sri Krishna Memorial Hall here, the BJP’s function will be held at its state headquarters. CM Nitish Kumar is slated to inaugurate the JD(U)’s function.

For the first time in recent memory, the state BJP has decided to hold the function under a ‘pandal’. Party’s senior leaders, including state president Dr Sanjay Kumar Jaiswal and ministers Sushil Kumar Modi , Nand Kishore Yadav and Mangal Pandey, will attend the function.

Leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav will inaugurate the RJD function at the party office here. “Former CM Rabri Devi is unlikely to participate due to poor health,” RJD spokesman Chitranjan Gagan said.

The RLSP has planned to organize congregation of school students in front of their schools across the state to press for educational reforms in the state. Party chief Upendra Kushwaha will lead the congregation on the Miller School ground here. “The students will stand in lines in front of their schools and hold ‘maanav kataar’, including on the Miller School ground,” RLSP functionary Bhola Yadav said.

As far as the political leanings of the EBC sections are considered, they have largely remained aligned with Nitish for the last 15 years or so.

Title: Nitish to PM: Intervene to end Nalanda seer’s fast at Haridwar
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

PATNA/NALANDA: Chief minister Nitish Kumar has urged PM Narendra Modi to intervene to end the fast being observed by Sadhvi Padmavati , a 23-year-old seer from Bihar’s Nalanda district , at Haridwar to press for preservation of the Ganga and suspension of the hydroelectric projects on the sacred river in Uttarakhand.

Nitish shot off a letter to the PM on Thursday, requesting him to initiate steps to end the fast being observed by Padmavati since December 15 last year. The CM said the health condition of Padmavati might deteriorate in the days to come.

Maintaining that the Ganga must be left to flow unhindered, the CM reminded the PM he had shared his views with him on this issue several times. He also reminded the PM of the conferences organized in Patna and New Delhi in February and May in 2017 to address the issue.

While the first conference was held in Patna on February 25 and February 26, 2017 on ‘Aviral Ganga’, the second one was organized in New Delhi on ‘Ganga ki aviralta mein badhak gaad: Samashya evam samadhan’ on May 18 and May 19, 2017. Noted river water conservation experts from across the country had attended the two conferences. Two separate resolutions – ‘Patna Resolution’ and ‘Delhi Resolution’ – were also passed after the conferences.

Nitish said the two resolutions were later sent to the Union water conversation ministry for necessary action. The CM hoped that the PM would initiate steps to address the issues raised by Padmavati and end her fast. “I am aware of your commitment and sincere efforts to ensure the natural and unhindered flow of the river,” he added.

On Wednesday, the CM had sent JD(U) MP from Nalanda Kaushlendra Kumar and water resources department minister Sanjay Jha to Haridwar to provide urgent medical and other assistances to Padmavati. Matri Sadan at Haridwar, where Padmavati is observing the fast, is the place where activist Swami Gyan Swarup Sanand had breathed his last following 112 days of his fast-unto-death on October 11, 2018. Sanand had begun his fast on June 22, 2018.

An Alwar based-organisation, Tarun Bharat Sangh, had recently appealed to Nitish to intervene in the matter and save Padmavati’s life.

Sant Kumar, father of Padmavati and resident of Badi Malama village in Nalanda district, said his daughter is a follower of Matri Sadan in Haridwar. He said Padmavati, who had earlier sat on dharna in Varanasi for the cause of preservation and protection of the Ganga, started her fast-unto-death this time after the central government and National Green Tribunal (NGT) failed to respond to her demand of legislation for preservation and free flow of the Ganga and suspension of hydel projects being carried out in Haridwar.

Title: Show concern for wildlife: Sushil Modi to forest guards
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Bihar deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi addressing the newly recruited forest guards at a function in Gyan Bhavan, P... Read More

PATNA: Deputy chief minister Sushil Kumar Modi on Thursday asked the newly recruited 848 forest guards of the state to show compassion and concern for the forests, trees, wildlife and scheduled tribe (ST) populations living in the forest areas.

“If you show compassion and concern for the forests, trees, wildlife and ST groups living in the forest areas, it will help you perform your duty with dedication and sincerity,” Modi said while addressing the newly recruited forest guards at a function at Gyan Bhavan here as part of their orientation programme.

Modi said against the 902 sanctioned posts of forest guards, 879 candidates were selected for appointment through an examination that was conducted without any controversy. “The results were fair and no court case occurred,” Modi said.

He added that the environment, forest and climate change department will spend Rs 641 crore during the current financial year. “Of the total sum, Rs 501 crore has come through budgetary allotment and the remaining Rs 140 crore from the Centre. The department will go for a massive plantation drive in August this year,” Modi said.

Title: Tamil Nadu: NEET aspirants from government schools fall by 10,000 this year
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Aspirants for National Eligibility cum-Entrance Test (Neet) from government and government-aided schools have dropped by more than 10,000 students this year . From 17,630 applicants in 2019, the numbers have dwindled to just around 7,000 in 2020 .

Only two students from government-sponsored coaching centres in the state got medical seats last year. Four students from government-aided schools who attended private coaching also got MBBS seats in 2019.

Despite elaborate efforts by the school education department, the number of students joining medical courses remained more or less the same.

The number of students attending Neet coaching has come down from 19,355 to 10,000 this year. Students and teachers were disheartened as the cut-off increased over 100 marks and old students grabbed 70% of medical seats in the state, officials said. There has been a decrease in the number of students opting for science stream every year. Pursuing Neet is also providing limited options and this year, the cut-off may increase further. These factors could have discouraged many students, said an official.

Headmasters of some schools said one year coaching for Neet is not sufficient. “Coaching should have been given for two years. Instead of giving coaching at state level, the government should consider coaching at school level,” said the headmaster of a city school. Some headmasters demanded a separate quota for government school students as they could not compete with students who prepare for more than two years for the exam.

Educationist Prince Gajendrababu said apprehensions about common medical entrance tests have been proved correct. “We warned about mushrooming of coaching centres and possibility of spending an extra year for coaching. They have come true and only affluent students can afford coaching as it would cost up to Rs 5lakh a year,” he said. “Though government school students have the same aptitude and skills like others, they could not take up the test. The state government should strengthen higher secondary exams and admit students based on higher secondary marks,” he added.

“Poor results for three continuous years has taken away the confidence of government school students. The government also did not give proper training for medical aspirants,” said Dr G R Raveendranath, general secretary, Doctors’ Association for Social Equality. “The state government should reserve seats for government school students in government medical colleges,” he said.

In 2016, before Neet-based admissions for MBBS, 34 students from government schools joined medical colleges. After introduction of Neet for medical admissions in Tamil Nadu , only seven from government schools joined MBBS in 2017, while five joined in 2018, according to the Directorate of Medical Education. So far, only 14 from government schools have aced Neet in the last three years.

Title: Depressed over break-up, girl ends life
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Varanasi: A student of BTC (basic training certificate) Pushpanjali reportedly committed suicide by hanging her with the ceiling fan of a room in Imaliadih locality under Sarai Lakhansi police station in Mau district on Wednesday night. Police recovered a suicide note stating that she was in depression after break up with her boy friend. According to reports, Pushpanjali of Mardah area in Ghazipur district was dwelling in a shared room at Imaliadih area to complete her BTC course. On Wednesday her room mate had gone somewhere. When she returned on Thursday morning Pushpanjali did not open the doors despite repeated knocking. When she saw inside the room from a window the body of Pushpanjali was hanging with the ceiling. Her room-mate informed the police.

Title: Societies going green to get 25% extra funds
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Surat: Residential societies who drastically reduce waste generation will get additional financial incentives.

Municipal commissioner Banchhanidhi Pani, while presented the draft budget for 2020-21 on Thursday, announced that 971 societies who have been equipped with organic waste processors will get 25% additional more grant from SMC if they reuse, reprocess and recycle the complete waste. These societies should send out less than 5% of the total waste for processing.

These societies get a monthly grant ranging from Rs 1,500 to Rs 3,500 from SMC depending on the volume of waste produced and size of the colony. Nearly 3.5 lakh citizens living in these societies will be benefited by this if they take up efficient waste management apart from earning from the manure that they produce.

In addition to this, all those societies who install common solar panels will get flat Rs 25,000 subsidy from the SMC. The city has nearly 80,000 residential societies.

Pani said both these provisions were made with an aim to make Surat a zero-waste city and promote green energy.

The civic body is also aiming to reduce air pollution by encouraging more citizens to leave their private vehicles and opt for public transport. For this purpose, Pani announced introduction of Saral card that can be used throughout the year for unlimited travel. Students, women, senior citizens and divyangs will get the card at discounted rates.

This card will be available for Rs 7,000 for commuters, but students and divyangs will be given for Rs 4,000 while women and senior citizens will have to pay Rs 5,000 per year for unlimited trips in city buses and BRTS buses.

FIRED UP AFTER FREQUENT BLAZES

The frequent devastating fires, which have claimed lives and destroyed property worth crores, has forced the Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) to double its spending on fire fighting infrastructure.

Municipal Commissioner Banchhanidhi Pani proposed to increase the budgetary allocation from Rs 16.72 crore last year to Rs 32.35 crore in 2020-21.

It has been proposed to increase the number of fire stations from 16 to 31 this year. South–west zone and south zone will have four new fire stations each whereas east west and Varachha zones will have two each. North zone will have one new fire station. This work at the cost of Rs 45.61 crore in under progress.

During the year, SMC will buy three new water tenders, two aerial ladder platforms 32 m and 22 m high, two more turntable ladders of 42 m and 68 m high and wireless and other electronics items. All these will cost Rs 42.24 crore.

Vehicle tracking systems will also be set up in fire department vehicles while every fire station will have a digital clock and CCTV camera and call recording system in fire control room. As many as 612 fire volunteers have been recruited of whom 280 have been given two-days training .

There is provision of setting up fire prevention wing and setting up online fire NOC issuance facility. Provision has also been made for a training centre for fire staff and in the budget. A workshop at the cost of Rs seven crore will also be built for fire department.

NEW LEVY ON PLASTIC MAKING UNITS

Plastic manufacturers will have to pay up Rs 9,000 per year to Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) beginning next financial year 2020 with municipal commissioner introducing a new levy these units. Under the ongoing plastic-free Surat campaign, more than 2 million plastic bags have been confiscated in last eight months and over 200 tonnes plastic waste was gathered in 10 months. There are nearly 140 units making different kinds of plastic in Surat city. SMC believes that the new levy will compel units to stop producing banned plastic material

INDUSTRIES USING RECYCLED WATER TO GET 5% REBATE

Industrial units under SMC purview buying recycled water from the civic body and are members of emission trading scheme will get five per cent rebate on re cycled water rates applicable to them. The step has been taken to encourage industrial units to reduce the pollution.

Title: Builders begin changing façade design of textile markets in Saroli
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Surat: The devastating fire at Raghuvir Celeum Textile Market on Puna-Kumbhariya Road a few days ago has brought into focus buildings with glass and aluminium facade, especially those in the textile markets of Saroli.

Firefighters had a tough task recently extinguishing the fire at Raghuvir Celeum Textile Market because it had a glass and aluminium facade.

Thus, builders, who constructed textile markets in Saroli with facade, have started to make drastic changes in decorative elevations.

A few builders have started to change elevation of the markets with non-combustible material and also providing them proper ventilation and lighting.

Out of 26 textile markets in Saroli on Puna-Kumbhariya Road, about 18 have façade design to make them look more decorative. Majority of builders had used aluminium sheets and glass in outer elevation.

Surat Urban Development Authority (SUDA) has given 30 days to builders to make necessary changes in façade design and get it approved from fire and emergency services department of Surat Municipal Corporation.

For the buildings under construction, the builders will be charged premium rate of Rs1,000 per square metre for outer elevation.

SUDA chairman Banchhanidhi Pani told TOI, “By putting premium rate of Rs1,000 square metre for façade design, we are discouraging builders in going for outer elevation. Those who have done the facade will have to change the design to make the building safe. From now on, builders will have to specially register themselves for doing outer elevation. The fire and emergency services department will carry out a detailed inspection of the design of the facade.”

Experts believe textile markets are vulnerable to fire hazards due to presence of highly inflammable polyester fabric.

Design of textile markets must conform to National Building Code (NBC) guidelines and builders should stay away from creating decorative facade using aluminium and glass material, which are highly dangerous when fire breaks out.

Dr Atul Desai, professor of civil engineering department of Sardar Vallabhbhai National Institute of Technology (SVNIT), told TOI, “Such elevations are done in western countries using glass due to heavy cold. Take the example of a car parked under the sun. If the temperature outside is 35 degrees Celsius, the actual temperature inside a closed car would be 45 degrees. Same is with buildings having decorative facade. Textile markets are ticking time bombs as they are stuffed with inflammable material in huge quantities. The facade makes matters worse in textile markets in case of fires.”

Title: Cholamandalam Investmentand Finance reports net profit up 28%
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Chennai: Cholamandalam Investment and Finance Company Limited (CIFCL) reports net profit up 28% at Rs 389 crore for Q3FY20, and up 13% at Rs 1,010 crore for year-to-date December 2019. The total AUM has crossed Rs 65,000 crore up 25% while total income stands at Rs 2,275 crore for Q3FY20 and Rs 6,501 crore for year-to-date. Aggregate disbursements for YTD Dec 2019 registered a 9% growth. The NBFC’s vehicle finance (VF) business has clocked a volume of Rs 18,685 cr for the period ended December 2019 as against Rs 17,600 cr in the previous year, reporting a growth of 6%. However, VF for the quarter ended December 2019 declined to Rs 5,949 Cr as against Rs 6,277 Cr in the same quarter last year. “The slow-down in VF disbursement is due to industry de-growth in CV segment during this quarter,” the company said. While, the home equity (HE) business disbursed seen 10% growth. The Capital Adequacy Ratio (CAR) of the company as on December 31, 2019 was at 17.04% as against the regulatory requirement of 15%. Arun Alagappan, MD said, “In Q3 of FY20, faced with the slowdown in the auto sector we changed our product mix to shore up our net interest income. Accordingly, we were able to grow our AUM at over 25% and PAT growth over 28%. While doing this we were able to contain our Stage 3 levels at 3.5% which is a reflection of our asset quality.”

Title: DGGI arrests bizman for Rs5.56 crore ITC fraud
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Surat: Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) arrested proprietor of a city-based trading firm for fraudulently availing and utilizing input tax credit (ITC) to the tune of Rs5.56 crore. The proprietor was produced in Surat district court on Thursday which sent him to judicial custody for 14 days.

DGGI’s Surat zonal unit had raided Karim Traders owned by Salim Ahmed Panjwani located at Udhna Udhyognagar in Udhana. Panjwani had created a chain of firms in Surat, Vapi, Billimora, Ankleshwar and other places in Gujarat to pass on fake ITC.

About 22 premises in Surat, Ankleshwar, Vapi and Billimora were raided by the DGGI two days ago. Scrutiny of seized records seized from Karim Traders revealed that Panjwani obtained GST registration as a trader of grains but had shown supply of scrap and ingots to various firms across Gujarat.

Panjwani availed huge amount of inadmissible and wrong ITC from bogus suppliers on the basis of GST invoices issued to them without actual supply of goods. During course of investigation, incriminating documents were recovered from the premises. Total illegal transaction of goods was valued at Rs100 crore, involving GST evasion of about Rs18 crore as per preliminary estimates.

An officer on the condition of anonymity said, “We have found GST evasion of Rs18 crore as per preliminary estimate. The case is at initial stage of investigation and the amount of tax evasion could increase further. Panjwani was arrested on the basis of preliminary scrutiny of documents which showed fraudulent availing of ITC to the tune of Rs5.56 crore by him.”

Title: Osmania University graduates can now get digital transcripts
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Osmania University

SECUNDERABAD: Students who graduated from Osmania University ( OU ) after 2010 can now get their transcripts digitally.

The university’s examination department started issuing digital transcripts to UG students from January 21. “Earlier, students had to submit a photocopy of their transcripts to obtain a duplicate one from the controller of examination. Many a time, we had to reject photocopies due to poor printing. Now, using the database from 2010 onwards, we will be able to issue digital transcripts without any hassle,” said Prof Sriram Venkatesh, controller of examination (CoE), OU.

Issuance of digital transcripts was initially limited to only a few courses such as master of computer applications. However, considering its benefits, the university extended it to other courses as well. “We will be shortly extending the service for post-graduate courses as well,” said Prof Venkatesh.

While the university will dispatch digital transcripts of those who graduated after 2010, those who have graduated before that will have to submit physical photocopy to the varsity to obtain transcripts.

According to officials, the digitisation of transcripts will prove beneficial for many graduates who have moved to other cities or countries. It will have digitized signature of the university registrar and the CoE. Cost of issuance of transcripts and the duration to obtain the same shall remain the same.

Title: Surat cops do spot verification of Raghuvir Celeum
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Raghuvir Celeum building in Surat

SURAT: Police did a panchnama – spot verification – of Raghuvir Celeum on Thursday accompanied by officials of different departments concerned. The textile market caught fire early on Tuesday and created a record as the longest burning fire in Surat’s history.

Police did spot verification in presence of officials of forensic science laboratory (FSL), electrical inspector, Dakshin Gujarat Vij Company Limited (DGVCL) and Surat Fire and Emergency Services (SFES) of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC). They will now collect detailed investigation report from all the departments to find out the cause of fire and how it spread in the entire building.

FSL officials collected samples from the spot for detailed investigation. FSL will submit its findings based on the evidences collected from the spot. “As of now it is an accidental fire and no FIR has been registered. If anything suspicious comes out during investigation police will register an offence,” said an officer at Puna police station.

Title: SGTPA urges govt to shift textile mills out of city
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Surat: While the devastating fire in the Raghuvir Celeum textile market served as another wake-up call to the administration on fire hazards in textile markets, mill owners seem to be really singed by the loss their fraternity suffered in the recent inferno.

More than 40 textile mill owners in the city areas have approached the state government for allotting them land outside the city limits for safe operations. For the purpose, the South Gujarat Textile Processors Association (SGTPA) has also identified about 20 lakh square metre land at Gabheni village outside the city limits for shifting the textile mills out of the city areas.

The shifting of the textile mills will not only reduce pollution in the city areas, but also protect residents from fire hazards.

President of SGTPA, Jitu Vakharia said, “We have been pursuing with the state government for the land on the outskirts of the city. We have identified government land in Gabheni village, located around 20km away from the city for setting up mills too.”

Last year, the government had approved specified shifting zones for the industrial units with the addition of few provisions in the General Development Control Regulation (GDCR).

The textile mill owners wanting to develop their factories in the special approved areas will get base floor space index (FSI) of 1.8 free, while 0.9 FSI will be chargeable based on the jantri rates. The textile mill owners are upbeat as the FSI for industrial units in city areas is only 1.2, whereas they will be getting a total of 2.7 FSI in the special nod areas located under the new development plan (DP) of SUDA.

Keeping in mind the future development, provisions has been made to construct wider roads. To check the reservations suggested in SUDA DP 2035, a local level consultative committee has been formed under the chairmanship of SUDA president and Municipal Commissioner, M Thennarasan.

About 65 textile mills are operating in the city’s residential areas including Khatodara, Udhna, Ashwani Kumar Road, Ved Road, Bombay Market, Puna Kumbharia etc. In these areas, Particulate Matter (PM10) levels is exceedingly high than the national annual average at 184 per micrograms per cubic meter of air (UG/M3) per annum.

Title: NPCI told to scrap charges on UPI like government’s MDR move
Content:
(Representative image)

BENGALURU: The Indian Bank’s Association (IBA) has written to the National Payments Corporation of India ( NPCI ) to remove charges like interchange fee and switching fee in line with the government move of zero merchant discount rate ( MDR ). TOI has seen a copy of the letter.This could be another serious blow to the growth of digital payments on the Unified Payments Interface (UPI). Removal of these fees would mean another revenue stream getting reduced to nil, which would affect UPI apps, fintech startups and the overall pace of investment and innovation in what is the fastest-growing digital payments network.This comes at a time when UPI has clocked over 1 billion transactions each month from October to December last year (see graphic), with companies like search major Google asking US regulators to follow the model.PhonePe’s co-founder and CEO Sameer Nigam came out strongly on the issue and termed it “most unfortunate but inevitable”. “Zero MDR killed acquiring banks’ revenues so they can’t afford to pay issuers any interchange. Without interchange & PSP fees, issuing banks also have no skin in the game left. Sad day for the entire UPI and RuPay story,” said Nigam, whose Bengaluru-based company launched its payments business starting with UPI in 2016 and has clocked over 5 billion transactions till December.During the IBA meeting when this decision was made and the letter drafted out, SBI was among the key players pushing for the move, people aware of the matter said. If accepted, the proposal would be beneficial for banks who are looking to reduce costs incurred because of the fast growth of these applications.Public sector banks like SBI, which has a 5-crore customer base, have been resisting increasing interchange and switching fee as they will be paying more to other banks when their customers use their ATMs/PoS machines/UPI apps. For seven years, the interchange fee has remained at Rs 15.“There is a loss per transaction banks face. This move will reduce that,” another source said. “IBA managing committee has decided that with respect to zero MDR on RuPay Card and UPI transactions, zero interchange is acceptable to banking industry and NPCI should be requested to consider zero interchange, zero switching fee, and zero-fee for PSPs (payments service providers) while implementing the government mandate,” the letter sent to NPCI on Thursday said.Emailed queries sent to NPCI and SBI did not elicit any response on the matter.Multiple payments industry executives said this would cause further damage to the industry already reeling under the pressure of zero MDR.As reported on January 10, payment players anticipate annual revenue loss could be to the tune of Rs 1,800 crore and about 2.5 lakh jobs would be impacted owing to zero MDR. Even though the Union Budget is slated to be tabled on February 1, hopes of relief from the government are low, sources added.Companies like PhonePe and Google Pay have spent serious money to popularise UPI, which has reached a sizable scale now. Last year, PhonePe was on a Rs 500-crore marketing spree to expand its acceptance among consumer and merchants, while Google Pay spent over Rs 1,000 crore in cashbacks for the financial year ending March 2019. “All the work done by UPI so far will go back to zero. This intervention is not needed and it’s a step back. Consumer companies will go back to the new non-KYC wallet that allows Rs 10,000 monthly transaction limit. The government should reimburse these fees if they want to do away with these charges,” said a senior payments sector executive.

Title: Sequoia’s startup bet intact, to raise record $1.3 billion for new India fund
Content:
(Representative image)

BENGALURU: Top Silicon Valley investor Sequoia is planning to raise about $1.25 billion for its new fund for India. This will be a record corpus raised for the country, underlining the growing maturity of the Indian startup ecosystem, said two sources familiar with the development. Sequoia is known as the early backer of companies like WhatsApp and Google in the US, and Byju’s and Oyo in India.Sequoia Capital India has sounded out its limited partners (LPs), the term for investors in venture capital funds. Sequoia’s LPs include top endowment funds and family offices. The new corpus is 80% larger than the $695 million the firm raised for its sixth fund in 2018. Till now, the largest venture fund raised for India was $920 million, also by Sequoia back in early 2016.Sequoia will also, for the first time, split the corpus into two vehicles — one for early stage and other for the growth stage. The move comes as Sequoia is holding the annual global meeting of its LPs in India for the first time at the end of March as the country has become a lucrative market in terms of returns as well for the firm.Till now, these meetings have been held in larger markets like the US and China. “The roadshows will happen after the global LP meet and the fund will most likely be closed during the second half of the year,” said one of the sources mentioned earlier.While $750-800 million is expected to be raised for the growth fund, $450-500 million will be raised for the early stage fund, according to one of the sources. These funds will also continue to invest in Southeast Asia, which the firm started in 2014 after setting up a Singapore office. When contacted, a Sequoia Capital India spokesperson declined to comment.“Sequoia India’s fourth has been a turning point as it has several portfolio companies which have already given cash returns,” said another person briefed on the fund-raise. Raised in 2014, Sequoia’s fourth fund got $500 million from hospitality major Oyo and another $185 million from ed-tech unicorn Byju’s through a partial exit over the last 18 months. Some of the other prominent portfolio companies from that fund include the biggest internet players in Southeast Asia, like Indonesian ride-hailing major Go-Jek (valued at $10 billion) and online marketplace Tokopedia (valued at over $7 billion).Sequoia also beefed up its top team last year by roping in former Google’s India and Southeast Asia head Rajan Anandan, and then Uber’s Asia head Amit Jain. These additions were done after three MDs left Sequoia to form a firm — A91 Partners — which raised $351 million last year. “Sequoia now has a stable partnership with the next rung being given a lot of leeway to spread their wings, which is a good sign,” said a venture capital investor who did not wish to be named. Other MDs at Sequoia are Shailendra Singh, Mohit Bhatnagar, G V Ravishankar, Shailesh Lakhani, Abheek Anand and Piyush Gupta.The new record corpus comes at a time when there is a slowdown expected in the venture funding market as investors tell startups to move away from the growth-at-all-costs mindset. Additionally, companies like WeWork and Uber have seen a significant fall in their valuations after testing public markets.A new large fund by Sequoia in such an environment signals continued long-term bullishness on the Indian startup space, said investors. “One thing Sequoia has done well is that they double down harder when the market is lukewarm, which they have done in India in the past as well. They are comfortable writing larger cheques as well,” said Vinod Murali, MD at venture debt firm Alteria Capital. “It is important for India that Sequoia goes and raises a large fund because there is a natural cascading effect for other smaller venture capital funds as well.”

Title: Notorious history-sheeter shot dead in Navsari
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Wasim Billa Gulam Shaikh

SURAT: Four unidentified assailants shot dead a history-sheeter from the city in Navsari on Wednesday night. Deceased Wasim Billa Gulam Shaikh, who had been debarred by Gujarat high court from entering Surat city due to his criminal activities, was living in Navsari for the past few months. Police suspect it to be a case of contract killing executed by professional shooters.

Shaikh left a gymnasium at around 10.15pm and was shot dead the moment he sat in his car by the assailants who fired multiple times at him. He was shifted to a private hospital where he died during treatment. He had received at least four bullet injuries on vital body parts, police said. Firoz Gulam Shaikh, brother of the deceased, lodged a complaint in this connection at Navsari rural police station on Thursday.

Family and friends have named a few suspects whom police were questioning. They alleged that Shaikh had enmity with a few businessmen in the city due to which he was facing criminal complaints. Shaikh’s family suspects any one of these businessmen could be involved in his murder.

Police suspect attackers had specific information about the deceased’s movement, including his routine of visit the gymnasium. Police are checking CCTV footages of the area to find out if the attackers were caught on camera anywhere and if they had carried out a recce before attacking Shaikh.

Police recovered a motorcycle from Kanai Khadi on Vedchha Road which they suspect was used by the assailants. Four shooters had come on two motorcycles but police don’t have exact information about the route they took to escape. “Vehicle number plate and chassis number of the motorcycle have been tampered with. Thus, we believe that this motorcycle had been used in the crime. We have no CCTV footages as yet in which the attack has been captured. There are no eyewitness to murder either,” a police officer said.

“Police suspect Shaikh didn’t know the attackers and hence allowed them to come close. He was shot from close range on vital body parts to ensure that he died,” the police officer added.

The high court had barred Shaikh from entering the city due to criminal cases against him. He was living in Rangoon Nagar in Navsari, police said.

Shaikh was prime accused in threatening and attacking a couple of businessmen in the city. He had threatened them for share in land deals. Shaikh was a local hoodlum when one of the businessmen roped him to keep troublemakers away during development on a disputed land. Later Shaikh became a gang leader and started to demand his share from the businessman.

Title: Three five-star hotels in Patna soon: Minister Krishna Kumar Rishi
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Bihar tourism minister Krishna Kumar Rishi

PATNA: State tourism minister Krishna Kumar Rishi on Thursday said three five-star hotels would be developed in the state capital soon. He said model toilets and restrooms for tourists would also come up on the highways in the state.

Addressing mediapersons at BJP office here as part of the party’s ‘sahyog karyakram’, the minister said Hotel Patliputra Ashok and Sultan Palace will be developed into five-star hotels, while the third such hotel will come up near Kangan Ghat in Patna City. He said the bidding process for these hotels, which will be developed in public-private partnership (PPP) mode, has already started.

Rishi said the number of tourists vising the state did not drop even after enforcement of total prohibition. “At least 2.95 crore tourists, including foreigners, visited Bihar in 2016 and the number went up to 3.34 crore in 2017 and 3.47 crore in 2018. In 2019, 1.76 crore people visited the state till September,” the minister said.

Title: 45th Shodh Yatra returns to Ahmedabad
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

AHMEDABAD: The 45th Shodh Yatra , a journey on foot by like-minded individuals in search of indigenous knowledge, creativity and innovations at the grassroots in remote corners of the country returned to Ahmedabad recently.

The ‘yatra’ is organized by Society for Research and Initiatives for Sustainable Technologies and Institutions (SRISTI). It returned with remarkable examples of innovative teachers, pest control ideas and agriculture methods. This time, the Shodh Yatra travelled to 20 villages in the district of Chamba in Himachal Pradesh and was led by visiting professor at IIM-Ahmedabad, Dr Anil Gupta.

During the Chamba visit, the team came across villages which prevented the deadly foot-and-mouth disease by an indigenous method of spraying a special powder made of crushed sugar and tobacco into used human footwear and then bandaging the same around a bovine’s hooves. The insects, according to the villagers, got attracted to the sugar, while the tobacco acted as a pesticide. Another fascinating instance was a series of transparent water pouches that were hung from beam of shops by grocers. This warded off mosquitoes because of the reflection in the water pouches. In fact, Gupta explains, the mosquitoes saw a magnified version of themselves and kept away.

Other than these, the yatris met people who inspired them. One such example being Pawan Kumar, a teacher at Government Primary School in Singa. When he had joined the school he found there was only one chair for three teachers. That day he decided to give up his one-year salary towards school improvement. Soon people got inspired and did the same, and within an year the school became a smart school.

Title: After Park Circus, more Shaheen Baghs come up across Kolkata and Howrah
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

The protests at Park Circus Maidan since the beginning of the month have spawned several demonstrations in other pockets of Kolkata in the past few days. Organizers say localized protests are helping them draw supporters and connect with fence-sitters. TOI visited the other Shaheen Baghs that have recently come up across the city

Zakaria Street

Protest started | January 10

Crowd count | More than 2,000 people observed a day-long fast on January 22, the day the petitions on CAA came up for hearing in the Supreme Court, and broke bread at the spot in the evening. Since then, thousands have been thronging the site right in front of Nakhoda Mosque every day to protest against CAA and NRC. A separate enclosure has been set up where women are keeping a vigil round the clock. Several activists have also delivered speeches here to make the people aware of how CAA discriminates on the basis of religion.

SN Banerjee Road

Protest started | January 21

Crowd count | More than 2,500 people assembled here on January 21, a day before the petitions came up for hearing in the Supreme Court. The demonstration in the heart of the city has picked up momentum in the past two days with more and more joining in. Students are keeping the energy up with slogans against policies of the BJP government. Seniors at the protest, however, have cautioned the youngsters against blocking vehicles or stepping out of the area cordoned off for the protesters. “We have invited several intellectuals and members of the civil society who will be addressing the protesters soon,” said one of the organizers.

Nawab Ali Park in Ekbalpore

Protest started | January 18

Crowd count | More than 1,000 people broke bread here after a day-long fast on January 22. Several local residents were visiting Park Circus Maidan every day when a group decided to organize a sit-in right here. “Firstly, several people from the Port area were not being able to commute so far every day. Secondly, we can connect with more people if we decentralize and start a movement in each of our neighbourhoods. Of course, if there is a bigger programme, all of us can join hands,” said one of the organizers.

Howrah Pilkhana

Protest started | January 17

Crowd count | Everyday, hundreds of women and children visit the protest venue off GT Road in Pilkhana. And every evening, students from local colleges visit the place and raise slogans against CAA and NRC and perform street plays. “People bring food for us. Students bring sweets for the children and also help us write posters. We are overwhelmed by the support we are receiving from people of all faiths,” said Shama Khatoon, a homemaker in Pilkhana.

Title: Tamil Nadu: DVAC submits inquiry report against S P Velumani
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

S P Velumani

CHENNAI: The directorate of vigilance and anti-corruption ( DVAC ) of Tamil Nadu on Thursday submitted in the Madras high court a preliminary inquiry report against state municipal administration minister S P Velumani , as directed by a division bench earlier.

It was submitted to the bench of Justice M Sathyanarayanan and Justice R Hemalatha in a sealed cover. It was done in compliance with an interim order on the petitions filed by Arappor Iyakkam, an NGO, and R S Bharathi, organising secretary of DMK, on January 7.

The petitions were filed alleging corruption in awarding contracts for various corporations by Velumani and showing favoritism to his relatives and people very close to him.

Title: Traffic diversions in place for Mauni Amavasya snan today
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Varanasi: In view of heavy inflow of pilgrims coming from Prayagraj for Mauni Amavasya snan on Friday, traffic restrictions were imposed on roads leading to ghats along the Ganga in the city.

SP (traffic) Shrawan Kumar Singh said as per the tradition pilgrims attending Magh Mela at Prayagraj throng the city on the occasion of Mauni Amawasya at large scale for bathing in Ganga. In view of the possibility of their arrival in huge number the route diversions will remain imposed on the roads in and around the city.

Points for parking the vehicles coming with pilgrims from Prayagraj have also been demarcated in city outskirts. Vehicles heading to Dashaswamedh Ghat from different city road will be diverted on other roads from Maidagin, Luxa, Beniabagh and Sonarpura. Vehicles heading towards Lanka from Cantt railway station will be diverted to Mahmoorganj to reach their destination via Kakarmatta.

Vehicles heading towards Bhaisasur Ghat and Rajghat will be diverted from Bhadauchungi, Visheshwarganj and Padao. Entry of heavy vehicles in city from highways will remain completely banned. Parking arrangements for the vehicles of officers of district administration, police, forces will be done at Company Bagh, Townhall, Sanatan Dharm Inter College. In case of access load of vehicles campuses of Government Queens College and Sampurnanand Sanskrit University will also be opened for parking.

For the parking of vehicles of pilgrims entering the city after coming from Prayagraj via Amra-Akhri, Naria and Malviya crossing Lanka arrangements have been made in Ravindrapuri area. Buses and big vehicles will be stopped at Jagatpur for parking. Rajghat Balumandi will be parking site for vehicles entering the city via Padao.

Title: Gujarat: Canteen staff crushes potatoes with feet, medical college issues notice to contractor
Content:
A video went viral showing a canteen employee crushing potatoes with his feet

AHMEDABAD: The authorities of Gmers Medical College and Civil Hospital, Sola, have issued a show-cause notice to the canteen management for termination of contract after a video went viral on Wednesday showing a canteen employee crushing potatoes with his feet.However, the contractor has claimed it was an old video, and the video was of mud being removed from sub-standard potatoes before being fed to cows.The college authorities have also begun an inquiry against the contractor and asked the contractor to vacate the premises within three days, said Dr Nitin Vora, the dean of Sola Medical college .“We have issued show-cause notice to the contractor and asked for the clarification in next three days. Also an inquiry will be conducted by a three-member panel,” Dr Vora said.He said that no student has in the past complained of the quality of the food. Mainly first-year students eat in the canteen. In the past, the contractor demanded that the college should make it compulsory for all students to eat in the canteen, but the college had refused and said they cannot force any student to do so, and that he should improve his quality of food.The contractor, Praful Suvala, who claims to be managing the canteen with one Chandrakanth claimed that the concerned video had been circulated in a move to defame him. “Some students in the institute are against us and hence raw potatoes which were being cleaned were projected as boiled potatoes. We are in the business for seven years and no untoward incident has been reported,” he claimed.A first-year student claimed that the quality of the food was pathetic and since he has got himself registered he would continue till the present contract. The food sometimes stinks, and often stale, he said.Another student claimed that he has already contacted a tiffin service to deliver tiffin as he didn’t like the taste or quality of the canteen food. “The contractor used too much oil and if we complained he did not listen,” said the student.Similarly, a third-year student too claimed the food quality was not good. “Many a time I left a meal mid-way due to poor quality. If we complained he (the contractor) did not bother to listen,” he said.In Video: On cam: Medical college canteen staff cleaning potatoes with feet in Gujarat

Title: Aurangabad: Cake for smart bus service anniversary attracts fine
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

A cake designed in shape of the city bus was ordered from the Cantonment-based Lalsa Bhai cakemaker by the AMC... Read More

AURANGABAD: The Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) on Thursday celebrated the first anniversary of the smart city bus service with pomp and show at ZP Ground in Aurangapura. However, on finding out that the celebratory cake for the event was brought covered in plastic, municipal commissioner Astik Kumar Pandey imposed a penalty of Rs 500 on the cakemaker.

The smart city bus service was launched in the city on January 23, 2019, under the Smart City project. Under the service, a set of 100 buses were ordered from Tata Motors. The Aurangabad Smart City Development Corporation Ltd (ASCDCL), the special purpose vehicle formed for the implementation of the Smart City project, signed an MoU with the Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC). As per the MoU, the MSRTC is providing drivers and conductors to run the service. Over the past year, 58.86 lakh citizens have travelled by the city buses. The ASCDCL has also awarded the contract for the construction of 150 bus shelters.

In an elaborate ceremony held at the Aurangapura ZP Ground, the anniversary of the service was celebrated in the presence of mayor Nandkumar Ghodele, MP Imtiaz Jaleel, municipal commissioner and ASCDCL CEO Astik Kumar Pandey, corporators and school students. Prashant Bhusari, the chief operations manager of smart city bus service, was present too. The guests released colourful balloons in the air to mark the anniversary.

A cake designed in shape of the city bus was ordered from the Cantonment-based Lalsa Bhai cakemaker by the AMC for the event. However, the cakemaker had used plastic to cover the cake. This did not go down well with the municipal commissioner, who immediately asked the solid waste management department to penalise the cakemaker for violating the plastic ban. The cakemaker was fined for Rs 500 and a spot fine receipt was issued.

This is not the first instance of Pandey fining for plastic use. Earlier, he had fined one of his officials, one of the corporators and a person greeting the chief minister for using plastic products.

Title: Delhi: Wife held for helping lover, friends kill man
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: A 29-year-old woman, who wanted to settle down with her lover, roped in her friends to get her husband murdered. The man was found dead in Shahbad Dairy recently. Leaving her kids and husband, Meenu (name changed) was living with her husband’s friend Ajay for the past one and a half years. She claimed that her husband was trying to win her back emotionally for the sake of the children, so she decided to eliminate him. Meenu’s friends strangled her husband in a car after asking him to join a party.

The three accused men—Ajay (27), Suresh (30) and Sonu (25)—knew the victim, Satyanarayan, as they all belonged to Satna in Madhya Pradesh . They were arrested from their village and brought to Delhi on Wednesday. Based on the revelation by them, the victim’s wife was nabbed on Thursday. All the accused have been sent to four-day police custody.

Title: Court paper reveals ex-assistant threatened Robert De Niro to expose his 'darkest secrets'
Content: Newly filed court papers have revealed that Robert De Niro was threatened by his former assistant with a memoir that she would publish exposing the actor 's darkest secrets.According to a report, the actor's legal team stated that ex-employee Chase Graham Robinson , who filed a lawsuit last year for 12 million dollars on the grounds of gender discrimination, wrote an e-mail to De Niro indicating that she would expose him through a tell-all memoir.The court papers said that the e-mail Robinson sent in August 2019, "contained a suggestion that if Plaintiff's demands were not met, she may have to write a memoir containing information of a personal nature about De Niro".The papers that were filed recently in the Manhattan federal court, do not mention anything about the probable contents of the memoir.The 37-year old assistant blamed the actor for verbal abuse, inappropriate touching, passing lewd remarks and cracking vulgar jokes during the years she held her position.As a response, De Niro also filed a 3 million dollar lawsuit against Robinson in 2019, alleging that she used to "loaf around," binge-watch TV on work and steal.

Title: 17-year-old Mohali boy shoots himself dead
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

A man points to a passage leading to washroom where Hardutt Singh shot himself in Mohali on Thursday

MOHALI: A 17-year-old boy committed suicide by shooting himself with his father’s pistol at his house in Phase X, here, on Thursday afternoon. Hardutt Singh, a Class XII student of St John’s High School , Sector 26, Chandigarh, was reportedly depressed.

According to the police officials, Hardutt took the step around 3pm after returning from his tuition. “Hardutt and his younger brother, Ekjeet, were alone at home. My wife, Puneet, had gone to pick up my 13-year-old youngest son from school when Hardutt committed suicide,” said Harjinder Singh, Hardutt’s father who is a farmer and also a property dealer.

Harjinder said, “Ekjeet thought there was a geyser blast. When he rushed to the washroom, he saw his brother in a pool of blood.” When Ekjeet was about to call him, Puneet, the stepmother, returned and they called him up. Hardutt was to turn 18 this April.

Officials said Hardutt went to the washroom with his father’s suitcase that had a licensed .32 bore pistol.

Phase XI SHO inspector Kulvir Kang said, “Hardutt had been under depression after his mother passed away in 2005. His body has been kept at Phase VI civil hospital. The post-mortem will be conducted on Friday. No suicide note was recovered from the spot.”

Title: Chennai: Ragpicker sleeping under bus run over
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A 65-year-old ragpicker was crushed to death by a private bus off Poonamallee bypass service road on Wednesday. The deceased man, yet to be identified, was sleeping under the parked bus, which had remained at the spot for a couple of days following an engine fault.

Bus driver M Govindaraj, 33, of Pallipattu in Tiruvallur district , failed to notice the man sleeping under the vehicle and the rear wheels ran over the man’s head crushing him to death on the spot. Soon after the cries of the victim, fellow bus drivers told police that they tried to stop the vehicle by alerting the driver. But, he didn’t notice it and stopped the vehicle only after running over the elderly man.

During inquiries, vendors and traders told police that they have spotted the elderly man picking rags in the neighbourhood. Based on the complaint of V Mohan, 44, a driver of a bus company who witnessed the incident, the Poonamallee traffic police rushed to the spot. They retrieved the victim’s body and sent it to the Kilpauk Medical College and Hospital for autopsy. They registered a case under IPC Sections 304 (A) (death caused due to negligent driving) and 279 (Rash and negligent driving) and arrested Govindaraj. A magistrate court sent him to jail.

Title: Gabhiye dedicates hearse van, ambulance to public
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: NCP MLC Prakash Gajbhiye provided a hearse van and ambulance for the city from his funds. Home minister Anil Deshmukh, guardian minister Nitin Raut, sports and youth welfare minister Sunil Kedar dedicated the two most useful vehicles for the public at Deshpande Hall on Saturday.

West Nagpur MLA Vikas Thakre, Umrer MLA Raju Parwe, MLC Jogendra Kawade, collector Ravindra Thakre, Zilla Parishad president Rashmi Barwe, vice-president Manohar Kumbhare, additional municipal commissioner Ram Joshi and others were present.

Deshmukh and Raut praised Gajbhiye for facilitating hearse van and ambulance for the city. “Gajbhiye has saved several slums across the city. He also took efforts for providing basic amenities to slum-dwellers and poor people. He knew requirements of the city and acted accordingly,” they said.

Gajbhiye is known as mass leader among slums in the city. Hearse van and ambulances will be provided for slum-dwellers and poor people.

Title: Telangana: Contractors fill own coffers in the name of sand societies
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Sand mining in Eturu on the banks of Godavari river.

HYDERABAD: Contractors, infra companies and politicians seem to be filling their own coffers from sand mining in the name of tribal sand societies in Telangana . For instance, in Mulugu district, which has around 60 tribal sand societies, sand mining works are being given to sub-contractors in almost all cases. As per government rules, rights to sand quarrying have to be exclusively given to tribals in tribal areas.

In Eturu, despite legal notices being served to offenders and complaints being lodged against irregularities , both collector and cooperative society have turned a blind eye to the problem.

Moreover, it is learnt that the district cooperative society has failed to maintain audits of sand societies and except for one or two, none of the societies have filed financial statements.

In the case of Samakka of Eturu Grama Prajala Isuka Quarry Labour Contract Cooperative Society, it was found that there was no elected committee when the sand mining license was issued.

On March 10, 2015, G Samaiah, a Koya tribal of Kamalapur in Mangapet mandal of Warangal district had sent a notice to the collector and Telangana State Mineral Development Corporation Limited (TSMDC) on irregularities in sand mining, however, no action was taken by authorities.

“The excavation of sand in Godavari river has become a business in the hands of persons with money and muscle power. They are saying that because adivasis do not have machinery, the licence was granted to the contractors, but as per river conservation rules, no machine can be used in the excavation of sand from rivers. AP Panchayat Raj Act 1998 says that mine license has to be granted to tribals only. Eturu Grama Prajala Isuka Quarry Labour Contract Cooperative Society Limited had no committee when the license was granted in February 2015. They said that a meeting of society members took place in the collector’s chamber, but it is impossible to accommodate hundreds of society members in the chamber,” the complainant alleged, adding that environmental and forest clearances were not obtained in many cases. “In the name of the welfare of tribals, mining mafia is destroying forests and rivers,” he said.

Furthermore, the cooperative society had served a legal notice to Sri Sai Constructions on October 25 in 2015 in which it alleged that it had given a contract to the company for loading, excavation and transportation of sand, but that the Integrated Tribal Development Agency (ITDA) ‘is recognising unauthorised persons of Sri Nidhi Construction for the purpose of raising contract.’

A petition was filed in 2018 with Jayashankar-Bhulapalli district officials regarding Sri Saralamma Tribal Isuka Moram Quarry Labour Contract Cooperative Society. The petitioner alleged that for more than two years, sand was being mined without the consent of the members and that the work was given to construction companies.

Madhu Babu, a tribal from Kanthanapally alleged that a former TRS leader’s son was actively involved in sand mining in the area. “There is too much competition among sub-contractors. Each politician ropes in his own sub-contractor. We don’t have machinery so we depend on contractors,” he said.

“The societies are supposed to submit annual reports. Except for one society, none of them have submitted the report. We have inspected one Alubaka Mahila Sand Society in Venkatapur and found that they are not submitting financial statements. No general body meeting was conducted. As the tribals are not educated, it is difficult,” Mulugu district cooperative officer C Nagar Narayana told TOI.

Title: Pre-histroic murals claimed to have been found in Almora
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

The murals have been spotted in Pattharkhola village

ALMORA: Pre-historic murals have been claimed to have been found in Pattharkhola village of Almora .

Lalit Joshi, teacher at the SSJ College, who found the murals a few days ago, claimed that “the murals painted in a saffron colour corresponded exactly to the murals of Lakhudiyar, a famous prehistoric site near Petsal village of Almora.”

“I got to know of these rocks, which have small holes init, from the local residents. I had read about some rocks with cup marks whichwere earlier used in various rituals. I then made up my mind to visit the area,”he said.

At the village, Joshi says he also spotted several paintings of what looked like a group of people.

“These paintings are very similar to the ones in Lakhudiyar,” hesaid.

As the word spread of the presence of the murals, a team of the state archaeology department visited the site on Tuesday and studied the paintings.

Chandra Singh Chouhan of the archaeology department based in Almora, told TOI, “Though the murals look similar to the ones in Lakhudiyar, we will submit a report in the matter soon after conducting carbon dating and other related researches. Without that, we won’tbe able to say much about the period that the murals belong to.”

Title: Chandigarh: Bell rung, make way for bicycle-sharing
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Delhi-based Smart Bike will station 5,000 pedal sets at 617 docks

CHANDIGARH: Bicycle-sharing will start here in two months. Delhi-based Smart Bike will station 5,000 pedal sets at 617 docks and pay Chandigarh Smart City Limited (CSCL) Rs 12 lakh a year, which was the highest financial bid opened on Thursday.

The city will not spend even a penny and the company will get limited advertisement rights. A senior UT official said: “Two companies had cleared the technical-bid stage, so the contest came to who could pay the CSCL more. Smart Bike’s rival quoted Rs 6 lakh.”

The authority’s board of directors will meet next week for approving the allotment to Smart Bike. The official said: “The 5,000 bicycles will come in a phased manner, since the company will first have to create its infrastructure. It’ll take 18 months for the full service to begin, although the first phase will start in two months.”

After failing thrice to start bicycle-sharing, the UT administration had relaxed the project rules and floated a new tender. The official said: “The relaxed rules allow for hybrid bicycles that can be switched from pedal to electrical mode. The earlier rules permitted only 25% bicycles to be power-assisted. Now, the city has also been divided into four zones to help the successful bidder lay its infrastructure.”

The earnest money was reduced from Rs 30 lakh to Rs 5 lakh to attract more bidders.

Title: Madhya Pradesh: Minister hurls ‘Shakuni Mama’ & Kaurava barbs at BJP
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

BHOPAL: The political storm over former BJP minister Badrilal Yadav’s offensive remark against the Rajgarh collector took an ‘epic’ turn on Thursday when minister P C Sharma compared CM Kamal Nath with Lord Krishna and BJP leaders to ‘Shakuni Mama’ and the Kauravas from The Mahabharata.

BJP took strong exception to this, and suggested that Nath send his cabinet ministers for courses in meditation

On Wednesday, in the aftermath of Yadav’s comment, Congress spokesman Durgesh Sharma had likened BJP to the Kauravas. Law minister P C Sharma continued with the Mahabharata theme to corner BJP on Thursday.

“The offensive language and the kind of words used against a woman bureaucrat are very unfortunate and highly condemnable,” Sharma told mediapersons on Thursday morning, adding: “The incident occurred in the presence of Shakuni Mama and it was only after indication from Duryodhana that Dushasana went ahead with the ‘chirharan’.”

Top state BJP leaders — including former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan, state party president Rakesh Singh and LOP Gopal Bhargava — were on the dais when Yadav made the remark in Biaora on Wednesday. Sharma didn’t specify who he meant by Shakuni Mama, Duryodhana and Dushasana. “This country respects women and worships Durga, Saraswati and Laxmi,” he said.

On BJP general secretary Kailash Vijayvargiya’s comment that the “virus of JNU has reached Madhya Pradesh”, Sharma said: “There is no virus of JNU here. Rather, it is the virus of Rani Laxmibai and Indira Gandhi. And if women officers face any difficulty while maintaining law and order in the state, then chief minister Kamal Nath will stand behind them like Lord Krishna.”

BJP reacted strongly to Sharma’s ‘Shakuni Mama’ and ‘Kaurava’ barbs. State BJP spokesman Rajneesh Agarwal said, “Chief minister Kamal Nath should send his cabinet ministers for a course in Vipassana meditation to get rid of their mental disturbances. Every other day, the state government’s ministers give statements that spark a controversy — be it Jitu Patwari in Dewas, Kamleshwar Patel in Rewa or P C Sharma in Harda earlier this week. Ministers are not doing their work, but creating controversies with their meaningless statements.”

On Wednesday, Durgesh Sharma had used the same metaphor of the Mahabharata, comparing BJP to Kauravas. “On Indian soil, even the arrogance of Kauravas was crushed. Kauravas had made the same mistake that the BJP leadership is making,” he had said.

Title: Two cops suspended on bribe charges
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Varanasi: A head constable and a constable of Lanka police station were suspended on bribe charges for allowing entry to two trucks on Dhapi road where movement of heavy vehicles is prohibited.

Two more junior policemen of Kapsethi and Dashaswamedh police station were suspended on laxity and indiscipline charges. SSP Prabhakar Chawdhary issued suspension orders against these cops on Wednesday night. Head constable Dhananjay Mishra and constable Ashutosh Rai of Lanka police station came on officials radar after they allowed two truck drivers to enter Dhaphi road despite knowing that heavy vehicles were prohibited on the route. One driver from Azamgarh district also lodged an FIR against the duo.

Title: Telangana govt finds ‘remedy’ for Ramappa temple vastu dosha
Content:
Eastern side of the Ramappa Temple.

HYDERABAD: The state government, which is vying for the prestigious Unesco World Heritage Site tag for the centuries-old Ramappa Temple in Mulugu district, has come out with a ‘remedy’ for vastu dosha (flaws in the elements) in the temple.The temple’s main priest, who had reported the matter, had said that the temple has serious vastu flaws as devotees and tourists enter from the western gate, when they are actually supposed to enter from the easter side.“Devotees enter from behind Lord Sivalinga in sanctum sanctorum of the temple even though the entry should be from the east as per the shastra. The temple was built in 1213 and is more than 800 years old. For the past 50 years, people have been walking in from the western gate. This is against vastu. Soma Sutra Pradakshinam is a way of circumambulating Sivalinga. People are crossing Soma Sutra from behind while entering the temple. This is not good,” temple priest Umashankar told TOI.He said that a representation was submitted to Mulugu district collector Narayana Reddy stating that the temple’s growth and international recognition are being delayed due to vastu dosha. “We suggested that if the entry is from the east, the temple will have a bright future ahead,” he added.District authorities and MLC P Srinivas Reddy have sanctioned an 80 feet road connecting the main road to the temple, and the work has almost been completed. The contractor of the road works told TOI that the road would be open to public and entry to the temple would be allowed during Medaram Jatara in February first week. “Kameswara temple located on the right side was dismantled, and the Archeological Survey of India (ASI) is trying to rebuild it. It must be rebuilt quickly,” Umashankar said.

Title: Row over Ahmedabad civic body's suction machines contract
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

AHMEDABAD: The leader of opposition Dinesh Sharma has raised doubts over the decision of the AMC to award the contract for super-suction machine to the old contractor despite the fact that a new contractor has quoted a price of Rs 2,200 less per shift.

Sharma said earlier this month the water supply and sewerage committee rejected the proposal of the official wing to award the contract to one Accord Watertech and Infrastructure (AWI). The company had quoted a price of around Rs 10,000 per shift which was 2,200 less than the tender price.

Sharma claimed the panel, instead of clearing the proposal of AWI, decided to continue with the contract of Hitesh Associates. He said the earlier contract of Hitesh Associates had ended on July 30, 2018. “Now when the new tender is invited, the committee still wants to continue with the old tender and wants to float a new tender afresh,” he said.

Title: Chandigarh: Wife, kids found murdered, man near railway tracks
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Society in Modern Housing Complex, Manimajra, where Aroras lived on the ground floor

Title: Relatives of deceased patient wreck GMCH medicine ward
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

When doctors declared the patient dead, a mob, posing as relatives, turned violent and damaged the glass doors... Read More

AURANGABAD: Second time in just 10 days, relatives of a patient vandalised the medicine ward of the Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH) on Thursday after the patient died while undergoing treatment in the afternoon.

According to GMCH sources, the patient had a heart-related ailment and was referred to the state-run hospital from a private hospital. Doctors said the patient was being treated at the Intensive Coronary Care Unit . However, the case turned critical on Thursday.

When the doctors declared the patient dead at 4.30 pm, a mob, posing as relatives, turned violent and damaged the glass doors on the ground floor of the medicine building, the GMCH administration said. The relatives also verbally abused the on-duty resident doctors, holding them responsible for the patient’s death.

Earlier, on January 13, a mob of 60-70 people had damaged the doors and windows of the same medicine ward after a patient had died. One guard was physically assaulted. Subsequently, a case was lodged at the Beghumpura police station.

When asked about measures taken to prevent such attacks, in-charge dean of GMCH Kailash Zine said the police is investigating the case lodged in the January 13 incident. “Increasing the security is not the solution as 10 to 15 men suddenly break into the ward, where only a single relative is allowed at a time. We have faith in the police. Following the investigation, lawful action will be taken,” he said.

Beghumpura police said no complaint was registered until late on Thursday. HoD of medicine Meenakshi Bhattacharya condemned the mob attacks.

Title: Cultural events lined up for Ramadasu Jayanthi
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hyderabad: The department of culture is organising birthday celebrations of poet-writer Ramadasu from January 29 to 31 in Khammam. This is part of the efforts to revive Telangana heritage and culture.

The Sri Bhakta Ramadasu Jayanthi Utsavam will be organised at Nelakondapally town where Ramadasu was born. “Prior to the formation of Telangana, these celebrations were totally neglected and the local people used to organise low-key events. Now, we hope to change this to instil pride of their culture among people,” said Hari Krishna, director, department of culture.

Over 1,000 students are expected to chant his kirtanas across town from 8-10am over the three-day period as part of the ‘Nagara Sankeertana Gaanam’. “The jayanthi celebrations will be celebrated every year as a state function. We have already rebuilt the Ramadasu Dhyana Mandiram, where the poet-author lived,” said Hari Krishna, adding, “this time, we are also going to install a 12ft statue.” Cultural programmes including musical competitions and performances have been lined up.

Title: Last nail for secularism, if SC upholds CAA, says Digvijaya Singh
Content:
