This story is from January 24, 2020

Former chief minister Digvijiya Singh with former Union minister Aslam Sher Khan after a press conference in B... Read More

BHOPAL: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh said on Thursday that if CAA is upheld by the Supreme Court as ‘constitutional’, it would be the “last nail in the coffin of secularism”.

Talking to reporters, Singh said that he and former MP and hockey Olympian Aslam Sher Khan would tour the state and create awareness on secularism like Mahatma Gandhi.

“Today, Muslims of this country are frightened and have lost hope in the system as well as the police and political parties. There is one last ray of hope and that is the judiciary. Muslims are keenly watching if the Citizenship Act is rejected or upheld by the apex court. If this Act is accepted as constitutional, it will be the last nail in the coffin of secularism.”

The former chief minister said, “If the Act is upheld, we don’t know what will happen in the country because no one can comprehend the amount of rage it will generate among the people. The protest against CAA-NRC has gone beyond the control of political parties, as they are being organised by students, women and children of minorities.”

Digvijaya Singh said that it is important to restore the faith of minorities, who feel they are being targeted. He said that Hindu, Muslims, Sikhs and Christians had fought for freedom hand-in-hand and have taken India to the road of development.

Aslam Sher Khan said that he will start touring the state to spread the message of communal harmony. “We will travel and talk to those who believe in secularism and Hindu-Muslim unity. We will fight the way Mahatma Gandhi fought for Hindu-Muslim unity. There may be attacks on us but we are not bothered. Sanatani culture should continue as it believes in Ganga-Jamuni sansktiri.” The dates for the tour of the state will be decided soon.

Title: Why hasn’t poll panel rolled out plan for zila parishads, panchayats: Rajasthan High Court
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

JODHPUR: Rajasthan High Court has issued notice to the election commission and the state government seeking reply as to why has the election programme for zila parishads and panchayats not been unrolled yet, despite completion of the five-year term.

The petitioner Bhanwar Singh has prayed for directions to the state government and the election commission for immediate release of the election programme and holding elections as soon as possible. Petitioner’s counsel Moti Singh argued that it was the duty of the state election commission and the state government to announce elections in Panchayati Raj system every five years.

“But in spite of the completion of five years on January 23, no such programme has been announced by the election commission,” argued Singh. The petition stated that the election commission had deferred the election in 3,264 gram panchayats and 412 panchayat samitis an order on January 9, 2020.

The petitioner also prayed for immediate announcement of elections in all these rural entities as well as 33 zila parishads in the state.

“The election commission has no constitutional authority to defer the elections except in the condition of death of any candidate or booth capturing,” argued Singh.

He prayed to the court quashing the orders of the election commission of deferring the election dated January 9 and announce a fresh programme as soon as possible for election in all the panchayat samitis, gram panchayats and zila parishads. Admitting the arguments of the petitioner, the court issued notices to the state government and election commission seeking reply by January 28.

Title: TRS drew inspiration from Netaji Subash Chandra Bose: Telangana minister V Srinivas Goud
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

V Srinivas Goud (Photo: Twitter/@VSrinivasGoud)

HYDERABAD: The TRS drew inspiration from the freedom struggle of Netaji Subash Chandra Bose during the statehood movement, said culture and sports minister V Srinivas Goud . “Netaji founded the Azad Hind Fauj to achieve freedom for India from British rule and during the Telangana movement to achieve a separate state, Subhash Chandra Bose was an inspiration,” said Goud, while addressing a large gathering to mark the 123rd birth anniversary of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose in the city on Thursday. “To fight and achieve what we wanted to, his life was a big inspiration,” added Goud at the event at Rabindra Bharati organised by Jan Urja Manch.

A team from the ‘She Teams’ gave a demonstration on how women and girls can protect themselves against attacks. Students of the martial arts form ‘Kalari Pattu’ gave a demonstration of the art form. Meenakshi Amma, 78-year-old exponent of Kalari Pattu from Kerala performed the martial arts form using a stick. Her team said the real sword that she uses could not be brought along with them as it was not allowed on flight due to a security alert in connection with Republic Day. The programme organisers felicitated culture director Mamidi Harikrishna Reddy on the occasion. A play was staged on the life of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose.

Title: JETRO looks to double number of Japanese companies in Gujarat in five years
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

AHMEDABAD: In a boost to foreign investments in Gujarat, the Japan External Trade Organisation (JETRO) is looking to double the number of Japanese companies present in Gujarat, over the next five years.

This will be undertaken through a fresh wave of investment by Japanese companies in Gujarat. According to state government figures, There are presently more than 100 Japanese companies operating here.

“We are looking at doubling the number of Japanese companies in Gujarat in the next five years. So far, more than 80% of Japanese companies that have invested in Gujarat are in the automobile and auto ancillary sector, while companies from other sectors are fewer. Of these, Suzuki Motor Corporation (SMC) and Honda Motorcycle and Scooters India (HMSI) have made the biggest investments in Gujarat,” said Yasuyuki Murahashi, chief director general, JETRO, New Delhi. He spoke to mediapersons after a seminar on investment opportunities in Gujarat, organized in Ahmedabad by JETRO Ahmedabad on Thursday.

“There is a lot of potential for companies in other sectors such as pharmaceuticals, chemicals and food processing for investing in Gujarat,” said Murahashi.

The seminar was organised with a view to bring more Japanese investments to Gujarat by Japanese companies that are present in India and are looking at expansion. Representatives of eight companies in the automobiles and chemical sectors met state government officials after the seminar and later visited the Sanand Industrial Estate-III at Khoraj, about 25km from Ahmedabad.

“We had fruitful engagement with representatives of 10 companies from Japan in the automobiles, chemicals, textiles and medical devices sectors. While bigger companies are looking at an investment of Rs 800-900 crore, smaller ones are looking at investments in the range of Rs 200-400 crore,” MK Das, principal secretary, industries and mines, told TOI.

State government officials also confirmed that a second round of visits by Japanese companies is expected to take place soon.

Slowdown Effect: Japanese investments in auto sector in low gear

According to top officials of Japan External Trade Organisation (JETRO), investment in the automobile sector has remained slack of late, due to the slowdown in the sector. Speaking to TOI, Yasuyuki Murahashi, chief director general, JETRO, New Delhi, said, “The pace of investment in the automobile sector has fallen due to the slowdown in the sector. However, Japanese investments in India come with a decade-long vision and therefore, as market sentiment revives, there will be a revival, as more projects pick up pace.”

Japanese garden to come up at riverfront

The Sabarmati Riverfront at Ahmedabad could soon have a Japanese garden. Ahmedabad mayor Bijal Patel announced that a few locations in the city have been earmarked for such gardens, while speaking to the press on the sidelines of Kobe-Ahmedabad and Hyogo-Gujarat Economic Cooperation Seminar, organized at Ahmedabad Management Association (AMA) by the Indo-Japan Friendship Association (IJFA), Gujarat, and Japan Information and Study Centre (JISC).

“The project is being undertaken as part of the sister-city agreement between Ahmedabad and Kobe. We will be showing them the land and if everying works out, a Japanese garden may come up at the riverfront,” said Patel.

A 51-member goodwill delegation, led by the mayor of Kobe, Kizo Hisamoto, is currently on a two-day visit to Ahmedabad to explore collaboration on academic, cultural and business fronts. “Talks are under way to work out a collaboration between Gujarat University and Kobe University,” said Mukesh Patel, president, IJFA, Gujarat.

Title: Forest guard, 2 middlemen held for bribe
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Kota: The Anti-Corruption Bureau, Kota Rural, on Thursday arrested a forest guard and two middlemen for allegedly accepting a bribe of Rs 25,000.

The accused forest guard, who is posted at Nayagaun forest checkpost, had demanded Rs 30,000 for not demolishing a house constructed on forest land and had already accepted Rs 5,000 at the time of verification of the complaint in the matter.

“Mahavir Prasad Verma, 54, a resident of Kota city and middlemen Veram Gurjar, 52, of Dharmpura Road and Vijay Gurjar, 30, of Crasher Basti, were arrested for allegedly accepting bribe from Ghanshyam Gurjar,” said Prerna Shekhawat, ASP, ACB, Kota Rural.

Title: Two major dump yards in city to be reclaimed
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Heaps of waste accumulated in two major dumping sites in the city—Palayam and Erumakuzhy—will be removed through bio-mining and bio-remediation. The corporation estimates that over 11,000 cubic metres of unsegregated waste have been piled up at both the sites over the past few years.

The dumping site at Palayam will be cleared as part of Smart City project. The temporary rehabilitation block for vendors and shop owners who have to be shifted for the modernisation of Connemara Market, is being planned at the site which has turned into a dump yard. A total of 484 vendors will have to be shifted to the temporary rehabilitation camp and around 60 vendors will be given permanent space as per the old agreement with Trivandrum Development Authority (TRIDA).

Bio-mining of legacy waste/un-processed municipal solid waste is done by excavation of the non-biodegradable waste by using suitable mechanical sieving machine or any other suitable equipment. It involves segregation and retrieval of recoverable materials and recycling and reclamation of the dumpsite. It is roughly estimated that there could be roughly 9684 cubic metres of legacy waste spread over 40 cents at Palayam.

The corporation’s health wing has recently undertaken a total survey to assess the volume of waste that has to be bio-mined at Erumakuzhy. The survey results showed that 2,388 cubic metres of waste have accumulated at Erumakuzhy. The corporation will now undertake bio-mining of the waste with the help of specialist agencies.

The civic body has decided to do bio-mining of two the dump yards as per rule 15 of the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016. As per the rule, the local body has to investigate and analyse all old open dumpsites and existing operational dumpsites for the potential of bio-mining and bio-remediation and take actions to bio-mine or bio-remediate the sites.

The National Green Tribunal (NGT) had raised alarm that the incremental growth of municipal solid waste dumpsites has resulted in mountains of waste and it had directed the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to propose standard operating procedure (SOP) for bio-mining and bio-remediation of legacy solid waste.

As part of bio-remediation and bio-mining, the dumpsite is excavated and waste is stabilized through bio-remediation. The waste is exposed to air with use of composting bio-cultures. The stabilized waste will be screened to recover all valuable resources like plastic, brick, metals, clothes, rags followed by sustainable management through recycling, co-processing and road-making, according to SOP issued by CPCB.

Bio-mining at Palayam is estimated to cost Rs 94 lakhs. The process will be completed within in three months.

Title: Creditor takes Gurugram realty firm to NCLT
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: The Delhi bench of the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has initiated corporate insolvency resolution proceedings (CIRP) against a Lotus Greens group company , the Gurugram-based Bright Buildtech Pvt Ltd .

An NCLT bench comprising Abni Ranjan Kumar Sinha (member, judicial) and Sumita Purkayastha (member, technical) appointed Naresh Kumar Bhutani as insolvency resolution professional (IRP) on a complaint filed by the operational creditor, Suresh Chand and Sons for non-payment of dues of Rs 1.01 crore.

“It’s the first case of its kind where a real estate company has been dragged into insolvency by operational creditors like real estate agents,” said advocate Piyush Singh, partner at PSP Legal, who represented the real estate agent in this case.

So far, financial creditors like banks or homebuyers would file cases against developers under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code.

Singh said the company was developing a 100-acre township in Gurugram .

The complainant had offered brokerage services to the developer and had raised bills for work that it did in 2015 and 2016. After prolonged negotiation, the operational creditor sent a final bill of Rs 1.01 crore, including a service tax component of Rs 15.56 lakh on April 8, 2019. It moved NCLT when it got no response.

Title: Bizman’s car rental fraud streak ends
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hyderabad: A fraudster was arrested and five cars and a bike was recovered from his possession in Mahbubnagar on Wednesday. CCS police have arrested the accused and produced him before court, which remanded him to judicial custody on Thursday.

The accused was identified as Nanavath Santosh, 21, a businessman from Mahbubnagar. Posing as a travel agency owner, Santosh used to contact people who post ads on OLX website offering to rent their cars.

He took a car of D Prasad on rent by presenting his Aadhaar card photocopy and two blank cheques nine months ago. The accused promised to pay Rs 18,000 monthly to Prasad and paid Rs 5,000 as advance. After taking the car, the accused stopped communication with Prasad and he lodged a complaint with police. During investigation, police found that the accused had duped eight other victims similarly.

Title: Rajasthan: 25 observers appointed for phase III of panchayat polls
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

JAIPUR: The state election commission (SEC) on Thursday released a list of 25 general observers to monitor the third phase of panchayat elections scheduled for January 29.

The chief electoral officer and secretary of the commission, Shyam Singh Rajpurohit, said senior IAS and RAS officials have been appointed observers to monitor the election process.

Among the observers, Ashish Gupta has been appointed in Ajmer, Nishkam Diwakar in Alwar, Bhawani Singh Palawat in Baran and Nakath Dan Barhath in Barmer. Ambarish Kumar has been appointed as observer in Bharatpur, Samit Sharma has been given charge of Bhilwara and Jai Narain Meena has been appointed as Bundi observer.

Mool Chand has been appointed in Chittorgarh, Jameel Ahmed Qureshi in Churu, Avdhesh Singh in Hanumangarh, Krishna Kant Pathak in Jaipur, Arun Kumar Purohit in Jalore, Lok Bandhu in Jhalawar , Ajeet Singh Rajawat in Jhunjhunu, Laxman Singh Kuri in Jodhpur, Virendra Singh in Kota, Peeyush Samariya in Pali and Harsh Sawan Sukha in Pratapgarh.

Omprakash has been appointed as observer in Rajsamand, Aslam Sher Khan in Ganganagar, Maneesh Goyal in Sawai Madhopur, Bhanwar Lal Mehra in Sirohi, Rakesh Rajoria in Tonk and Shivangi Swarnakar in Udaipur.

The state recorded 83% polling at the end of the second phase of panchayati raj elections on Wednesday.

An FIR was lodged by the zonal magistrate after around 50-60 people gheraoed him at the Jajabar polling station in Nainwa, Bundi, and accused him of changing the ballot boxes. “He had come to the polling station with the reserved ballot boxes. They quarrelled with him and also pelted stones. Later, police took control of the situation and the miscreants were chased away. The zonal magistrate has lodged an FIR,” said Nainwa SHO Om Prakash.

Five miscreants were arrested after they set the bus of a polling party on fire outside a polling station in Udaipur’s Rishabhdev on Wednesday. “Five miscreants have been arrested so far. Investigations are on and more will be arrested after the inquiry,” Udaipur collector Anandhi said.

“The situation has been brought under control and the micreants have been arrested. We have also rescued the polling party. There are no injuries and everybody is safe,” she had earlier said.

Title: Rs 4,000 crore wind in Madhya Pradesh’s industry sail at Davos
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

CM Kamal Nath interacts with vice-president (international sales) of Amazon Web Services Max Peterson at Davos... Read More

BHOPAL: Madhya Pradesh scored big on Thursday in its push for investment at Davos by bagging wind energy projects worth Rs 4,000 crore. Chief minister Kamal Nath has been holding back to back talks with global business leaders there to showcase MP’s potential as a business-friendly destination.

“Two central wind projects of 325MW capacity each are now approved. One of them is by Soft Bank Energy of Japan and the other by Actis from England. They will be coming to the state,” said principal secretary, industries, Rajesh Rajora, adding that the twin projects involve a total investment of Rs 4000 crore. Details related to the two projects are yet to be announced, he said.

Earlier in the day in Davos, Dawaat, a food company based in Mandideep got an FDI worth Rs 125 crore from Saudi Arabia Agriculture and Livestock Investment Company (SALIC). A government spokesman said the prevailing atmosphere of faith has started yielding results.

CM Nath met Max Peterson, vice-president (international sales) of Amazon Web Services, and showcased Madhya Pradesh’s potential to have a data centre of AWS. The CM highlighted “low lease rentals and competitive skill adjusted labour cost” in MP, said sources.

Peterson was informed about the low power tariff in MP, with Re 1 per unit rebate, and that nearly 693 acres land was available at nine locations in the state. The state promises to provide up to 75% rebate on cost of land for units established on government land and leased up to 99 years, said sources.

AWS is present in six locations in India — Delhi, Mumbai, Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai — and has data centres in Delhi, Mumbai and Chennai.

“Back-office operations of AWS can be set up in MP as the state is cost-competitive for support functions,” Rajora said. The MP government is already in touch with Vikram Sridharan, general manager, public policy government relations, at AWS India on setting up a data centre in MP.

Nath also had a meeting with Borge Brende, president of World Economic Forum, and L Iswaran, minister of communications and information of Singapore.

Last month, CM Nath had handed over a letter of award to the CEO of Wesley Group Dorian Mulanse for a world class 27-hole golf course-cum-resort to be constructed at a cost of Rs 220 crore in Ninod village near Sanchi.

Title: Prestigious surgical training centre faces closure over funding
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Mumbai: One of the country’s prestigious surgical training centres, the Center of Excellence for Minimal Access Surgery Training ( CeMAST ), in Worli is facing closure.

“Closure is more than a possibility,’’ CeMAST founder Dr Tehemton E Udwadia told TOI on Thursday. “It is facing closure as the German medical equipment company, Karl Storz SE, which has been funding it altruistically, has now changed its philosophy,’’ he added. He said CeMAST officials had received a call on Thursday afternoon, asking them to cancel training programmes scheduled from March.

CeMAST started in 2012 with the backing of Sybill Storz, who was until last year chairperson of Karl Storz SE, and has now retired. The company is one of the world’s leading manufacturers of laparoscopic equipment, and has been providing roughly Rs 16 crore annually to run the centre, said Dr Udwadia. Calls to the company’s Delhi office were unanswered.

CeMAST started in a 4,000 sq ft centre in Mahalaxmi to provide multispecialty minimal access surgery training courses, but it moved five years back to Poonam Chambers in Worli. It offers training across 16 specialities, from gastroenterology to neurosurgery and ENT, and has trained over 8,000 surgeons.

``I set up the centre because the surgeon:population ratio in India is absurdly low. With the implementation of new government schemes, it is important to train more surgeons,’’ said Dr Udwadia.

CeMAST provides tissue-based training on sophisticated machines specially built by Storz for the centre. “Surgeons get to train on animal tissues or entire GI tract or bladders preserved from dead animals,’’ said a surgeon who trained there three years back.

Gastroenterologist Dr Amit Maydeo said it was a pity the centre could close down. “It has fantastic modules and is a great training centre,’’ he said. But, he added, training centres require a lot of funding, equipment as well as manpower.

Dr Jaydeep Palep, a laparoscopic and bariatric surgeon, said the centre was a great resource centre for young surgeons from tier 2 and 3 cities. “Surgeons who come out of college could get hands-on training on high-tech equipment with faculty picked up from across the country,” he said.

Dr Udwadia said the centre had just worked out details of a distance education module to ensure surgeons get knowledge without having to travel to Mumbai. “We manage to make Rs 4 crore a year, but it isn’t enough to run such a training centre,’’ he added.

A doctor, a faculty member, said while some philanthropic groups in India could easily fund such a centre, it would be a shame to reinvent the wheel. “Not only will a new office be needed, new equipment will be needed,’’ he said.

Title: MVA set to scuttle BJP plan to dissolve NIT
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: Change of guard at the state level has led to a complete reversal in urban development policies of the city. Devendra Fadnavis-led government had decided to dissolve Nagpur Improvement Trust (NIT) and make Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) the sole planning authority. However, new guardian minister Nitin Raut is against the decision and wants to strengthen the agency.

Raut had written a letter to chief minister Uddhav Thackeray some days ago urging him to revoke the decision to scrap NIT. He demanded that NIT be made planning authority for 3,800 Gunthewari layouts, which were developed by the agency and have been handed over to the NMC.

Thackeray forwarded the letter to the state urban development department (UDD), which sent letters to NMC and NIT seeking their opinion. NIT told the government that it would abide by whatever decision state government takes.

The demand for dissolving NIT was raised by corporators belonging to all political parties. It was one of the major poll promises of BJP in 2017 NMC elections. NIT was to become Nagpur Metropolitan Region Development Authority (NMRDA) and its jurisdiction would be confined to the Nagpur metro region outside city limits.

The Fadnavis cabinet, on December 27, 2016, decided to dissolve NIT with effect from December 31, 2017. A three-member committee was formed to oversee the dissolution, but the committee did not take any concrete action. On June 13, 2018, the Nagpur bench of Bombay high court stayed the decision. Fadnavis nevertheless went ahead with the dissolution process, albeit slowing down the process.

The state cabinet on August 13 last year approved NIT’s dissolution. The UDD issued a notification on August 27, ending NIT’s powers as planning authority and transferring its schemes, leased out plots and flats to NMC. NMC became planning authority for entire city, including for sanctioning layouts, building plans, regularization of unauthorized plots, amendments in city’s development plan etc. However, final notification was not issued before assembly elections were declared and NIT survived.

According to mayor Sandip Joshi, BJP decided to dissolve NIT as having two planning bodies for a city was an anomaly. “There was tremendous discontent among Nagpurians over working of the NIT. They welcomed our decision to dissolve it,” he said.

Fadnavis had started emasculating NIT long before dissolving it. He made NIT bear NMC’s share of Rs250 crore in the Smart City project and asked it to pay Rs200 crore for two phases of cement road projects and another Rs200 crore for executing works in regularized and unauthorized layouts. Consequently, NIT, which was a cash rich body, has become almost bankrupt.

Even though the BJP government had almost dissolved NIT, there were several grey areas and contradictions. For example, even after cabinet’s decision to scrap NIT, the agency continued to execute several projects like developing multimedia show at Futala Lake. There was no clarity on whether NIT’s assets within the city like the Ambazari swimming pool, Jagnade Square transport plaza etc would remain with NIT or be handed over to the NMC. The issue of NIT staffers had not been resolved.

This move by the state government seems like another effort to throw spanner in the work of the BJP-ruled civic body. As reported by TOI on Thursday, Raut has usurped the Nag-Pili river rejuvenation plan by bringing in a ministerial committee to oversee its implementation. Three Congress ministers and Shiv Sena’s Aditya Thackeray are part of the committee. Two days ago, municipal commissioner Abhjit Bangar was replaced 13 months into his tenure.

INFOGX

TIMELINE

December 27, 2016 | Fadnavis cabinet decides to dissolve NIT by December 31, 2017. Three-member committee formed to oversee process

December 31, 2017 | Committee fails to take any concrete steps and dissolution of NIT postponed

June 13, 2018 | HC stays dissolution of NIT

August 13, 2019 | State cabinet again decides to dissolve NIT

August 27, 2019 | UDD issues preliminary notification dissolving NIT, but final notification not issued

January 2, 2020 | Guardian minister Nitin Raut writes to CM asking him to strengthen NIT and not dissolve it

January 10, 2020 | UDD seeks NMC, NIT opinion on Raut’s proposal

Title: Footpath encroachers to be evicted soon
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The town planning standing committee, which has begun issuing notices over parking violations at major commercial complexes and institutions, has directed the engineering wing to remove all encroachments, mostly belonging to street vendors, on footpaths.

The previous council meeting had approved the town planning standing committee’s proposal to release funds to remove unauthorised structures jutting onto the footpath and roads.

The street vendors who have occupied RKV road, the stretch between Museum police station and Kanaka Nagar, will also be rehabilitated as part of opening up space for implementing a project under the smart city scheme. As part of the scheme, vending zones would be established on RKV road at a cost of Rs 2.7 crore.

The problem posed by street vendors had led to a heated debate in the council with various councillors and mayor K Sreekumar admitting the existence of a network, which helps the street vendors operate unauthorizedly in the city.

Sreekumar has said that individuals owning multiple bunks run the businesses making use of local and migrant labourers.

BJP councillor Karamana Ajith has alleged that one of the persons who has been allotted street vending space, rents out shops and commercial spaces in the city and that eligible beneficiaries were being denied opportunities.

The town planning wing had earlier completed compilation of data on road and footpath encroachers, parking violations and unauthorised constructions in the city.

Major violations regarding encroachment of footpaths were found in locations coming under Fort, Ulloor and Kadakampally areas. Nearly 150 violations have been found in these areas. Footpath encroachments have been also reported from Pettah, Perunthanni, Chalai and Fort areas.

Title: Table NIT dissolution report in NMC first: Mayor Joshi
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: Mayor Sandip Joshi has issued a letter to municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe asking him not to submit report on dissolution of Nagpur Improvement Trust (NIT) to the state government without tabling it in the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) house.

Guardian minister Nitin Raut had written a letter to chief minister Uddhav Thackeray asking him to not dissolve NIT and instead strengthen it. The state urban development sought NMC’s views on the same.

Addressing a press conference on Thursday evening, city BJP president Pravin Datke appealed to Raut to withdraw the letter. “The decision to dissolve NIT was taken in interest of common citizens. The guardian minister should not block the move. We appeal to the CM not to agree to Raut’s demand. However, if the state government goes ahead with strengthening of NIT, BJP workers will take to streets. We will not let the government hurt the city,” he said.

Datke said that former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis had decided to dissolve the NIT because it was the most corrupt agency in the city. “NIT has enriched itself by looting the poor and middle class Nagpurians. Its working is very poor,” he added.

The BJP leader further said that Raut had taken the decision because BJP was in power in NMC and would continue to rule for another twenty to twenty-five years. “However, the minister should realize that only BJP voters don’t live in Gunthewari layouts,” he added.

On reasons for delay in dissolution of NIT during Fadnavis government, Datke said that there were several legal issues which had to be sorted out.

Earlier, mayor Joshi strongly condemned the decision and said that it was unfortunate. “The guardian minister instead of working for welfare of people is promoting an agency that harasses them,” he said.

Title: Economic slowdown, joblessness hit youths hard, says Sachin Pilot
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Sachin Pilot

JAIPUR: Deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot on Thursday said the economic slowdown and rising unemployment have hit the youth most. On one hand, the prices of essential commodities are skyrocketing, while on the other hand, there are hardly any employment opportunities for youths, he said.

Pilot was speaking at a meeting of the Congress leaders including ministers, MLAs, MPs, district presidents and party candidates from the last assembly and parliament elections, at the PCC office on Thursday. The meeting was held to finalise preparations for Rahul Gandhi’s rally which has been named as ‘Yuva Aakrosh’ rally scheduled to be held at Ram Niwas Bagh on January 28.

Pilot sad, unemployment is at an all-time high in the last 45 years. But the BJP government at the Centre instead of focusing on the pressing issues is adopting diversionary tactics by raking up contentious issues.

Pilot claimed that besides party workers, Gandhi’s ‘Aakrosh Rally’ will be attended by youths and students in large numbers.

“There is unrest among youths in the country today. The educated are unemployed and the economy is in poor state and Rahul Gandhi wants to focus on it. The message from the rally will go across the country,” he said.

“Gandhi will raise issues concerning people. After Rajasthan, he will hold rallies in other state also. In view of the Union Budget, the Congress wants the Central government to focus on the issues which help the economy run,” Pilot added.

The youth Congress and the NSUI have been asked to mobilize youth for the meeting.

Speaking on the occasion, chief minister Ashok Gehlot said due to the wrong polices of the Centre under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the economy has nosedived. Common people are reeling under skyrocketing prices while the youth are uncertain about their future with retrenchment and shrinking job opportunities the order of the day, he said.

Gehlot said crude oil is only sold at half the price at international market today compared to UPA government but there is no reduction in fuel prices.

He alleged that demonetisation and poor implementation of GST are the major reason for the economy going haywire. Even the share of the state government in central taxes were being curtailed. The Centre is now playing diversionary tactics. CAA and NRC are part of it, he said.

Gehlot alleged “The country’s unity and integrity is under threat by fascist forces and an atmosphere of fear is being created among the people.”

AICC secretary Vivek Bansal also spoke on the occasion.

Title: Rajasthan: 25 observers appointed for phase III of panchayat polls
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

JAIPUR: The state election commission (SEC) on Thursday released a list of 25 general observers to monitor the third phase of panchayat elections scheduled for January 29.

The chief electoral officer and secretary of the commission, Shyam Singh Rajpurohit, said senior IAS and RAS officials have been appointed observers to monitor the election process.

Among the observers, Ashish Gupta has been appointed in Ajmer, Nishkam Diwakar in Alwar, Bhawani Singh Palawat in Baran and Nakath Dan Barhath in Barmer. Ambarish Kumar has been appointed as observer in Bharatpur, Samit Sharma has been given charge of Bhilwara and Jai Narain Meena has been appointed as Bundi observer.

Mool Chand has been appointed in Chittorgarh, Jameel Ahmed Qureshi in Churu, Avdhesh Singh in Hanumangarh, Krishna Kant Pathak in Jaipur, Arun Kumar Purohit in Jalore, Lok Bandhu in Jhalawar , Ajeet Singh Rajawat in Jhunjhunu, Laxman Singh Kuri in Jodhpur, Virendra Singh in Kota, Peeyush Samariya in Pali and Harsh Sawan Sukha in Pratapgarh.

Omprakash has been appointed as observer in Rajsamand, Aslam Sher Khan in Ganganagar, Maneesh Goyal in Sawai Madhopur, Bhanwar Lal Mehra in Sirohi, Rakesh Rajoria in Tonk and Shivangi Swarnakar in Udaipur.

The state recorded 83% polling at the end of the second phase of panchayati raj elections on Wednesday.

An FIR was lodged by the zonal magistrate after around 50-60 people gheraoed him at the Jajabar polling station in Nainwa, Bundi, and accused him of changing the ballot boxes. “He had come to the polling station with the reserved ballot boxes. They quarrelled with him and also pelted stones. Later, police took control of the situation and the miscreants were chased away. The zonal magistrate has lodged an FIR,” said Nainwa SHO Om Prakash.

Five miscreants were arrested after they set the bus of a polling party on fire outside a polling station in Udaipur’s Rishabhdev on Wednesday. “Five miscreants have been arrested so far. Investigations are on and more will be arrested after the inquiry,” Udaipur collector Anandhi said.

“The situation has been brought under control and the micreants have been arrested. We have also rescued the polling party. There are no injuries and everybody is safe,” she had earlier said.

Title: Narendra Modi: PM’s intervention fast-tracks Odisha railway project delayed for 25 years
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

NEW DELHI: At the meeting on Wednesday of Pragati , a mechanism devised by him to speed up implementation by bringing down silos within bureaucracy, Prime Minister Narendra Modi seemed happy when presented with the status report of one particular project.

The 289-km Khurda-Bolangir railway line in Odisha was conceived in 1995 and was supposed to provide succour to one of the poorest regions in the country. Yet, it languished for decades until 2015 when it engaged the attention of the PM when he was reviewing the status of projects which had failed to get off the ground much after they were launched.

After going through details of the project and seeing that it had progressed at a snail’s pace, Modi made his unhappiness known. “This area is home to some of the poorest and neediest citizens, who got left behind other parts and are in dire need of compassionate governance. We have failed them,” sources in PMO quoted a worried Modi telling officials in 2014.

“Work on this project should have been prioritised. If the work had been finished by 2000, the original date of completion, the cost would have been substantially lower and would have helped unlock the economic potential of eastern India,” he lamented.

On Wednesday, in sharp contrast, Modi, a stern taskmaster, looked satisfied when the railway ministry shared the details of implementation of the Khurda-Bolangir line with him to show that work was going as per schedule.

Sources said the railway ministry shared the progress report on the line and assured that work on it was on track. The chief secretary of Odisha said not much work had taken place on the project for the first 20 years and the process of serious planning began only in 2015, after Modi undertook the first review. Odisha government said that land was being acquired for the project from the Rs 2,000 crore state government provided for after the renewal of interest in the project under NDA government and that the job would be complete in next 6 months.

On the question of environmental clearances, sources said the PM noted with satisfaction that the railway ministry and the environment ministry were on the same page.

For PMO officials, the progress of the Khurda-Bolangir line is another evidence of the effectiveness of Pragati platform as a tool to speed up implementation of projects which were mothballed for several decades.

On Wednesday, the PM took up 11 issues out of which nine were linked to delayed projects worth Rs 24,000 crore and spread over nine states of Odisha, Telangana, Maharashtra, Jharkhand, Bihar, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh, Kerala and Uttar Pradesh and three Union ministries. These include three from the ministry of railways, five from the ministry of road transport and highways and one from the ministry of petroleum and natural gas.

Until Wednesday, the PM has reviewed 269 projects with a total investment of Rs 12.30 lakh crore. The PM has also reviewed the resolution of grievance redressal related to 47 government programmes and schemes across 17 diverse sectors, sources said.

Title: Aurangabad: BJP throws weight behind Pankaja Pankaja, to join stir for water
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Pankaja Pankaja

AURANGABAD: Amid speculations that BJP was sidelining Pankaja Munde , the party office on Thursday declared that it would launch an agitation on January 27 for Marathwada ’s water issues under her leadership.

Munde supporters were upset over the lack of enthusiasm from BJP towards her plans to stage a token hunger strike in front of the divisional commissionerate for various issues concerning Marathwada. The former state minister for women and child development had decided to go ahead with her agitation under the banner of Gopinath Munde Pratisthan, irrespective of the party’s support.

It is said that Munde is upset with former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis and some other senior party functionaries since her loss in the 2019 assembly election from Parli. “The BJP has in a way extended an olive branch to Pankaja Munde at the party core committee meeting by declaring that the agitation would be launched under her,” said the party worker.

The statement issued by party’s office secretary Mukund Kulkarni states that the meeting of the core committee headed by state party chief Chandrakant Patil, in the presence of Fadnavis, decided to launch the agitation to be led by Pankana Munde.

Fadnavis, union minister of state for civil supplies Raosaheb Danve, former speaker Haribhau Bagade and the opposition leader in legislative council Pravin Darekar would participate in the agitation.

BJP state general secretary Surjeet Singh Thakur said that the Fadnavis-led government had initiated many steps to free Marathwada from drought. “However, after the new government took over, its constituents got engaged in infighting and settling scores with each other, thus eventually ignoring the region’s core issues,” he said.

Title: Newly elected deputy sarpanch attacked in Baran district
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

KOTA: Supporters and the husband of a defeated sarpanch candidate of Kalmodiya gram panchayat attacked the newly elected deputy sarpanch in Baran district on Thursday.

The incident occurred when the deputy sarpanch went to receive her certificate of victory.

The miscreants later pelted stones at the house of another defeated sarpanch candidate alleging that their candidate was defeated due to her as she had secured 146 votes, hurting their vote bank. Two constables sustained minor injuries in the stone pelting.

Police filed two separate cases for damaging government property and attacking the candidates under sections of IPC, PDPP Act and Section 3 of SC/ST Act against 15 miscreants, including defeated candidate Sayeeda Bano’s husband Naina alias Julfikar, said Parmanand Meena, SHO, Sarthal police station .

Title: Rajasthan: Returning officer dies after bus hits truck in Rajsamand
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

The bus that was ferrying poll personnel on Thursday

UDAIPUR: A returning officer was killed and two policemen sustained injuries when their bus fell into a gorge after ramming into a trailer truck in Rajsamand district on Thursday evening.

The team was returning after completing the election process in Borwas gram panchayat under Bhim panchayat samiti.

The accident took place near Mada ki Bassi when a trailer truck that was ahead of the bus applied brakes, the bus driver lost control of the vehicle which hit the trailer and fell into a gorge.

Returning officer Jagdish Chandra Ameta was a lecturer in geography and hailed from Veervas. He was posted at Saraniya Kheda Government Senior Secondary School, police said.

Ameta’s head was leaning of the window when the mishap occurred. The collision was so severe that the bus turned turtle and Ameta was decapitated as his body was caught under the tyre.

Constable Jitendra Singh of Nathdwara police station and head constable Hanuman from Kishangarh police station were injured in the mishap.

The police team led by SHO Laxman Singh Chundawat rushed to the spot to rescue the victims who were taken to Deogarh hospital.

A hydraulic crane was pressed in to move the bus and pull out the body, which has been kept at Deogarh mortuary.

Title: Chinese worker among two dead in mine roof collapse
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: An Indian and a Chinese mine worker were killed after the roof of a manganese mine caved in at Gumgaon, around 24km from Nagpur, on Wednesday. Two mine workers, an Indian and a Chinese, were injured and are recuperating at a private hospital after the incident around 400 feet below ground level.

Manganese Ore India Limited (MOIL) had allotted contract to China Coal C3 (India) Private Limited to complete a work of high speed shaft sinking. The work at the site had started in 2018, with combined work force of MOIL and the Chinese government company’s workers. The incident took place in the second shift.

The deceased in the incident were identified as Chen Gang, 31, and Pankaj Chauriwar, 25, who were trapped under debris when the roof fell. The injured, Wang Yungshan and Anil Bagde, were lucky to be rescued by co-workers.

Khapa police have registered an offence against Prashant Geharwal, assistant manager of MOIL, along with the Chinese company’s safety personnel Vijay Kumar Swarajsingh and others for causing death due to negligence.

Police said some 13 persons, including four Chinese, were engaged in the concreting work of the multi-level inset. MOIL sources said the systematic support rules were comprehensively followed, but a sizeable portion of the roof caved in. “The incident was unfortunate, and mostly uncontrollable and unpredictable,” said MOIL sources.

Bagde, 25, who suffered lower back and limb injuries, said it appeared to him as if there was an earthquake under the ground, which was followed by a huge load collapsing on his lower back. “I was fortunate my upper part was not buried under the debris, which allowed me to keep breathing. My unfortunate coworkers were completely trapped under a huge quantity of debris,” he said.

Bagde, who was working as a welder, said co-workers rushed to rescue him and others. “An engineer had just completed checking the portion of the walls and roof with a hammer to see whether something was loose and coming off, but he had got no untoward indication. The walls and roof were mostly covered with safety iron net too, but still a portion of it came off,” he said.

“We have no assurance of the future, whether there would be work for us tomorrow or we shall be fit enough to work again and when,” said Bagde, who had been working at the site for around a year.

Police said the deceased Chauriwar too was tightening a bolt when debris fell on him. The four persons were rushed to Mayo Hospital but Chauriwar and Gang were declared dead. Their post mortem was performed at Mayo Hospital.

MOIL sources said Chauriwar’s family has been compensated with Rs20 lakh and job for one of his kin. The Chinese company is learnt to be taking up the compensation for the injured and their deceased national.

Title: City lad’s innovation wins national award
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Varun Saikia

Vadodara: A machine prepared by a young school student from the city may well help the government in cleaning up the waterbodies in cost effective way. Varun Saikia, a standard IX student of Navrachana School, Sama, recently won the top prize in the category of cleanliness and health at the CBSE National Science Exhibition held at Gurgaon recently.

In an exhibition where hundreds of schools from across the country had participated, Varun’s machine prototype ‘Makara’ earned appreciation from none less than CBSE chairman Anita Karwal. “I believed in my project and I had this feeling that I will win in the contest,” Varun told TOI. Karwala didn’t just appreciate the project but also suggested that the innovative machine prepared by Varun should be suggested to the government.

The 14-year-old boy’s prototype ‘Makara’ floats on the water surface and picks up garbage as well as filters sewage water.

The machine doesn’t cost much and if operated smartly, can play a key role in cleaning up water bodies across the country.

“The small prototype I kept on display in the exhibition was also equipped with Bluetooth. The machine can be connected with a mobile app and operated from a distance. I am hopeful that the government will consider my project and implement it on bigger scale,” Varun added.

Varun is in process of building a hi-tech prototype that will have bigger capacity for collecting waste, battery with longer life and a heavy duty motor.

The new prototype named Flipper will also have an ultrasonic sensor to prevent fishes getting caught, GPS to monitor its movements and data recorded to find out how much garbage was collected from which spot.

His aim is to help the government in cleaning up River Ganga as well as other water bodies across the country in cost effective way. Varun was the youngest innovator to participate in Vibrant Gujarat - Global Trade Show 2019 and he had also got grant from Gujarat Innovation Council, Vadodara chapter for building a better prototype last year.

Title: Nagpur: Over 100 goats killed in accident
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

NAGPUR: More than 100 goats were killed, while several others survived, after the truck they were being ferried in was rammed by another truck carrying coal on Thursday night on Mansar highway near Kanhan.

The accident blocked the highway for a couple of hours until Kanhan police managed to remove the goats and the truck from the spot.

Police said the truck carrying goats was travelling from Ramtek to Hyderabad while the truck carrying coal was crossing the road when the accident happened. The truck carrying goats fell on its side and several goats were crushed under it. It is learnt the truck carrying coal was coming from Dongri siding after loading coal.

Till late night police had not registered a case in the matter.

Title: Vadodara’s Bala unleashes bald fury on homeo chain of clinics
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: In a recent Bollywood blockbuster, actor Ayushmann Khurrana’s character Bala tries every trick to hide his bald pate, except going for a hair transplant. Banyan City’s ‘Bala’, tried even the last resort — hair transplant — which, however, proved to be an exercise in futility.

Seething in bald fury, the 31-year-old man pulled the homeo clinic major to the consumer court on charges of cheating and won the case too.

Ketan (name changed) mane struggle began in June 2015 when lured by an advertisement by a leading chain of homeopathy clinics, assuring 100% result, he had spent Rs 65,000 to get respite from baldness. He was promised a good crop of hair within a year of the operation. However, not a single strand grew on his head.

After medical tests, Ketan was referred to a senior doctor at the Ahmedabad clinic by a doctor at chain’s Vadodara clinic. He went for the transplantation process at Ahmedabad where too the doctors assured him of hair regrowth after the treatment .

However, his wait proved fruitless, even after a year. Ketan then contacted the doctors again but was given assurances again to wait patiently for some time more. Makwana even sent them photos of his condition through emails and WhatsApp but got no response.

Miffed at being duped, the resident of Karelibaug filed a complaint with Vadodara district consumer disputes redressal forum and fought the case on his own. He presented all the bills, medical test reports, copies of emails and WhatsApp messages and argued that the treatment was bogus as he was healthy at the time of treatment as shown in medical tests and was also young. Therefore, the failure to grow hair was not his fault, he said.

The court upheld his evidence and the arguments and concluded that the treatment did not yield results and ordered in his favour. However, Ketan will get only half the amount he spent along with interest.

“Since the doctors have performed the hair transplant surgery on the complainant it is not appropriate to award him the entire treatment cost,” the court stated in the judgment, ordering the chain of clinics to pay him Rs 32,500 along with 8% interest. Ketan will also get Rs 5,000 compensation for mental harassment and legal expenses.

Title: Centre unaware of number of enemy properties in Bhopal
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

BHOPAL: The Union home ministry has appointed two high-level committees to look into the disposal or sale of enemy properties in the country. However, none of the 9,406 moveable and immovable vested properties that figure on the ministry’s list belong to Bhopal .

In 2015, the Custodian of Enemy Property for India (CEPI) had vested control of properties on Abida Sultan, the daughter of last Nawab of Bhopal Hamidullah Khan. However, the move was challenged by Bollywood actor Saif Ali Khan and Pataudi family in the MPHC. The case is scheduled for hearing on February 20.

A senior Union home ministry official said, “We do not know the exact number of enemy properties in Bhopal . The state government has been asked to look into the matter.” About 131 properties in state capital Bhopal were earlier identified and vesting order was issued.

Highly placed sources in the government said there was a complaint over tabulation of CEPI properties in Bhopal. The properties worth crores are largely controlled by Pataudi family and spread over 2,800 acres across Bhopal, Raisen and Sehore. All three districts were then part of the Bhopal State. Officials from the revenue department have traced land records from 1940 to 2016 record. Following the district collector survey on behalf of CEPI, there is only one property named ‘Nani Ki Haveli’ in walled city which has been traced to Abida Sultan.

A complaint in such a matter is received by CEPI. It pertains to people who migrated to Pakistan or were residents of Pakistan between September 10, 1965 and September 26, 1977 are treated as enemy movable and immovable properties in India. New CEPI Act applies retrospectively to transfers that have occurred before or after 1968 and prohibits civil courts and other authorities from entertaining disputes related to enemy property.

Meanwhile, disposal of 88 properties in MP is scheduled to take place soon. The properties are located in Khandwa (1), Jabalpur (1), Seoni (5), Satna (55), Harda (4) and Dindori (22). Across India, a total of 6,50,75,877 shares in 996 companies of 20,323 shareholders are under the custody of CEPI. Of these 996 companies, 588 are functional or active companies, 139 of these are listed with remaining being unlisted.

The process for selling these shares is to be approved by the alternative mechanism under the chairmanship of Union finance minister and comprising minister of road transport and highway and home minister. The sale proceeds from this may be used for development and social welfare programmes.

Title: Plant 10 trees for each one cut for highways: Rajasthan High Court to state government
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: A division bench bench of Rajasthan High Court asked the state government to plant 10 times the trees to be removed while constructing the state highway (SH) and its maintenance from Majari to Haryana/Rajasthan border and from Majari to Neemrana (Alwar) SH-111 and SH-111A, a highway project on PPP model.

In a public interest petition filed by Lokesh Khandelwal, the bench comprising Chief Justice Indrajit Mahanty and Justice Ashok Kumar Gaur said among the 5,279 odd trees that are required to be cut for the purpose of construction of road, the state government has come up with a report indicating that 859 such trees will be translocated to appropriate places on the highway.

“We are of the opinion that since the present expansion of the road is a public requirement; we direct that the state may be permitted to construct the road on the proposed state highway Majari to Haryana and Rajasthan border and Majari to Neemrana. It is also subject to abiding their undertaking that 859 trees will be translocated,” the bench said.

The court further stated that although the state has agreed to plant three times the number of trees than the trees that have been removed, they need to plant more. “The state government must plant 10 times the number as planting trees is a vital necessity in a state like Rajasthan,” the bench said.

The bench has further expressed hope that the state government would abide by the request made by the court.

Title: Huge rally on Bal Thackeray’s birthday
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

The Shiv Sena workers took out a rally in the city to mark the birth anniversary

AURANGABAD: Shiv Sena workers took out a rally in the city to mark the birth anniversary of party founder Balasaheb Thackeray. The rally took off after a floral tribute was paid to Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj’s statue at Kranti Chowk.

Incidentally, the civic body had temporarily shifted the life-size statue of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj to facilitate increased height of its platform. The work is in progress.

Meanwhile, MLC and Shiv Sena district president Ambadas Danve objected to the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena using the seal of Shivaji Maharaj in its new flag. “It is not right for a political party to use the rajmudra (seal). We regret the MNS decision. Election commission should take notice of MNS move to change flag and make use of Shvaji Maharaj’s seal on its saffron flag. We will make a representation to the election commission in this regard,” said Danve who was among those who led the huge rally taken out to mark the birth anniversary of the party chief.O

On the occasion, deputy mayor Rajendra Janjal said that Sena wants to spread the ideology and message of the late Shiv Sena supremo to all the people. “This would help us to strengthen our hold in the city. He said that the anniversary celebrations were very significant because as per Thackeray’s wish, Shiv Sena has managed to install its chief minister in the state,” Janjal said.

The anniversary celebrations were very significant because as per Thackeray’s wish, Shiv Sena has managed to install its chief minister in the state,” Janjal said.

Title: Rs 2.5cr food scam at Niloufer Hospital, reveals inquiry
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hyderabad: After complaints of a high-protein diet being supplied to around 1,000 patients per day at the state-run Niloufer Hospital without recommendations surfaced nearly three months back, a detailed inquiry was launched into the issue.

While new mothers and pregnant women require a high-protein diet and a daily chart is followed to ensure a nutritious meal, the food supply contractor in this case was supplying to high-protein diet to all patients, making an additional Rs 16 per patient per day. The additional amount that the contractor took home in the process ran to the tune of up to Rs 2.5 crores per month. This scam was confirmed by the inquiry committee in a confidential report submitted to the health authorities a few days ago.

After the irregularity was pointed out, a team of five members, including dieticians, was set up by the Director of Medical Education (DME), Dr Ramesh Reddy and the report had been directly submitted to the state health secretary. “The report has pinpointed the scam and the double payment being made for the food. Links establishing the corruption have been shown as well. It is recommended to remove the contractor and review the food in all other state-run hospitals too,” said a senior official.

The fact that the scam went unnoticed for almost a year hints at a nexus, the report said. “While pregnant women and lactating mothers are recommended high-protein diets, not all patients require it. The contractor was supplying the high-protein diet to all the patients without being asked. While regular diet costs Rs 40, the high protein diet costs Rs 56. There are issues related to double payment to the contractor from funds of Aarogyasri and from hospital funds as well,” said a source in the hospital.

Title: UP man tries to dupe Vadodara bizman of Rs 9 lakh using forged cheque
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representational Image

VADODARA: A city businessman nearly bid goodbye to Rs 9 lakh after an unidentified man from Kanpur in Uttar Pradesh tried to cheat him using a cheque with his forged signatures.

Piyush Shah, a resident of RV Desai road in the city said he was plainly lucky as the money was debited from his Union Bank of India account in the Sultanpura branch on Lakkadpitha road on December 18. However, Shah’s son Hemang received an SMS regarding the debit and asked his father if he issued a cheque for Rs 9 lakh to anyone.

When Shah denied, the father-son duo immediately went to the bank to inquire and wrote an application to the branch manager requesting to ‘stop payment’ on the forged cheque. Thankfully, Shah received the money back in the account the next day.

But on inquiring further with the bank, it was known that the cheque was deposited in a branch of Oriental Bank of Commerce in Kanpur. However, it was not known whose account it was. Shah, who deals in industrial machineries, submitted his complaint with Navapura police, based on which cops registered a complaint of forgery on Wednesday. tnn

Title: Fadnavis likely to attend CJM court today: Lawyer
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: Even as former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis has challenged summons issued to him by the chief judicial magistrate (CJM) here in the Supreme Court, he’s likely to remain present before former’s court on Friday, according to his lawyer Uday Dable.

During the last hearing, the CJM’s court had granted a reprieve to Fadnavis by adjourning hearing on plea filed against him by lawyer Satis Uke for allegedly suppressing information about two pending criminal cases while filing affidavit for nomination form during 2014 assembly polls.

The CJM asked Dable to make Fadnavis appear in the court on January 24 for replying to the summons issued to him. It was a second reprieve for the South Nagpur MLA. He was earlier allowed to skip the court proceedings on December 4 when he was asked to appear by the Judicial Magistrate First Class (JMFC) court led by judge SB Mehta.

According to BJP office-bearers, Fadnavis had given his consent to attend the concluding ceremony of Khasdar Krida Mahotsav, to be held at Yashwant Stadium on Friday evening. Since Fadnavis would be in city, his lawyers may produce him in the court in the afternoon to avoid any embarrassment in case the CJM issues a warrant. The court may not grant him a reprieve third time, they said.

After Uke’s case was remanded back by the SC to trial court, JMFC issued summons to Fadnavis, a five-time MLA, on November 4, asking him to remain present on December 4 to defend charges against him.

After Dable sought ex-CM’s exemption from appearance citing “unavoidable circumstances” due to winter assembly session, the hearing was adjourned to January 4. The ex-CM again asked for exemption from appearance citing his “busy schedule” for visiting hailstorm hit areas in the state being LOP, following which he was asked to remain present on January 24.

On January 9, the leader of opposition in assembly moved the top curt for reviving its order of remanding back Uke’s case to JMFC. Fadnavis had allegedly failed to mention in his poll affidavit summary case no. 232 of 1996 (u/s 500 of IPC — defamation) and regular criminal case no. 343 of 2003 under various sections of IPC, which were pending before the JMFC.

Title: Rajasthan: One held for sharing child porn clip
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: The Special Operations Group (SOG) on Thursday arrested a person for allegedly watching child pornography and circulating it to other groups on WhatsApp in Sriganganagar.

Akbar Khan (28) allegedly shared a 1.14 minute child pornography video on an app. When other group members raised an objection, the group admin removed Khan from the group.

Khan, a resident of Ramawali of Sriganganagar, has a criminal record with cases registered in Raisinghnagar and Sriganganagar, police said.

Police said members of the group are people linked to politics and social work. A social activist complained against Khan at the state’s national cyber crime portal about the video clip shared on the group.

DGP (anti-terrorist squad and SOG) Anil Paliwal said the cyber crime investigation unit (CCIU) of SOG investigated the case and arrested the accused.

Title: Kerala: Cops recover gold worth Rs 12.5 lakh stolen from house
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

ATTINGAL: The Kadakkavoor police recovered the gold ornaments stolen from a house at Parthoorkanam in Manamboor here based on the confession of the second accused in police custody, here on Thursday.

The police recovered gold ornaments worth Rs 12.5 lakh, which was found buried near a grave at Kavalayoor in Kadakkavoor.

Sub-inspector Vinod Vikramadithyan said that the recovery operation was carried out based on the confession of Ratheesh Raveendran alias Kannappan (35) of RS Nivas in Attingal, who is the second accused in the case.

The crime took place at the house of Ashokan, a native of Parthoorkonam in Manamboor.

The incident happened on January 8, after the NRI family found that the main door of the house and a steel almirah were forced open.

Other than gold ornaments, the thieves had also stolen Rs 50,000 and 1,000 UAE Dirhams.

Based on the complaint, police had arrested four youths who have direct involvement in the burglary on January 19 from their hideouts in Perumkulam and Attingal.

“During interrogation the second accused, Ratheesh, confessed about the ornaments. The ornaments were found buried near the grave of the accused’s father-in-law who died last year. As per his confession, soon after the incident he had attended his father-in-law’s death anniversary observance at the latter’s house in LP School Junction, Kavalayoor. After the event, he put the stolen ornaments in a box and buried it on the ground near the grave,” said Vikramadithyan, adding that the officers are yet to arrest Yasin, the leader of the gang.

“Four of the accused were arrested with the help of CCTV footages and mobile tower locations. But Yasin had switched off his phone, thus we could not find out his hide out. The other accused admitted that the stolen money is with Yasin,” added the SI.

Title: 59% of girls in Gujarat villages face lewd comments: Study
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representational Photo

AHMEDABAD: A study by the Society for Women’s Action and Training Initiative (SWATI) and International Centre for Research on Women (ICRW) last year, revealed a new low in sexual violence against women in public spaces in rural Gujarat .

The study to gauge sexual violence against women and girls ( SVWAG ) conducted across some 10 villages in various districts of Gujarat revealed that 59% of adolescent girls faced lewd comments, songs or playing music loudly when they walk through the village.

According to the study, conducted as part of the ‘Know Fear’ project, 41.1% of adolescents were subjected to winking, leering and stalking; while 29.7% faced grabbing of their hands, obscene gestures, touching or even groping. The study was conducted in Jarvala, Bamanva, Bajana, Gavana, Mithaghoda, Bubwana, Sedla, Vadgam, Nana Goriya and Savlas villages, among others, with a sample size of 522 adolescent girls in the 13-18 years age-group and 522 women above the age of 18; from the population of 16,000 in these villages.

“The infrastructure in rural areas is poor and women don’t have access to safe public transport. At the same time, awareness about the issue and acknowledgement of the problem by authorities is poor. Thus, it is important to create conversations around cases of sexual harassment ,” said Poonam Kathuria, director, SWATI.

Title: Electric buses for Pune-Kolhapur
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation ( MSRTC ) will soon launch electric bus service on Kolhapur-Pune route.

A team of MSRTC officials visited Kolhapur on Wednesday and reviewed preparations for the service that is expected to start in three months.

Title: Thrissur: Renovation of North bus stand to be completed soon
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Thrissur: Renovation works of North bus stand ( Vadakke stand ) in Thrissur will be completed soon. The face lift of the bus stand will be implemented with the CSR fund of South Indian Bank . The facelift is worth Rs 5.5 crore. As part of the project, the bank will arrange airport model facilities in the bus stand, said officials.

“We hope the construction work of the bus stand will be completed in the second week of February. The inauguration of the bus stand will be on February 18 or 19. After construction completion, the bank will hand over the bus stand to the corporation,” Thrissur mayor Ajitha Vijayan told TOI.

“The construction works of the bus stand is almost completed. Fixing of the roof works and tiling works are in progress and will be completed soon. South Indian Bank will manage the maintenance works of the stand for the next 10 years,” said Vijayan.

“As part of the project, South Indian Bank ATM and advertisement boards will be fixed inside the bus stand” said the mayor.

As part of the renovation project the bank will arrange airport quality toilets for gents and ladies, restaurant, ATM centre, various Kiosks including police aid-post, mobile phone shops, medical stores, stationary shops and rest room for drivers will be setup, said officials. The bank will also assure security facility to the bus stand. For the next 10 years, the bank will manage maintenance work of the bus stand. The construction works of the bus stand were done with the guidance of Thrissur Government Engineering College. At a time, 20 buses can arrange parking facility inside the new bus stand, said officials.

“The North bus stand is used by thousands every day. The corporation authorities hope after completion of renovation works of the stand it will provide a new face lift for Thrissur city,” said officials.

Title: Nationalistic slogans, Modi chants dominate BJP rally
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Agra: Slogans of ‘Jai Sri Ram’ and ‘Bharat Mata ki Jai’ rent the air at the BJP’s well-attended public meeting, organized in support of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), at Kothi Meena Bazar ground on Thursday.

If slogans of “azadi from CAA” have been the flavour of the anti-CAA protests in UP, particularly AMU, Modi chant and slogans like ‘Jai Shri Ram’ dominated the public meeting which was addressed by BJP’s national president JP Nadda, chief minister, Yogi Adityanath, deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya and party’s state president Swatantra Dev Singh.

Though the crowd at the rally was impressive by local standards, it was far less than the 1.5 lakh figure touted by the party leaders a day earlier.

Party workers reached the venue with posters and banners of ‘We support CAA’ and kept shouting slogans of ‘Jai Sri Ram’, ‘Vande Matram’ and ‘Bharat Mata Ki Jai’. Modi chants were also raised.

BJP workers had also carried a 51-foot-long national flag, which, in fact, turned out to be a major attraction at the rally.

People, who reached the venue wearing black outfits, were turned back by the cops on duty, as organizers feared that they might take them off and waive them during the speeches by the party leaders.

The busy area around the venue witnessed traffic jam for almost an hour as the police had cordoned off several access routes. The rally, which started around 2:10 pm, finished at about 3:15 pm.

Title: Sickle, 9cm deep in woman’s eye and head, removed by govt docs
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: In a rare life-saving surgery at trauma centre of the Government Medical College and Hospital (GMCH), neurosurgeons removed a sickle that was almost 9cm deep in the head of a 65-year-old woman and saved her life. The woman hails from a poor farmer family of village in Yavatmal district.

Mirabai, hailing from Asoli village in Pusad tehsil of Yavatmal district, was assaulted by an unidentified person while she was sleeping in her house on Tuesday night. The assaulter left her screaming in pain with sickle stabbed deep in her head through her right eye.

Relatives rushed her to a local government hospital. Even doctors were shocked when they saw the iron sickle deep inside her skull and referred her to GMCH Nagpur. Her relatives managed to bring Mirabai to trauma centre on Wednesday morning. All the necessary investigations were conducted immediately and she was moved to the operation theatre within one and a half hours.

A team, led by Dr Pavitra Patnaik, associate professor and head of neurotrauma, ophthalmologist Dr Divyanjana and Dr Sheetal and maxillofacial surgeon Dr Vikas Meshram performed the critical operation. Within one hour, Dr Patnaik removed the sickle from the right eye.

“The surgery was extremely critical. We were worried about torrential bleeding after removal of the sickle. Saving the life of the patient without damaging any vital structures of the brain while removing the sickle was a major challenge,” said Dr Patnaik. Adequate blood for transfusion was arranged by the hospital.

The sickle was stabbed so deep inside head that both frontal lobes were hurt. While the right eye was badly damaged, even the branches of carotid arteries and on opposite side behind the left eye was injured.

“The patient is now conscious and obeying commands. The post-operative infection is a major challenge in such cases. The situation is considered critical until the patient is discharged,” said Dr Patnaik.

Dr Faizal, professor and head of orthopaedics and in-charge of trauma centre, quoted this as a courageous example of multidisciplinary team effort in saving a patient’s life. “Such treatment at any other private hospital would have cost a fortune. We are happy to offer such care at no cost. Speedy treatment was the key of success in this case,” said Dr Faizal.

GMCH dean Dr Sajal Mitra congratulated everyone involved in the patient’s management and prayed for a faster recovery of the patient.

Saved from jaws of death

65-yr-old Mirabai faced murderous assault by unidentified person on Tuesday night

Was brought to GMCH trauma centre on Wednesday at 11.45am

X-rays, 3D CAT scan of skull and brain, blood tests conducted within 90 minutes

Neurosurgeons, ophthalmic surgeons and maxillofacial surgeons were roped in for surgery

Ophthalmic surgeons removed damaged eye

Maxillofacial surgeons reconstructed dismantled face

Patient was off the ventilator within 24 hours of surgery

CAPTION: The doctors removed sickle from right eye within 60 minutes

8.5 to 9cm

Title: Garbage on open plots: NMC to fine owners, auction properties
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: Owners of vacant plots in Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) limits will be fined if they fail to stop people from littering their property. The NMC’s health department has proposed to impose garbage lifting charge of Rs50 per sq mtr from such owners.

In a proposal submitted before the standing committee, the department has also sought nod to auction such properties if owners fail to keep the place clean.

Health department prepared the proposal after mayor Sandip Joshi received complaints from several residents about how open plots were posing serious health hazards due to accumulation of garbage and stagnation of water for many years.

The proposal states that if garbage is found on any open plot, the department would issue a notice to clear it in two days. If the owner failed to heed to the notice, the cost involved in clearing the litter will be recovered from the defaulting owners, the proposal stated. If the owner fails to pay the expenses incurred and in stopping garbage being dumped on his/her property, the NMC will auction such properties under relevant sections of the Maharashtra Municipal Corporation Act.

In the past, the corporation had asked the owners of open plots to remove bushes, garbage, trash and fence their property. Corporators like Abha Pande had raised the issue on several occasions at the general body meeting.

The NMC had, in 2014, passed strict bylaws for dumping, collection and destruction of waste on open plot control rule. It had provision to levy a fine up to Rs5,000 or filing a police complaint against such plot owners. The bylaws for Dumping, Collection and Destruction of Waste on Open Plot Control Rule, 2014 were forwarded to the state government for approval on March 15, 2016. However, they have not been cleared yet,” said a senior official from NMC’s health (sanitation) department.

“As a result, we could not take punitive measures against the nuisance makers,” the official claimed.

Recently, Joshi directed assistant municipal commissioners of all 10 zones and property tax department to identify private and government plots being used as garbage grounds and warned their owners. The officials will take a photograph of the garbage before removing it and use it as evidence.

OTHER PROPOSALS

* NMC’s health department (medicine) has sought nod to appoint 29 doctors including one physician, two gynecologists, 11 male doctors, two homeopaths, eight ayurvedic medicos on contract basis for its clinics. The department will require Rs93.60 lakh

* Sports and cultural department has demanded Rs46.35 lakh for organizing three-day Vaishakh Din Mahotsav to mark birth anniversary of Gautam Buddha

* Garden department seeks Rs31.32 lakh and Rs24.82 lakh for developing garden in Yogeshwar Gruh Nirman Housing Society and Vaishno Devi Nagar, respectively

* General administration department has sought nod to empower civic chief to appoint a security agency to deploy guards on its premises. NMC spends over Rs7.30 crore per annum on 300 security guards at its various establishments and offices

Title: Customised vehicles ease transport woes at Mela
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

A man rides an elephant while negotiating his way through the crowds on Magh Mela ground on Thursday

Allahabad: A tractor-trolley transformed into a double-decker vehicle with a bamboo partition and a pedal rickshaw with a battery for greater speed are just some of the ways in which the ‘great Indian jugaad’ has been facilitating transport at the Magh Mela ground in Allahabad.

With several of kilometres to cover on the 20-bigha venue, devotees often have to walk miles to reach the different camps on the ground. However, one can spot a number of customised vehicles, some using unique principles of rural engineering, ferrying devotees. The number of such vehicles only surged on Thursday, as hundreds flocked to the Magh Mela ground ahead of the Mauni Amavasya snan.

Almost every vehicle which came from nearby villages was retrofitted with special arrangements like extra carriers to accommodate more passengers.

“Three families from my village wanted to take a dip in Sangam on Mauni Amavasya. We were 15 people and had only one vehicle. So, we decided to use a bamboo structure to convert our tractor-trolley into a double-decker bus so that more people could be accomodated,” said Ghanshyam Kumar, a native of Mahi village and a farmer by profession.

Some vehicles were also saddled with stoves and sacks filled with vegetables and rice, especially those ferrying devotees from far-flung places.

“As we there wasn’t enough space in the truck, we decided to hang our belongings on both sides of the vehicles,” said Rambilas from Khajuri Khurd village.

Even small vehicles like motorcycles and vans were seen fitted with additional carriers. In many vehicles, baskets tied to the roof were laden with items of daily necessities.

Title: Case against teacher for punching boy
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hyderabad: LB Nagar police registered an assault case against a teacher of a private school for allegedly punching a nine-year-old student in the head for tearing notebook pages. Police also registered a counter case against the father of the student for allegedly assaulting the teacher at the school premises following the incident.

“According to the complainant, the boy fainted after he was punched by the teacher and he was treated at a local hospital before being discharged.
