When the complainant went to the school to enquire about the incident, the staff and the management did not respond properly,” LB Nagar inspector V Ashok Reddy said. Police registered a case under section 323 of the IPC and the JJ Act.

Subsequently police received a counter complaint from the teacher who alleged that the boy’s father came to the school on Wednesday afternoon and assaulted him.

Title: ‘Hatch 2020’ startup summit held
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Over 50 start-up entrepreneurs attended the ‘ Hatch 2020 : The Startup Summit ’, organized by the Project Management Institute (PMI), in association with the Kerala Startup Mission (KSUM) here on Wednesday.

The objective of the summit was to create awareness on how structured project management techniques can become the key to the success of projects and emphasize why a startup needs to integrate a formal project management methodology into their work ethos.

During the inaugural session, Vineesh Kathuria, MD of SenseAI Ventures, spoke about the failure threat faced by startups and the real-life challenges he had faced while launching his own startup, including raising funds and finding the right partners.

“Through this initiative, we at PMI India intend to empower startups with relevant project management frameworks and toolkits.” said Srini Srinivasan, managing director, PMI India.

Krishnakumar T I, president of the Kerala chapter of PMI India said that the organization will continue to provide opportunities to young entrepreneurs through seminars, open forums and other professional programmes.

PMI India honoured KSUM team for their recent achievements to support startup industry’s growth. “In addition to providing basic amenities, governmental support and industry connect, the entrepreneurs must be well equipped with project management tools and methodologies. We are happy to partner with PMI to support the startup industry in Kerala. With this initiative, we plan to address the typical challenges that startups have to overcome, including, testing unexplored markets and new products,” said Saji Gopinath, CEO of KSUM.

Title: Uttarakhand: Thieves flee with cash, gold from municipal commissioner’s house
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

ROORKEE: A few unidentified burglars raided a locked house of Roorkee municipal commissioner in Roorkee industrial estate on Wednesday evening and decamped with jewellery and other items worth more than Rs 1 lakh.

RMC officer Nupur Verma’s husband Abhishek raised an alarm after he found that their house was ransacked and several items worth lakhs stolen.

“When her husband Abhishek came to his house at 6 pm he noticed that the main gate of their house was locked from inside. After checking, he found that one backside window was also broken. When he entered the building, he saw all the rooms ransacked and valuables missing,” Rajesh Sah, in-charge of Gangnahar police station, said.

He added, “In his complaint, Abhishek mentioned that some gold ornaments, silver jewellery, and Rs 25,000 cash were missing from the house. As per our calculations, the robbers have looted items that might cost over Rs 1 lakh. So far, we don’t know anything about the robbers, but we have pressed a separate team to locate them.”

Title: Gujarat BJP MLA Ketan Inamdar falls in line, offers to withdraw resignation
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

BJP MLA Ketan Inamdar with BJP president Jitu Vaghani on Wednesday

VADODARA: The resignation drama by Savli BJP MLA Ketan Inamdar was wrapped up within 24 hours with state BJP president Jitu Vaghani announcing that he had decided to take back his decision.

After a marathon meeting with Inamdar at the circuit house, Vaghani told media persons that his decision could not be called as a rebellion. “Inamdar would withdraw his resignation. He did not rebel against the party. It was an emotional decision he took as he felt some of his works were not happening. These include setting up an ESIS hospital in his constituency, a lift irrigation project and the issue of the power bills of the Savli municipality,”

Inamdar had sent his resignation to the assembly speaker Rajendra Trivedi, chief minister Vijay Rupani and Vaghani on Wednesday. The strongly worded resignation letter blamed lack of coordination between the government and administration as well as indifference in addressing important issues in his constituency for his decision.

Inamdar had stated that the dignity and respect of his post as an MLA were not maintained. “This has happened at the cost of government constantly trying to ensure the respect of senior officials," the letter had stated. It later came to light that he was referring to being cold shouldered when he had approached a senior Madhya Gujarat Vij Company Ltd (MGVCL) official for resuming electricity supply to the Savli municipality.

The power connection of several facilities of the municipality including streetlights had been severed as the civic body’s power bills were overdue. Inamdar said that he had requested the official to resume the connection by taking a post-dated cheque, but the official insisted that the connection would be resumed only after the cheque was cleared. He later raised the issue with state energy minister Saurabh Patel, but it remained unresolved and Inamdar felt hurt, sources said.

While Inamdar had been sulking for quite some time now and had raised the issue of officials not maintaining the dignity of elected representatives earlier too, the MGVCL incident was the catalyst in his decision to resign. He mentioned this even while addressing the media after the meeting with Vaghani.

Inamdar too said that he would be withdrawing his resignation. “My concerns have been addressed by the party president, chief minister, deputy chief minister and the energy minister,” he said.

Earlier in the day, Rupani had told reporters in Dahod that the issue would be sorted and the government was serious in resolving problems of MLAs and common people.

Throughout Thursday, a series of resignations were tendered in favour of Inamdar. These included district and taluka panchayat members, agriculture produce market committee members, BJP party office bearers and others.

Title: Maharashtra: 'Flood-hit Sangli farmers received Rs 89 crore aid'
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Over 3 lakh farmers were affected by floods in the month of August 2019

KOLHAPUR: Sangli collector Abhijit Choudhary on Thursday said that around Rs 89 crore has been distributed among flood-affected farmers in the district till the third week of January.

“We had demanded around Rs 130 crore from the state government as compensation for farmers. The government, however, released Rs 100 crore of which Rs 89 crore has been distributed among the beneficiaries. The remaining amount too will soon be deposited into the accounts of the beneficiaries,” he said.

According to Choudhary, they also received Rs 109 crore aid for damages caused due to the unseasonal rainfall of which Rs 102 crore have been distributed. “We returned Rs 7 crore back to the state government after compensation was distributed among all the beneficiaries,” he said.

Daulat Desai, district collector of Kolhapur , told TOI that they received Rs 121 crore from the state government for agriculture aid of which Rs 38 crore have been distributed and the remaining amount will soon be deposited into the account of the farmers.

“We are taking every precaution to ensure every affected farmer gets the assistance, but if anyone is facing any kind of hurdle then they can contact the respective administrative authority to get their issue resolved at the earliest,” he said.

Over 3 lakh farmers were affected by floods in the month of August 2019. The beneficiaries are being provided compensation according to the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF) guidelines.

Pratap Jadhav, deputy commissioner revenue, divisional commissioner office (Pune), told TOI that they received around Rs 1,018 crore as aid for five districts across the division.

The officials, however, are unsure about the distribution update. According to a revenue department official, Rs 300 crore has been received from the state government for flood compensation and Rs 222 crore has been received for homes destroyed during floods.

The state had received record rainfall in the month of August during which many rivers and waterbodies had flooded or crossed danger levels, leading to evacuation of around 5 lakh people in Kolhapur and Sangli districts.

Title: Centre should listen to ‘Mann ki Baat’ of intellectuals, writers: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

CM Ashok Gehlot along with PHED minister B D Kalla during the inaugural session of Jaipur Literature Festival ... Read More

JAIPUR: In an indirect attack on the central government and current political unrest, Rajasthan chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday said the Centre should listen to the ‘ Mann ki Baat ’ of intellectuals and writers. He was speaking after inaugurating the annual five-day Jaipur Literature Festival (JLF) at Diggi Palace.

“JLF is the pride of Rajasthan, it has carved a place for itself in the world. Everyone is in awe of it. I hope the festival will inspire the new generation. It is being talked about across the world. All the literary people discuss this festival, they feel at JLF they will get a chance to say their 'mann ki baat' as well as ' kaam ki baat '... If intellectuals voice their opinion then it is a possibility that their voices will reach those holding positions in the government and it might help,” Ashok Gehlot, who was attending the festival after a gap of six years, said.

Interacting with the media later, he said that this was the first time that such a situation has risen in the country and urged authors and speakers to discuss it at length and get the message across.

“This is not just a national but an international platform and I strongly suggest that more people should participate in it,” added Gehlot.

Referring to the Centre’s policies that have resulted in political turmoil, he reiterated, “Everyone knows the present scenario and I hope that the central government listens to writers and those participating in the festival.”

The festival, now in its 13th edition, was described by Gehlot as “pride of Rajasthan” and “Sahitya Ka Mahakumbh”. During the event, he paid tribute to Rajasthani poet Vijaydan Detha and unveiled an English translation of the late poet's works—“Bijji: Timeless Tales from Marwar”.

Speaking at the inaugural session, festival co-director and author William Dalrymple told the audience that the JLF has now formally become “the largest literary festival” in the world.

“Around five lakh people attended the event last year. At a time when people say that love for literature is dying, we are a proof that it isn’t. Literature is alive and loved and the teeming crowds at the JLF are proof of it,” said Dalrymple.

Gehlot later tweeted that he hopes that the youth especially would gain from discussions at the festival as well as from the authors.

Deputy chief minister Sachin Pilot, who visited the festival venue on the inaugural day, said that the festival was not only for the people of Rajasthan but also for the whole world. “Every citizen in this democracy has the right to speak about the present scenario in the country and their words should be acknowledged,” said Pilot.

Sanjoy Roy, festival producer, said that literature was the only thing that can push against the "spread of a narrative of hatred”, the one that the country was witnessing today.

(With inputs from agencies)

Title: Learning lessons on staying hydrated with water bell in Maharashtra
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

The notification stated that dehydration is the root cause of many diseases among school children across the s... Read More

KOLHAPUR: The schools across the state will soon be ringing bells at least thrice during the school hours to encourage students to drink water.

The state school education and sports department, in a notification on January 21, has asked schools to decide on the timing of ringing the bell and include it in their daily schedule.

The notification stated that dehydration is the root cause of many diseases among school children across the state. The children should drink at least 1.5 to 2 litres of water, which varies according to the age, height, and weight of the child.

“It is a common complaint from parents that their wards bring the water bottle as is without even consuming it. Less water consumption can cause urinary tract infections and also kidney stone, lethargy, and distressed behaviour,” it said.

The notification has asked the headmasters to fix the timing of ringing the water bell in their daily schedule, which could habituate students into consuming water on a regular basis during the school hours. The schools have been asked to give special breaks to students to use washrooms. The education commissioner has been asked to review the initiative.

Asha Ubale, district primary education officer, told TOI that they have received instructions from the education department and same will be forwarded to schools. It is an important initiative, she said.

Sattappa Mohite, a city-based education activist, said such initiatives have already been implemented in a few schools in other states and it is a welcome decision from the education department. “It will surely help in encouraging students to hydrate themselves at regular intervals, it can really help them in their academics as well,” he said.

Notably, according to United Nations guidelines, every student (child) has the right to safe drinking water and it’s a human right too. It is important for schools to provide safe drinking water. It is also one of the important criterion in the Right to Education (RTE) infrastructure needs of the schools to have drinking water facility in a school.

Title: Kolhapur: Farmers hope for better rose production ahead of Valentine’s Day
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

The farmer added that the flowers are kept in the cold storage at the fixed temperature of 7°C before they are... Read More

KOLHAPUR: Farmers in the region are hoping for better weather for roses ahead of Valentine’s Day in February.

According to the farmers, rose production has already taken a major hit this season due to the unfavourable weather conditions. However, consistent cooler weather can make up for the bad better a little bit.

A farmer said if there is a lot of cloud cover over the poly houses for rose saplings, it can have an adverse effect on the growth of the plants. Extreme cold too can be harmful. The current pleasant weather is ideal for rose production. He added that the flowers will be ready for the export from January 28 onwards and will be kept in cold storage. He added that the orders are still being received and the rate of orders for the flowers will increase after February 10.

“For production in late January and early February, we have to prepare from December and make sure everything is in order — including the plant’s health and the production quality,” he said.

The farmer added that the flowers are kept in the cold storage at the fixed temperature of 7°C before they are shipped out. This ensures they retain their freshness.

He said the European market is the biggest, and long-stemmed red Taj Mahal rose variety is most in demand. According to the farmer, varieties of red roses like Grand Gala, Top Secret and Upper Class are also quite popular abroad. He said that in the past few years, there was variation in the production of roses, either due to the climatic differences or due to demand.

Ramesh Jadhav, a flower vendor, said, “Generally a red rose costs somewhere between Rs 10-15. However, during Valentine’s Day, the prices skyrocket upwards to Rs 30-60 for each rose.”

Title: Modi corrected historical mistakes committed at the time of Independence: Nadda
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Agra: In an obvious reference to the abrogation of Article 370 in J&K, enactment of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) and settling of the Ram Janmabhoomi dispute, BJP national president JP Nadda on Thursday said that what Prime Minister Narendra Modi has achieved in eight months of his second tenure, the Congress could not do it in the last 70 years.

Addressing a pro-CAA rally in city’s Kothi Meena Bazar, Nadda said that Modi has made corrections to “historical mistakes” made at the time of Independence. “Congress had absolute majority in both the houses of Parliament but never had the willpower to make these corrections,” he said.

It was his first political rally since the 59-year-old leader from Himachal Pradesh was elected as the BJP’s 11th president on January 20 after he emerged as the only nominee in the fray.

Nadda was accompanied at the rally by Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath, deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya and party’s state president Swatantra Dev Singh. This was the sixth rally organised by BJP in the state in support of CAA.

Nadda quoted western UP poet Muzaffar Razmi’s famous lines to attack Congress. “Lamhon ne khata ki thi aur sadiyon ne saza payee (centuries have been punished for mistakes of the moment). We got freedom but the decisions, which were taken then, had proved deadly for the country.”

Maintaining that Mahatma Gandhi, Jawaharlal Nehru and even former PM Manmohan Singh wanted Indian government to settle Hindus, Buddhists, Sikhs and Christians, who were left in Pakistan during Partition and had been facing problem in their survival, Nadda said, “The Congress leadership is suffering from ‘manasik diwaliyapan’ (mental bankruptcy). The statements issued by the party in the last eight months will reflect that these are intended to help Pakistan.”

“It’s unfortunate that Dalit leaders are opposing the CAA. These Dalit leaders and the Congress hardly know anything about the CAA and are only spreading canards to mislead people,” Nadda said, adding that this law is for providing citizenship not taking it away.

In his address, UP CM Yogi Adityanath said, “In a democracy, everyone has the right to speak in a democratic way but those who cause chaos should not be under any kind of illusion as the government has a solution to every problem.”

Maintaining that protesters who destroyed public property “on the signal of PFI and SIMI” have now realised that their assets will be confiscated, Yogi said, “The government will recover the losses from those who damaged public property.”

“Now, these people are trying to ruin the atmosphere by using their women and children as a shield,” he said, adding that previous governments used to plead with miscreants but the one led by him knows how to deal with them.

On CAA, the CM said, “The CAA is connected with India’s heritage. It has been the tradition of India to protect the people who come here for shelter. The CAA is a law for granting citizenship not for taking citizenship away. The opposition must understand its reality.”

Title: Poor connectivity renders devotees’ phones useless
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Allahabad: Miles away from her family, Pratapgrah native Kalpana describes kalpwas as a ‘spiritually blissful’ experience. However, she often is unable to share her experience with her family given the poor mobile connectivity at the Magh Mela venue.

Hundreds of devotees, especially the kalpwasis, have been reeling under problems spurred due to the poor mobile connectivity at the Magh Mela ground.

This is the time that 45-year-old Kalpana and her neighbour Sushila have visited the Magh Mela as kalpwasis. “It is a unique experience to spend a month on the banks of Ganga, while leading an austere life. We share joy, perform rituals and attend religious discourses. My experience is the only thing that I would be taking back with me. However, I find it difficult to share my experience with my family due to the connectivity snags,” said Kalpana.

Another devotee, Kunti said, “This is the first time that we are facing such a problem. Despite having a mobile phone, we aren’t able to use it for the most basic of all tasks, which is making a call.”

Kinnar Akhara’s acharya mahamandleshwar Laxmi Narayan Tripathi said scores of devotees, seers and kalpwasis, who were staying in camps at the ground, are facing troubles due to lack of connectivity.

Another kalpwasi Sundar said, “During our visit, we have had a number of experience and would like to share it with our family members, but are unable to because of the poor network.”

Mela Adhikari Rajnish Mishra said that additional mobile towers of all service providers have been set up on the Mela ground. As these mobile towers were set up just two days back, we are experiencing some teething troubles,” he added.

Title: Sena MP demands mate for tiger C1
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: Shiv Sena MP Prataprao Jadhav has demanded a mate be brought for tiger TWLS-T1-C1. The peripatetic wildcat has been shuffling between Ajanta Hills in Aurangabad and Dnyanganga wildlife sanctuary in Buldhana district.

Saying that he wants the male tiger to settle down, Jadhav told TOI that he has sent a request note to the forest secretary on Thursday. C1, which stepped out of Tipeshwar Wildlife Sanctuary on June 23, 2019, has logged over 1,900km till now in the last 7 months and is still moving. As reported by TOI earlier, this is the longest recorded tiger dispersal in the country.

“C1 has travelled through six districts and of the late it has been shunting between the Dnyanganga and Ajanta in search of mate. Wandering for such a long distance continuously poses risk to the tiger as well as the villagers,” said Jadhav.

Officials expected C1 to move towards Muktai Bhawani Conservation Reserve in Jalgaon district where there are tigers but it didn’t happen. Plans are being explored to translocate the male in Melghat tiger reserve, which is 70km from Dnyanganga.

The MP was told by forest officials that the tiger went to Ajanta Hills for a second time and is now returning. “If a tigress is released in the sanctuary, C1 could settle down. Tiger population will open tourism avenues in the district and employment to locals,” said Jadhav.

The Sena MP said as of now there are no big carnivores like tigers in Dnyanganga and “their numbers will help maintain ecological balance here”.

State’s chief wildlife warden Nitin H Kakodkar said, “We are exploring the suggestion.”

APCCF & field director of Melghat Tiger Reserve (MTR) MS Reddy was not aware about the MP’s letter but said he was not averse to his suggestions.

“There is no competition in the 200sqkm sanctuary. We have two dams and big water bodies inside the sanctuary with a sizeable prey. There is only one village Devari inside which has voluntarily offered to move out. This will make the sanctuary completely inviolate,” said Reddy.

Like the 149 sq km Tipeshwar Wildlife Sanctuary which has 7 adult tigers, Reddy sees “equal potential in Dnyanganga”. “We cannot strengthen tiger conservation on just probabilities that conflict will occur,” he said.

Title: Water board employs GIS tech to track water leaks
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hyderabad: Gone are the days when authorities used to track water leakages by manual methods. The Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board (HMWS&SB) are now using geographical information systems (GIS) to identify water leakages.

For the first time, the water board had taken the initiative to implement GIS technology for the water supply network at Operation and Maintenance (O&M) Division-VI (SR Nagar) in two sections including SR Nagar and Fathenagar on a pilot project.

After receiving the good results, the HMWS&SB has extended the GIS technology to other sections too and is set to complete the process.

All water lines are being linked to the GIS technology. For each size of the pipeline, different colours have been marked to identify them easily.The water board has marked eight different colours, according to HMWS&SB sources. “These colours would help the water board staff by tracking the areas in which the water line has suffered leaks through GIS technology. In fact, all valves of the pipelines will be linked to this technology,” said a senior HMWS&SB official

Soon after there is a leak in water line, an alert include time, location and size of pipeline will be received by the concerned official. Based on the alert, the staff will reach the location and rectify the leak.

Meanwhile, SMS alerts will be delivered to the mobile phones of the consumers stating that water supply will be affected due to leakage. “As a result, the consumer can take precautions and make alternate arrangements to avoid inconvenience,” added the official. “GIS will also help us to track the leakages of the valves as well. The information of the water source’s valve and the location will be sent to the water lineman too,” said the official.

Title: Congress seniors’ missive to Sonia on selection of new TPCC chief
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hyderabad: The Congress loyalists’ forum, comprising party veterans and seniors, sent a letter to AICC interim president Sonia Gandhi that various factors should be taken into consideration before appointing new TPCC chief .

“Loyalty, commitment to party and ideology, track record, clean image with capability to inspire all sections of the society, to rejuvenate the party and win the confidence of people are very important.,” the forum said.

The letter was signed by NDMA former vice-chairman Marri Shashidhar Reddy, AICC secretary V Hanumantha Rao and All-India Kisan Congress vice-chairman M Kodanda Reddy. TNN

Title: Two arrested for four house burglaries in Kolhapur
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The local crime branch has arrested two suspects for their alleged involvement in four house burglaries in the city.

Police have recovered valuables worth Rs 6.40 lakh from them. Police suspect that the duo’s interrogation may give leads on some more cases of house break-ins.

The arrested have been identified as 24-year-old Rajat Ramchandra Khilare and 40-year-old Dagadu Annappa Devkule alias Yuvraj. Both are residents of Kanannagar, Kolhapur .

“While investigating the cases, we got information from sources that the two youths from Kanannagar were suspects in house break-ins. Based on the information, we traced them and nabbed them for interrogation,” said a senior police officer.

“During the interrogation, the duo confessed of committing four house burglaries in the city. They were working as workers at building construction sites and used to observe the houses while on duty. After confirming that the residents of the houses are on vacation, they used to make a plan and commit burglaries,” he said.

“We have seized 160-gram gold jewellery worth Rs 6.40 lakh from them. We suspect that they might be involved in more house break-ins reported in the city,” he said.

Title: Pathri action committee mulls legal recourse for Saibaba birthplace status
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

The idol of Saibaba

AURANGABAD: The action committee formed to spearhead the battle for Pathri’s development has announced that it would pursue a legal course to ensure that the town is declared as Saibaba ’s birthplace.

Baba Jani Durani, the NCP MLC and president of the action committee, on Thursday said a legal suit would be filed shortly. “It is unfortunate that the state government has chosen to remain silent on Saibaba’s birthplace status for Pathri. Even if the government has not withdrawn its stand to offer funds for Pathri’s development, it pains the devotees to know that the government is not ready to officially declare this village as Saibaba’s birthplace. The legal battle, therefore, is imminent to establish the claim,” he said.

On the other hand, the majority of trustees managing the Saibaba temple at Pathri said they were against any case to prove the “established fact” that Saibaba was born at Pathri. “All the scriptures and official records have mentioned that Saibaba was born at Pathri. A large number of devotees visit Pathri temple. There is no need to separately go the court on our own for any legal intervention. However, if anybody else, including residents of Shirdi, are keen on taking the matter to the court, we will present our evidence,” a trustee said anonymously.

Besides different scriptures and religious literature, the official government website of Parbhani district administration describes Pathri as Saibaba’s birthplace. “In the 1970s, field research established that Saibaba was born in Pathri village. Sri Sai Smarak Samiti (Sai memorial committee) was formed in Pathri. The committee purchased land for the temple on the site of Saibaba’s house and the construction work started in 1994. In 1999, the temple was inaugurated,” the website reads.

Meanwhile, Meghana Sakore-Bordikar, the BJP MLA from Jintur in Parbhani, has demanded that Pathri be renamed ‘Sai Dhaam’. The first-time MLA has written to the district administration and the state government.

Title: Vadodara: Income tax surveys 2 firms for tax evasion
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

VADODARA: The income tax department on Thursday cracked down on an investment firm and a private company and conducted surveys on their premises in the city.

Different teams of I-T officials began conducting the survey in the morning with a group of state reserve police (SRP) for security purposes.

According to sources, the I-T department had received information about tax evasion on revenues by these firms following which it decided to conduct the surveys. The investment firm’s offices in Sayajigunj were surveyed and important documents were scanned. The I-T department is hoping to unearth tax evasion worth crores. I-T officials also raided an oil and solvent firm in Akota area.

Sources said that the survey will continue for a couple of days to ascertain the amount of tax allegedly evaded by both the firms. The I-T department has also issued tax demand notices worth hundreds of crores of rupees to a couple of companies in the city over last few days. The companies have been asked to give explanation and pay up the dues.

Title: Jaipur Literature Festival not aligned to Rajasthan tourism strategy: Vishvendra Singh
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Vishvendra Singh

JAIPUR: Even as chief minister Ashok Gehlot was inaugurating the JLF on Thursday and heaping praises on the event, his cabinet colleague and tourism minister Vishvendra Singh tweeted saying that the festival is not aligned with the marketing strategy of Rajasthan tourism department. The minster had also reportedly recommended cancelling the tourism department’s sponsorship for the event.

Reacting to news reports that the tourism minister had skipped the inauguration after being annoyed with JLF organisers, Singh tweeted, “There is no anger. Just that I don’t think the festival is aligned with our marketing strategy for Jaipur or Rajasthan for that matter. The synergy was not enough for me to spare the marketing revenue they wanted.”

The tweet came immediately after Gehlot had showered praises on JLF during his inaugural address. Gehlot said, “JLF is the pride of Rajasthan, it has carved a place for itself in the world. Everyone is in awe of it. I hope the festival will inspire the new generation. It is being talked about across the world. All the literary people discuss this festival, they feel at JLF they will get a chance to say their ‘mann ki baat' as well as ‘kaam ki baat'.”

The tourism department had approved Rs 30 lakh for the event as it commands a global audience.

Officials in the tourism department said the sponsorship deal with the organizers could not be scrapped. “Much of the promised deliverables have been made and it cannot be rolled back,” said an official.

Interestingly, the tourism minister is scheduled to speak at the event on January 27 on the session ‘Secrets of Amber by Rashmi Dickinson’.

Later in the day, in a press release, Sanjay Roy, managing director of Teamworks that organises the event, said, “We are looking forward to welcoming the honourable tourism minister, Shri Vishvendra Singh Bharatpur, when he joins us in a session on responsible and sustainable tourism.”

Singh has been in news for tussles with the bureaucrats of his department. A controversy also came to the fore after the minister wrote to the tourism principal secretary for cancelling a light and sound show project for which the Centre had released Rs 45 crore.

Title: Parents request Amit Deshmukh to scrap 70:30 MBBS quota
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: Three-time Congress MLA from Latur Amit Deshmukh becoming the medical education minister has rekindled the hopes of students and parents who are demanding the scrapping of the contentious 70:30 quota for MBBS admissions.

The unique quota, which exists only in Maharashtra, has been allegedly shattering dreams of several medical aspirants from the Marathwada region every year.

While Dilip Walse-Patil (Pune), Jitendra Awhad (Thane), Vijaykumar Gavit (Nandurbar) and Girish Mahajan (Jalgaon) served as medical education ministers in Maharashtra during the tenures of three different state governments in the past, it is for the first time that the key portfolio is handed over to Amit Deshmukh, who is from Marathwada.

Deepak Rajhans, one of the parents whose ward is preparing for entrance examination for MBBS admissions, said it is high time the state delivered justice to the students from Marathwada.

“The issue of 70:30 quota for MBBS admissions simply needs corrective measures in the policy making. We feel that the issue has become more of a political in nature than the academic. We appeal to the new medical education minister to scrap the contentious quota and protect the interest of students willing to become doctors in future,” Rajhans said.

Dilip Deshmukh, chief coordinator of CET cell of Rajarshi Shahu Junior Science College, Latur, said that a delegation of colleges, parents and students met Deshmukh after becoming the medical education minister and sought his help in the doing away with the 70:30 quota.

“We are again going to meet him on January 26 and request him to intervene in the issue. We also seek his help in expediting the legal battle waged by stakeholders from Marathwada to strike down the court,” he said.

Maharashtra witnesses admission to MBBS course from three regions — Marathwada, Vidarbha, and the rest of the state. Leaving out All India quota of 15%, 70% of the seats in colleges in each region out of remaining total 85% state quota seats are reserved for candidates from that particular region while rest 30% are kept aside for students from other region. Contending that the number of medical colleges in Marathwada are relatively less as compared to aforesaid two other regions, students, parents and colleges have been pressing for doing away with the formula of 70:30 quota for medical admissions in the state.

When contacted, Deshmukh said that he has received representations from stakeholders demanding scrapping of the quota in question. “Being from Marathwada, I know the issue at large. However, I am planning to meet with different stakeholders across the state to study pros and cons of the matter. We will ensure no deserving student has to compromise on the dream of becoming a doctor,” he said.

Title: Police, banks advise people to beware of KYC scam
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: The cyber police and the authorities of a nationalised bank have advised citizens to be extra vigilant and avoid getting cheated by a new scam, the modus operandi for which has been designed by cybercriminals to commit the crime in name of Know Your Customer ( KYC ) completion process.

“The fraudsters target customers by asking them to download a mobile or desktop app to allegedly facilitate the KYC verification process. The app helps criminals in gaining the access to the PIN of the customers and then the fraudsters can easily empty out the linked bank account in multiple successive transactions,” the bank has said in a communication issued to its customers.

The bank authorities have issued a set of do’s and don’ts to ensure that their customers do not fall prey to the evolved modus operandi of criminals.

“Customers strictly avoid downloading any such mobile or desktop app as per suggestion given on a random phone call, posing as bank employees. The banks at large have not come out with any process to carry out KYC verification of customers using mobile or desktop app. The customers are encouraged to bring such fraud calls to the notice of banks and law enforcing agencies,” bank authorities said.

Confirming the incidents of aforesaid ‘ KYC scam ’ in few parts of the country, cyber cell authorities said that the citizens must take extra caution while dealing with phone calls asking for KYC verification.

“The banks at large never ask for KYC verification once the account is opened as the necessary formalities are done before the account is activated. Moreover, banks never use any app or online link for KYC verification,” Kailash Deshmane, in-charge of cyber cell at Aurangabad police commissionerate, said.

The cyber sleuths have appealed to the citizens to be aware of apps requiring to fill in the bank, Aadhaar and mobile number details among other confidential information.

Title: UDBHAV-2020 to motivate youth for entrepreneurship
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Kanpur: Young Indian minds should do survey to find problems faced by public and get solutions to become technopreneur. This was stated by Dr Vandana Kalia during UDBHAV-2020 that was organised by Startup Incubation and Innovation Centre (SIIC) at IIT-Kanpur on Wednesday. The event was to motivate the young minds towards entrepreneurship.

Chaired by Dr Vandana Kalia, department of scientific and industrial research, the event saw renowned names including ministry of science and technology, Umang Mistry, SIDBI Bank, Prof S Ganesh, dean research and development, IIT Kanpur, Prof Amitabha Bandyopadhyay, professor-in-charge, SIIC IIT-Kanpur and Dr Nikhil Aggarwal, CEO First-IITK.

Prof S Ganesh spoke about the whole gamut of incubation facilities and services offered to innovators to convert their ideas into commercially viable products.

DSIR representative, Dr Vandana Kalia, delivered an information session covering an overview of DSIR’s active role in supporting innovators in Green Technology, Clean Energy, Industrially Utilizable Smart Materials, Affordable Healthcare and Waste to Wealth and allied areas.

As a part of UDBHAV 2020, SIIC IITK also conducted a PAN Indiaideation-stage business competition that attracted good quality enthusiastic applications not only from UP but from states like MP, West Bengal, Maharashtra.

Making a special mention to a Class IX student applying for competitive exams, Prof Bandyopadhyay opined, Innovation has no age, bar and is beyond the bounds of formal education.

The jury comprised Dr Vandana Kalia, Umang Mistry and a team of IITK faculty members namely Prof BV Phani, Prof Ankush Sharma, Prof Tarun Gupta and Prof Amitabha Bandyopadhyay. The winning team of Dhirendra Kumar won Rs 50,000 cash rewards for developing a vertical lathe machine, followed by Dr Bhuvana who won Rs 25000 cash prize for developing biodegradable packaging material from chitosan and agricultural waste.

Title: Braving cold, protesters against CAA vow to keep flame burning
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Protesters at Mohammad Ali Park near Halim crossing in Chamanganj continue their stir

Kanpur: Protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) at Mohammad Ali Park in Chamanganj area continued on Wednesday even as chief minister Yogi Adityanath addressed a rally in the city to drum up support for the new law.

People, including women and youngsters, joined the protest in large numbers and claimed that the citizenship law is unconstitutional and discriminatory. Holding placards reading ‘No CAA, No NPR, No NRC’, the protesters waved the national flag and sang patriotic songs.

Women protesters said they would continue their protest against the law as it was biased against a particular community.

Mohammad Ali Park near Halim crossing in Chamanganj has been witnessing anti-CAA protests on the lines of Shaheen Bagh in Delhi. Protests in Kanpur, however, are confined to this park where people from different faiths and communities are joining in. Shahbuddin, a protestor, said CAA was against one community and the government should withdraw it. “People from all walks of life are protesting here. However, we are not allowing any politician to participate in the protest,” he added. Hilmi, a woman protester, said: “The government should also give citizenship to Muslims facing persecution in Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. Why Muslims have been left out by the government?”

Women protesters said they were braving extreme weather just to demand that the government should roll back the law as it was against the Constitution.

Title: ‘Ensure kids living in rural areas not deprived of edu’
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: All the other options of service could be charity but educating a person is an act of empowering them. Education is of utmost importance to every human being and it is our duty to make sure that no children, even in the deep rural areas, are deprived of schooling, said Ravidev Gupta, president of Ekal Vidyalaya Foundation, on Thursday.

Gupta was delivering the presidential address at the inauguration of Vigyan Mahotsav ‘Vision 2020’, a three-day science exhibition for school and college students organized as part of Khasdar Sanskrutik Mahotsav.

The exhibition has been organized jointly by Khasdar Sanskrutik Mahotsav Samiti, My Science Lab (MSL), Stree Shikshan Prasarak Mandal, Natraj Niketan Sanstha and Nagpur education department at Mahila Mahavidyalaya, Nandanvan.

Present at the programme were Ravindra Fadnavis, president of Stree Shikshan Prasarak Mandal, Sandip Rathod, deputy commissioner, tribal development department, MSL co-founders Dhananjay Balpande and Avinash Gaikwad, and director of State Institute of Science Ravindra Ramatkar, among others.

Gupta said, “Science is an integrated developmental aspect and its progress is vertical. The foundation is laid right from the education one attains in elementary school. “We can strive to reach a level of perfection by acquiring knowledge and contributing our part in utilizing the resources at our disposal to discover and invent innovative projects.”

Fadnavis said, “Union transport minister Nitin Gadkari took this initiative with the aim of generating scientific curiosity among students and to give a push to their efficiency. Witnessing the power of students’ imagination through models proves that they are developing their thoughts on their own.”

Speaking on the occasion, Rathod urged students to participate in the exhibition in large numbers. He said the expo is a great medium to give exposure to scientific aptitude of students. Balpande noted that the theme of this exhibition is based on vision of former President of India APJ Abdul Kalam.

The exhibition gave platform to nearly 120 projects made my students and invited participation of hundreds of schools in and around the city.

(Reporting by Manshika Vaikkath)

Title: Delhi-based journo detained in Aligarh while covering anti-CAA protest
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Agra: Police in Aligarh on Thursday detained a Delhi-based journalist who had come to cover an anti-CAA protest by women in Shahjamal area of the city. Shaheen Abdulla’s detention set off another set of protest as locals, mostly women and students, reached the police station and demanded his release.

Abdulla, in his early 20s, was released after over four hours of detention on personal bond. A journalist with Maktoob Media-- a local news website-- Abdulla was live streaming the protest of Facebook when he was detained by police.

After his release, Abdulla alleged that police used derogatory remarks against him. “Police asked me about my background. When I told them that I am a student of Jamia Millia Islamia and hail from Kerala, they immediately took me with them,” Abdulla told TOI.

Abdulla said his phone and camera were also seized by police at 2pm, and he was released four-and-a-half hour later. “I told them that I work as a journalist and had come to Aligarh to cover the anti-CAA protests,” said Abdullah.

Soon after Abdulla’s detention, AMU students along with the women protestors of Shahjamal gathered outside the police station in Sasni Gate and demanded his immediate release.

According to AMU students, who went to the police station, Abdulla was released after two local residents gave his guarantee and submitted their ID proofs. Abdulla thanked the students who supported him. Several attempts to get police version proved futile.

Title: AU likely to revamp faculty recruitment cell, appoints new director
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Allahabad: Days after the varsity drew flak for irregularities in hiring process of teachers during former vice-chancellor RL Hangloo’s tenure, Allahabad University ( AU ) appointed a new director for the faculty recruitment cell (FRC) on Thursday.

AU’s officiating vice-chancellor RR Tewari appointed Jayant Nath Tripathi from earth and planetary sciences department as FRC’s new director. The cell will have two deputy directors too.

Earlier, DK Chauhan was heading the cell as its chairman, while Vivek Kumar Tewari from the physics department was its director.

Officials said that most members of the FRC are believed to be close to Hangloo. However, with the change of guard, there is a strong possibility that the new VC might reconstitute the FRC.

On Thursday, the registrar issues a notification announcing Tripathi’s appointment. Besides, Anoop Kumar from the economics department and Prakash Kumar Singh from department of earth and planetary sciences were appointed as FRC’s deputy directors.

Currently, there are over 550 vacant teaching positions in AU. The varsity recently received a green light from the ministry of human resources development to begin the recruitment process, which were kept in abeyance over the past six months.

The ministry also directed AU authorities to stop all recruitment processes for teachers started in June 2019.

“The team has a huge responsibility on its shoulders and we will try to fill up a chunk of vacant teaching positions before the new academic session starts, so that the teacher-taught ratio (TTR) at AU improves,” said Tripathi.

Title: At least a dozen injured after head-on collision of two UP roadways buses
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

MEERUT: At least a dozen people were injured on Thursday morning after two UP Roadways buses collided head-on in Kithore area near Machhra police post. The injured were rushed to a nearby community health centre, from where the critical patients were referred to Meerut district hospital.

Rojent Tyagi, station house officer at Kithore police station, said, “The accident occurred early morning on Thursday when two UP Roadways buses collided head-on. At least a dozen passengers were injured and were rushed to the community health centre. Some of those who were critical were later referred to Meerut district hospital.”

Police seized both buses and have set up a probe in the matter. “Both bus drivers are at large. An investigation is on to find out how the accident occurred. UP Roadways authorities have been contacted and efforts are on to find the drivers,” said Tyagi.

Title: 270-year-old Company Garden renamed Subhas Chandra Garden
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

MEERUT: The 270-year-old Company Garden in Saharanpur was rechristened Subhas Chandra Garden on Thursday, on the occasion of the 124th birth anniversary of Netaji. The name, Company Garden, authorities say, symbolizes East India Company’s rule in India. It was changed on the occasion of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose’s anniversary. A grant of over Rs 8 crore has been given for the garden’s facelift . It will now have fountains, a theme-based park, yoga pedestal, internal roads and pathways and other facilities.

Alok Kumar Pandey, Saharanpur district magistrate, said, “It is a historic day as the name of Company Garden has been changed to Subhas Chandra Garden after the freedom fighter. The garden’s name in a symbolic reminder of East India Company’s rule in India. Hence, it has been renamed after the freedom fighter.”

With the name change, also comes a budget of over Rs 8 crore for the garden’s facelift under the Smart City Project initiative. “A budget between Rs 8 crore and Rs 10 crore has been released for the park. This will include construction of internal roads, fountains, theme-based parks, yoga pedestal, proper lighting and sitting areas. All of this will be ready within six months and then opened to public. Meanwhile, care will be taken that not a single tree is cut in the process,” said Vijay Kumar, divisional commissioner, Saharanpur.

Authorities said trees will have their names written on them so that the area can be developed into an eco knowledge centre in future. “I want to thank all the people who sent proposals for the name change. The area will also have an open gym, toilet blocks and a medicinal plants section, among other things,” said Pandey.

Title: Gujarat: Man gets life term for sodomy, murder
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

Title: Anjani Kumar selected for Best Election Practices Award 2019
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hyderabad: City police commissioner Anjani Kumar has been selected by the Election Commission of India for the Best Election Practices Award 2019 . He will receive the prestigious National Award for Best Security Practices from President Ram Nath Kovind on January 25 at New Delhi. TNN

Title: Two booked for kidnapping college girl student in Kolhapur
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

KOLHAPUR: The Kolhapur police have registered a case of kidnapping after a girl student was allegedly taken away by two youths from the college entrance on Wednesday morning.

According to the police, two youths driving a car approached the girl, who was waiting at the college entrance during college hours. She stepped into the car and has not been seen since. The police are on their lookout.

“At the initial level, we cannot confirm whether the girl was kidnapped or she eloped with the suspects. Eyewitnesses have said that the girl did not refuse to get into the vehicle when the duo approached her at the college gate,” said a police officer.

The police said they are confirming information with the passers-by and witnesses. “We are gathering information about the probable suspects based on the statement of the victim’s parents. We are also checking the call detail records to find out if anyone was in touch with the victim and was aware of the victim’s routine,” the officer said.

The officer added, “Our teams are gathering information about criminals on record having similar history to check if they are involved in this case or are associated with anyone involved in this,” he said.

Title: Back-to-back robberies on Yamuna Expressway as armed gang targets vehicles
Content:
The gang users sharp metal objects to puncture tyres and rob at gunpoint

AGRA: Mathura district witnessed back-to-back robberies on Yamuna expressway of Naujheel police limits late on Wednesday. Members of the gang used sharp metal objects to puncture tyres of vehicles and then rob at gunpoint. Mathura district magistrate’s (DM) car also reported flat tyre and had to be escorted by local police to safety. The police have now formed several teams to nab the gang members.According to robbed victims, most of the gang members were wearing khaki trousers with black jackets. Police said that all accused were in their early 30s as per victims’ descriptions.The first incident took place at 10:45 pm near milestone 65, when an Agra-based sports stadium developer, Vikram Gupta, 42, was heading home along with his driver Chote Khan. They were robbed at gunpoint by puncturing the hatchback’s tyre with sharp metal wedge. Two mobile phones, laptops, Rs 8,000 in cash and credit/debit cards were reportedly snatched away.Speaking to TOI, Gupta said, “We had travelled for 5 km after crossing Jewar toll, when suddenly two tyres of my car got punctured. While my driver was changing a tyre, a group of six to seven men armed with two country-made pistols and baton surrounded us. They snatched our belongings and ran away to nearby mustard field after jumping over barbed wire fence.”“Since our phones were taken away, we immediately went towards Mathura toll with flat tyres and informed the toll staff about the incident,” Gupta, who is a resident of Sadar, added.Later at 2.30 am, a Kanpur-based garment store owner Prateek Shukla, 25, heading back home from Delhi along with his friend Vidith Jha, 26, and driver Mukesh Kumar Pal, 42, in SUV were robbed of nearly Rs 1.25 lakh worth of belongings at gunpoint at milestone 63.Shukla said, “We were cruising at 100 kmph when suddenly two tyres of my SUV got punctured with a loud sound. Fortunately, my driver Mukesh managed to control the car and parked it on the left lane. I, immediately, dialled toll free number of Yamuna expressway for help, but before rescue team could arrive, a gang of five to six men with weapons and sticks surrounded us and started searching our pockets and the vehicle.”“They took away my two bags in which I was carrying Rs 80,000 worth of jeans for my store. The gang also snatched one bag each of my friend and driver in which they had kept their wallets, phones and IDs. I managed to save my phone in time, as I threw it on the nearby grass,” Shukla said, adding, “While crossing Jewar toll, e-way staff had warned us about possible movement of robbers on expressway. A commuter was targeted earlier in the night.”Interestingly, between the two incidents, Mathura DM Sarvagya Ram Mishra, who was also heading back to his residence from the national capital region, reported flat tyre, after which he called local police to escort him to a safer location.Major (retired) Manish Singh, in-charge coordinator of Yamuna expressway (Mathura-Agra section), said, “On reaching toll, when Vikram Gupta informed our staff about the robbery which had occurred at 10:30 pm, we immediately alerted UP police patrol teams, but they found no one in the area. Later on, the team spotted DM Mathura’s punctured car tyre and escorted him till the toll. By 2:30 am, our control centre again received news of another robbery near the same spot.”“Between milestones 63 and 65, near Awakheda village, at least seven vehicles reported flat tyres but only two were targeted by robbers. The robbers had cut barbed wires to enter expressway stretch and target the vehicles,” he added.SHO Tappal (Aligarh), SHO Naujheel (Mathura) and ASP crime Mathura Radhey Shyam Rai visited the spot, later DIG Mathura Shalabh Mathur and IG Agra range Satish Ganesh visited as part of investigation.Speaking to TOI on Thursday, inspector general of police (Agra range), Satish Ganesh, said, “After the expressway control room alert, SHO Tappal along with his team went for patrol on Yamuna expressway stretch covering 10-15 km, but unfortunately the patrolling was done on the stretch before Jewar toll (towards Noida) due to faulty information shared by e-way control room.”“Our initial probe suggests that the gang members first hid in the nearby mustard fields and used sharp metal objects to target vehicles. After their act, they fled away using the unmetalled road along the expressway. We have formed several teams to nab them. We have also scanned the records of 15-20 history-sheeters who have been active in the area. The main accused will be arrested soon,” he added.

Title: Prior planning by cops aids traffic run smoothly on rally day
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Agra: Effective planning and timely implementation of traffic diversion ahead of BJP pro-CAA rally, helped commuters to travel in the city without much hassle on Thursday.

Regular traffic was banned on roads from all four directions heading towards the rally venue, which was organised at Kothi Meena Bazar. All heavy vehicles, including city buses, trucks and milk and fuel tankers were not allowed entry on city’s arterial M G Road. Such vehicles were diverted towards Yamuna Kinara road to reach Water Works intersection to continue further journey on NH-2.

Vehicles which ferried tens and thousands of BJP supporters from Etah, Firozabad, Mathura, Aligarh, Hathras, Fatehpur Sikri, Mainpuri and other areas were provided proper parking on GIC ground, Agra College ground and other designated places. The traffic diversion were implemented since 10 am to 4 pm.

Mukesh Singh, a Sanjay Place-based trader, said, “The traffic was usual like any other day. It didn’t feel that there was a political rally in the city.”

Mohammad Abrar, resident of Jaipur House, said, “It was a well planned and executed traffic management. Even after the rally got over, there was not much hassle on the roads.”

Prashant Kumar Prasad, superintendent of police, traffic, said, “We did not receive any complaints on traffic congestion or related issues the entire day. Everything went peacefully.”

Title: Delhi: 11 hurt as Cluster bus rams vehicle with 27 schoolkids
Content:
Seven students and an attending teacher were injured

NEW DELHI: A group of 27 schoolchildren travelling in a contract carriage had a close shave when a rashly driven Cluster scheme bus rammed their vehicle near the Sagar Ratna crossing in west Delhi’s Naraina on Thursday morning. Seven students and an attending teacher were injured, while at least two occupants of the Cluster bus and its woman marshal were also hurt. The errant driver, Prabhat Malik, was arrested on the spot.Eyewitnesses said the Cluster bus was driving down the Loha Mandi flyover at a high speed and had jumped the signal when the other bus, carrying the students of Salwan Public School in Rajendra Nagar, was taking a U-turn near the Naraina fire station. The Cluster bus, coming from Shivaji Stadium, hit the other vehicle in the middle, making it overturn.Principal Indu Khetarpal said the bus was hired by the school to ferry students.A group of firemen heard the crash at the fire station and rushed to the spot. The students got injured as they fell on top of each other. “The emergency exit of the bus was opened and the rear windshield was cut to rescue the students,” said Ravinder Singh, additional divisional officer of the station, who also informed police around 7am.“The students were traumatised and crying inside the bus. We calmed them down before pulling them out one by one. One of our men entered the bus to help the students come out of it,” said Singh. The students, who were injured on the face, arms and legs, were taken to two private nursing homes. One student had a fracture on the nose and another on aleg, but all have been discharged. Malik has been booked for rash and negligent driving and causing hurt due to negligence.“My child is still traumatised. He has been recalling how the orange bus cut through the traffic and hit their bus, which, he said, had stopped to let other vehicles pass. He needed stitches on the head,” said the mother of a Class VI student, who was informed by the school authorities.The principal said most of the injured students were discharged after first aid. “A Class XI student was brave enough to come to school after the accident and attend classes till the end. His parents also came to school,” said Khetrapal. “At the end of the day, everyone is safe. We have a WhatsApp group for every bus, which was used to inform the parents,” the principal added.The bus was packed as the school had an internal examination. “We have asked police to find out if the school bus driver was also at fault,” said Ashish Kumar, a relative of an injured student.Cluster bus marshal Reeta Singh, who took part in the rescue operations despite being injured, said, “The bus didn’t slow down despite the driver having applied the brakes.”A Delhi government official said the transport department had started an inquiry. “Prima facie, it seems the traffic signal was not working at the intersection. The Cluster bus was on the main road and the signal was green while the school vehicle was coming from a smaller road where the signal was not working. The Cluster bus driver swerved the vehicle towards the left but couldn’t avoid the collision,” he said. Cluster buses are run by Delhi Integrated Multi-Modal Transit System.

Title: Telangana: Man survives without food for six days
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

HYDERABAD: A 32-year-old disabled man, who got on to the asbestos roof of a seeds godown in Alwal, remained trapped inside the locked godown for six days without food and water after the roof caved in. On Wednesday, locals noticed him and rushed him to hospital. According to police, he is recuperating and out of danger.

The victim was identified as 32-year-old Wahed from Hasmathpet . According to locals, Wahed was unemployed and suffering from a minor physical disability. On January 16, Wahed got on to the asbestos roof of an abandoned seeds company godown. “A small portion of the roof caved in and Wahed fell inside the locked godown. As no one heard his screams, he remained in the godown till January 22 evening when some locals heard his screams and alerted the godown owners It appears like he ate mud in the godown,” Wahed’s neighbour Razak said.

Wahed was immediately rushed to a local hospital for treatment.

Title: SC recommends seven to be elevated as Rajasthan High Court judges
Content:
Chandra Kumar Songera

Devendra Kachhawa

Manoj Kumar Vyas

JAIPUR: The Rajasthan High Court is likely to get seven new judges soon, taking the total number of judges to 28. The Supreme Court collegium has recommended the elevation and sent the names of seven judges to the Centre for approval. Out of the seven, one will be appointed from the court while six others will be elevated from judicial services.Currently, there are 21 judges in the high court, including the chief justice, against the total approved posts of 50 judges.The collegium meeting held on January 20, chaired by Supreme Court Chief Justice, gave the nod to elevate advocate Manish Sisodia as a high court judge. Others who are to be elevated are Devendra Kachhawa, Satish Kumar Sharma , Prabha Sharma, Manoj Kumar Vyas , Rameshwar Vyas and Chandra Kumar Songera .Three high court judges—Justice Mahendra Maheshwari (March 31), Justice GR Moolchandani (April 2) and Justice Abhay Chaturvedi (September 9)—are set to retire this year.The high court has had a shortage of judges since May 2018 when nine out of the 11 names sent by the HC collegium to be considered for elevation were sent back.According to high court sources, there are nearly 4.53 lakh pending cases till November 2019, which include nearly 2.74 lakh with the Jaipur bench and 1.79 lakh with the Jodhpur bench.

Title: Special trains to Delhi via Manmad
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: In order to clear the rush of passengers, the South Central Railway (SCR) has announced two special trains between Yadgir in Karnataka and New Delhi from next month.

The Yadgir–New Delhi special train, bearing number 07423, will leave Yadgir at 5.40pm on February 13 and reach New Delhi at 4.30am on February 15.

In the return direction, New Delhi–Yadgir special (07424) will leave New Delhi at 9.30pm on February 17 and reach the destination at 12.45 pm on February 19.

Enroute, these special trains will stop at Wadi, Kalaburagi, Solapur, Daund, Manmad , Khandwa, Itarsi, Bhopal, Bina, Jhansi, Gwalior, Dhaulpur, Agra Cannt and Mathura station in both the directions. The special train will consist of sleeper class and general second class coaches.

Meanwhile, the SCR top-brass on Thursday held a meeting with advertising agencies and railway freight customers including cement companies, fertilizer companies and cab/bike aggregators to discuss various modalities to improve the non-fare revenue, which is generated from non-conventional sources.

Title: Gujarat: Mystery shrouds death of two in Padra
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

VADODARA: Two persons from Narsinhpura village in Padra taluka died under mysterious circumstances on Thursday evening.

The duo identified as Harshad Valand (26) and Soma Padhiyar (45) collapsed near their respective houses around the same time. The villagers made them lie on cots and as the duo did not respond, they were taken to community health centre in Vadu.

At the health centre, the doctor declared them dead on admission. The reason for their death was not immediately known, but locals said that the duo died after consuming illicit country-made liquor.

“We have registered a case of accidental death as of now. The exact reason for their death cannot be known now. We have collected viscera samples and the post-mortem has been done,” said inspector S D Dhobi of Vadu police station. He added that once the post-mortem reveals the reason, appropriate steps will be taken.

Title: 139 trees to go for Smart City Project roads
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: Smart City Project special purpose vehicle Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited (NSSCDCL) has sought permission to cut 139 trees for construction of five roads in Smart City Project area. The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) tree officer has issued a public notice on Friday inviting suggestions and objections on NSSCDCL application despite trees cannot be cut and need to be transplanted for road works as per The Maharashtra (Urban Areas) Preservation of Trees Act, 1975.

NMC garden superintendent Amol Chorpagar has continued to issue public notice in the capacity of Tree Officer despite advocate Ankita Shah registering strong objection. Shah, in a notice to the civic chief, said Chorpagar was of superintendent rank and Tree Officer should be of rank of assistant commissioner or above as per The Maharashtra (Urban Areas) Preservation of Trees Act, 1975.

As per the notice, 68 trees will be cut for the road proposed from Saduru Factory, Navin Nagar to Bhavani Hospital in Pardi, 33 trees for the road from the entrance gate of Shree Bhavani Mata Mandir, Punapur to Bharatwada road, 29 trees for Bhandara national highway to Punapur road, 6 trees for Bharatwada road to Navkanya Nagar and 3 trees for road going towards Navkanya Nagar.

The NMC is constructing roads with a length of 52km in Smart City Project area covering Pardi, Punapur, Bharatwada and Bhandewadi in East Nagpur. The roads are being constructed under tenderSURE concept in which NSSCDCL will construct roads along with all types of amenities like streetlight, storm water drain, sewage network, footpath, road-divider, duct for laying cables, cycling track etc at the cost of around Rs 650 crore.

NSSCDCL had appointed Mumbai-based Shapoorji Pallonji Group for execution of the works. Already, the firm has started works.

After series of protests, the NMC in association with state’s public works department and MahaMetro had dropped plan to construct road through Bharat Van. The road was proposed at the cost of 558 trees. Axe is still hanging over 1,000 trees situated at Empress Van as the Maharashtra State Textile Corporation had proposed to construct road and develop textile and commercial shops on its sprawling land situated in front of Empress Mall and Gandhisagar lake.

Title: UP: Five cattle lifters injured in police encounter
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

MEERUT: After a short lull, West UP once again reverberated with gunshots that left five alleged cattle lifters injured in a gun battle with police at Kaili village in Daurala region on Wednesday night. However, the gang leader, who carries a reward of Rs 25,000, and three of his unharmed accomplices managed to flee. A hunt is on to nab them.

According to police sources, the gang had loaded a bull in a truck in Kaili village and were trying to flee when challenged by a patrolling police team. The gangsters opened fire at the policemen, who returned fire.

The arrested members of the gang confessed to having stolen cattle in Ghaziabad, Hapur , Bulandshahr , Meerut, Moradabad and Shamli districts. While three of those arrested hail from Ghaziabad, the other two belong to Meerut and Hapur, respectively.

According to Jitender Sargam, circle officer, Daurala, “We have arrested five of the alleged culprits but gang leader Bhura, a resident of Ghaziabad, managed to escape. The gang used to wait till sundown before conducting a recce and stealing the animal at night. But we will nab them soon. Those arrested have been identified as Munavvar Ali, Salman, Sohrab , Nauman and Babu. All have been admitted to hospital.”

Title: Give 10% quota to West UP students, they will take care of Jamia Millia Islamia & JNU: Sanjeev Balyan
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Sanjeev Balyan (Photo: Twitter/ @drsanjeevbalyan)

MUZAFFARNAGAR: Union minister of state for animal husbandry, dairying, and fisheries Sanjeev Balyan, who is BJP MP from Muzaffarnagar , said that nobody will be able to make anti-national slogans if people from western Uttar Pradesh are given 10% reservation in Jawaharlal Nehru University (JNU) and Jamia Millia Islamia. Speaking at defence minister Rajnath Singh’s pro-CAA rally in Meerut on Wednesday, Balyan said, “I request Rajnath Ji to give 10% reservation to students from West UP in JNU and Jamia. No one else will be needed and they will take care of those who raise anti-national slogans. There is only one solution for them. This is a message to all those who are protesting against CAA .” Later, Balyan told TOI, “Jamia has 7,000-8,000 students. JNU has almost similar number. Meerut university has double the number of students enrolled in both the universities put together. These students support the CAA but their viewpoint isn’t highlighted in the media. The viewpoint of students in two universities (Jamia and JNU) cannot be the viewpoint of the students of the entire country.” Referring to violent protests in western UP districts after the passage of CAA, Balyan said there were deliberate attempts to stoke unrest in the region. A doctorate in veterinary anatomy from Haryana Agricultural University , Balyan is an accused in the 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots, who was arrested and sent to jail for inflammatory speech. The MoS has made many controversial statements regarding the CAA in the past. Last month, he claimed that 10-12-year-old children studying in madrassas in UP were allegedly involved in stone-pelting and called for a probe on children's participation. Before that, attacking Samajwadi Party chief and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav for saying that he won’t fill NPR form, Balyan said that he will not be allowed to contest elections if he does not follow the National Population Register procedure.

Title: B.Ed student shot at outside Chaudhary Charan Singh University, critical
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: A 28-year-old student of a local college here was shot at in a brazen daylight shootout on the road outside the main gate of Chaudhary Charan Singh University here. According to sources, victim Viswas alias Vishu Chikara is the son of a local teachers' union leader, Ram Bharat Chikara . Vishu was waylaid by assailants who came in a car and opened fire at him before fleeing.

The youth was hit by a bullet near his waist. He was rushed to a private hospital, where his condition continues to be critical. Police have begun primary investigation and are in the process of identifying the suspects. “An FIR under section 307 (attempt to murder) has been registered at the Medical police station against five named suspects and some unnamed ones based on a complaint lodged by Vishu’s father,” said SP, city, Akhilesh Narayan Singh.

Police are also trying to extract CCTV footage from the area to identify the culprits.

According to sources, Vishu, who pursues a Bachelor of Education (BE.d) course at Mahaveer College , is also a sportsperson and practices for shotput at the city stadium. “Earlier this month, he (Vishu) had a scuffle with another sportsperson at the stadium. The shootout incident appears to be a fallout of the ongoing rivalry,” said a sleuth investigating the case.

Brazen shootout in the heart of city near Chaudhary Charan Singh University has again raised the issue of law and order in the district. Several incidents of shootout have happened on CCSU campus following which, security especially at the main gate, was beefed up.

Title: Meerut: BSF jawan killed by wife, younger brother, say cops
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: Two days after a 34-year-old BSF jawan was found shot dead in his farm in Meerut’s Durgeshpur village, his younger brother and wife were on Thursday arrested for the murder . Sanjeev Kumar, who had come home on a vacation from Kashmir, was shot in the head and died on Tuesday evening. His wife,Geetanjali, was inside the field plucking vegetables when she claimed to have heard the gun shot.

According to police sources, Geetanjali and Sanjeev’s younger brother Gulab Singh developed “illicit relationship”. “Both of them planned to kill Sanjeev,” said a police officer.

According to circle officer of Sadar (rural) Akhilesh Bhadauria, “Geetanjali’s statements seemed inconsistent and later call detail report revealed long chats with Gulab Singh. Even before the murder, the woman had spoken with her brother in-law. We detained both and when questioned them. They broke down and confessed to the murder. It was Gulab who had actually killed his own brother. We have also recovered the illegal firearm used in the crime.”

Title: Muzaffarnagar: Former MLA’s son shot dead by ‘stray’ bullet
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: Police were left clueless after a student was killed by what appears to be a stray bullet on Wednesday night, as he sat with his friends inside a house on Parikrama Marg, under New Mandi police station. Upendra Thakur, 24, is the son of former MLA Thakur Moolchand, who was elected twice in 1974 and 1977 from Kandhla and Thanabhawan, while representing the Bhartiya Kranti Dal and Janata Party respectively.

Upendra was taken to the Muzaffarnagar district hospital, where he died during treatment. Police rushed to the spot and launched an investigation. A case was also registered after a relative of the deceased filed a complaint.

According to sources, forensic teams have been pressed into service and call detail reports are being accessed. Deputy Superintendent of Police, Harish Bhadauria, said, “The investigation is on and the case will be solved soon.” New Mandi SHO Deepak Chaturvedi said, “On the basis of a complaint filed by Upendra’s relative, a case under Section 302 (murder) of the IPC has been registered against unidentified killer. Further investigation is on.”

Title: Two ex-students of AMU booked
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Agra: Aligarh police has registered an FIR against eight people, including two ex-students of AMU, in connection with the incident when some students misbehaved with the members of a proctorial team on the campus on January 17.

Confirming this, SSP Akash Kulhary said the two former students’ union office-bearers, Nadeem Ansari and Hamza Sufyan, have been booked along with six unidentified people on a complaint filed by the AMU administration. He said teams have been formed to nab them.

All of them have been booked under IPC section 147 (punishment for rioting), 186 (obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions), 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty), 504 (intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace) at the Civil Lines police station.

Nadeem Ansari and Hamza Sufyan, against whom the district police has already initiated the process of invoking the UP Control of Goondas Act, 1970, allegedly misbehaved with varsity’s proctor Afifullah Khan and asked him to go back when he visited the protest site on January 17 along with his team. The duo had questioned where he was when students were allegedly beaten up by police on December 15.

According to varsity administration, Sufyan had been rusticated by AMU for five years for creating ruckus at the vice-chancellor’s office and for allegedly misbehaving with the varsity employees in July 2019. Ansari is also not a student of AMU any more.

Title: Teacher held for molesting 10-yr-old girl
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Kanpur: A goverment school teacher was arrested on charges of molesting a 10-year-old girl student. The accused has been identified as Lokesh Kumar Tripathi. A case was registered against Tripathi.

The basic education officer KK Jha said that a departmental action will be taken after an inquiry in the case.

According to Kotwali police, Tripathi is a primary school teacher. Parents of a girl student of class VI approached police on Thursday, alleging that he had molested their daughter.

They told police that she narrated her ordeal when she returned home. “Upon query, she took the name of her teacher Lokesh Kumar Tripathi,” said a police official.

Based on the complaint, Kotwali police registered a case under charges of outraging modesty of woman and the POCSO Act. Basic education officer KK Jha, said teacher has been arrested. “We will initiate departmental action after an inquiry,” he added.

Title: Gun used to kill Tamil Nadu cop recovered
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Cops recover a gun, reportedly used by the assailants to execute the crime, from a drainage near the stand

KOCHI: The team of Tamil Nadu police Q-Branch CID, investigating the murder of TN special sub-inspector Y Wilson who was shot dead near Kaliyikkavila check post on January 8, recovered the gun reportedly used by the assailants to execute the crime from a drainage in Kochi during an evidence collection on Thursday.

The gun, identified as a 7.65mm Italian-made automatic pistol loaded with 5 bullets, was recovered by the team from a drainage near the Ernakulam KSRTC bus station around 9.30am in the presence of the two prime accused in the case, Abdul Shameem of Nagercoil and Taufeeq of Thuckalay.

The team led by T O Ganesh, DSP, Q Branch CID and Colachel ASP Vishwesh came to Kochi around 8.45am with the accused. They also took the accused to the shops in the bus station. The search was conducted based on the statements given by the accused and the pistol was recovered within 15 minutes after the evidence collection began.
