Title: Poor enrolment: Telangana women colleges may turn co-ed
Content: HYDERABAD: Beginning from academic year 2020-21, many women’s degree colleges are likely to become co-ed institutions due to poor enrolment. Colleges are now knocking at Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) doors to make the shift. Recently, the TSCHE had issued a notification seeking proposals from degree colleges intending to convert from women’s college to co-ed institutions. Following this, several colleges from the city are expected to approach the TSCHE in order to make the shift by January 31.“There are many women’s colleges in Hyderabad which are able to fill only 50% to 60% seats every year. While women’s colleges in districts have higher enrolment, women’s colleges are not able to secure as many admissions in Hyderabad,” said president of Telangana Degree and Post-Graduate Colleges Association, Ramana Reddy.Change in parents’ mindsets towards gender parity is cited as one of the key reasons why a higher number of women’s colleges are willing to convert to co-ed institutions. “Earlier, there was a lot of concern over female students’ security due to which parents preferred an all-women’s college. But now, the mindset has changed as parents have understood that their daughters have to eventually work with men once they are employed,” said Fareetha Farzana, principal of Shine Degree College, LB Nagar.Officials claim that there is a 60:40 ratio between male and female students in degree colleges due to which managements are preferring to switch to co-ed. “Colleges have realised that if they switch from a women’s college to co-ed, they will be catering to a larger market wherein chances of vacant seats will be lower,” said TSCHE chairman Papi Reddy .In order to make the shift, managements will have to submit letters from students, parents and staff (teaching and non-teaching) expressing their willingness in writing for conversion of the college before January 31.

Title: Deaths in road accidents dip by over 17% in Uttarakhand in 2019
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

DEHRADUN: In some good news pertaining to road safety in the Himalayan state, the numbers of road accidents and related causalities have seen a drop last year as compared to 2018.

According to police department data, in 2019, Uttarakhand witnessed 867 fatalities in road accidents, compared to 1,047 in 2018, registering a decline of over 17%.

The number of road accidents too has shown a decline of around 8% with 1,352 road accidents witnessed last year, compared to 1,468 accidents in 2018. The number of people who sustained injuries in road accidents also declined to 1,457 from 1,571 in 2018.

According to Ashok Kumar, director general (DG) law and order, the decline in the number of accidents and related causalities “is a result of consistent efforts in terms of awareness campaigns and drives.”

However, Udham Singh Nagar district remained the worst performer in terms of road accident-related deaths . As many as 206 people lost their lives in accidents in the district in 2019, compared to 226 in 2018.

Haridwar remained the second worst performer registering 184 deaths in 300 road accidents last year. The numbers were, however, better than 2018, when 200 people died in 345 accidents.

Dehradun, on the other hand, registered increase in the number of road accidents and related causalities in 2019. In 328 road accidents, as many as 168 people were killed, compared to 137 fatalities in 2018.

“Pauri and Uttarkashi districts managed to bring down the number of road accident related deaths by significant numbers in 2019. Besides Dehradun, Rudraprayag also registered a slight rise in the number of accidental deaths,” said Kewal Khurana DIG traffic.

After recording 71 deaths in road accidents in 2018, Uttarkashi registered only 18 deaths in 2019, showing sharp decline of over 74%. Similarly, accident-related deaths in Pauri district dropped to 32 from 83 in 2018.

Title: Heated argument ensues between DMC officials and Shishambara protesters
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Dehradun: Unruly scenes were witnessed at the Dehradun Municipal Corporation (DMC) office on Thursday when around 8 to 10 protesters, who have been agitating against the Shishambara waste management plant, got into a heated argument with the officials.

The protesters, along with BJP MLA Sahdev Singh Pundir, had gone to the DMC office to register their grievance against the stench emanating from the waste plant.

The protesters asked the DMC officials to close the plant, but after getting an unsatisfactory explanation, the people started shouting slogans in the office.

After being escorted out of the office, the protesters raised slogans against the DMC and Uttarakhand government. “We have warned the administration that we will kill ourselves in the DMC office if the plant isn’t closed down or the stench emanating from the plant isn’t controlled,” said Satpal Dhaniya, a protester.

“The administration is corrupt and they are putting our lives at stake for their self-interest. More than 10 people have died due to cancer and most of us are suffering from migraine and skin infections,” said another protester, Neelam Thapa.

Meanwhile, the DMC has stated that from next week more than 100 tonnes of waste would be shifted from the site on a daily basis.

Title: Gujarat cops play Good Samaritans for poor deaf girl
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

RAJKOT: Cops can be ruthless, especially when they go to arrest someone. But the abject poverty and condition of a cheating case accused’s daughter in Sikka Na Patia left sleuths of Rajkot special operations group (SOG) with a lump in their throats.

So moved were the cops when they went to arrest former gold smith Jitu Pala in November last year that they gathered money for treatment of his 12-year-old daughter who was hearing and speech impaired.

SOG had received received an application of complaint that Pala had allegedly cheated two people of Rs 65 lakh when he was working in Rajkot’s Soni Bazar. But in a cruel twist of fate, Pala incurred heavy loss in the business and went bankrupt. He left Rajkot and moved to Sikka na Patia with his family six months ago.

“We found that Pala and his family were living in abject poverty. No accused who had committed a fraud of Rs 65 lakh would suffer such poverty. We realized our that the application was false,” said M A Ansari, sub-inspector with Rajkot SOG.

While at his house, cops discovered that the 12-year-old girl’s disability.

“After Pala’s neighbours testified in his favour and his wife cried, we felt he could not have been involved in cheating. But we told him that he would have to come to Rajkot for investigation formalities. We could not see his daughter’s plight and thought it was our duty to help her,” said Jitubha Zala, head constable with Rajkot SOG.

Four SOG policemen contributed from their own pockets to get her a pair of hearing aids, which has helped her overcome disability.

“My daughter developed complications in her eardrums when she was a year old. She became completely deaf by the time she turned five. They were not cops, but angels in disguise who visited our house two months ago,” said Sheela Pala, the girl’s mother.

At that time, one Rajani Lodhia and his associate identified as Nadha filed an application of complaint against Pala, accusing him of duping them of gold worth Rs 65 lakh.

Title: ‘File report on case against H Raja for remarks on judiciary’
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Madurai: Madras high court has directed the police to file a final report (charge-sheet) within two months in a case registered against the national secretary of BJP, H Raja for his derogatory comments about the judiciary.

S Doraisamy, an advocate from Chennai, in his petition stated that on September 15, 2018, Raja had proceeded to set up a stage to conduct a meeting for the Vinayaka Chathurthi celebrations in Pudukottai district by violating a high court court which prohibited the setting up of a stage in the middle of the road. When the police officials attempted to stop him, Raja picked up an argument in which he passed derogatory comments about the judiciary.

Doraisamy said the Thirumayam police had registered a case against Raja under Sections 143 (unlawful assembly), 153A (promoting enmity between different groups on grounds of religion, race, place of birth, residence, language, etc., and doing acts prejudicial to maintenance of harmony), 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), 294 (b) (sings, recites or utters any obscene song, ballad or words, in or near any public place), 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty), 505 (1) (b) (c) (statements conducing to public mischief), 506 (1) (punishment for criminal intimidation) and 290 (punishment for public nuisance) of IPC.

The principal seat initiated suo motu contempt proceedings against Raja, however, it was closed after he tendered his unconditional apology. He stated that since Raja holds a high post in a political party, the police after registering the case did not conduct any investigation and did not file the charge-sheet yet.

Hence, the petitioner moved the high court Madurai bench last year, seeking to file final report in the case. When the petition heard on Thursday, justice A D Jagadish Chandira gave the direction to the police.

Title: CBI raids actress’s luxury salon in Kochi
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Kochi: The Central Bureau of Investigation conducted a raid at a luxury beauty salon , Nail Artistry owned by actress Leena Maria Paul at Panampilly Nagar in Kochi on Thursday, in connection with an alleged money fraud case. According to CBI sources, the raid was held following an order from anti-corruption bureau in Hyderabad.

Incidentally, it was the same salon which was attacked by two bike-borne assailants in December 2018 on the orders of underworld don Ravi Pujari.

“A case was recently registered by the CBI Hyderabad unit against two people who posed as CBI officers from New Delhi and demanded bribe from a businessman who was accused in a corruption case. The accused spoofed CBI Hyderabad office’s landline number and multiple calls were made to the businessman mobile. The investigation found that one of the accused was familiar to actress Leena. We are yet to ascertain whether the actress has any involvement in the fraud,” said a CBI source.

Title: Human — dam or disaster?
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Nagpur: A dam or disaster? Ten days after the expert committee headed by chief minister’s secretary Vikas Kharge met to discuss the controversial Human dam project proposed in the buffer of Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve (TATR), Uddhav Thackeray will review the issue at a high-level meeting on Friday.

On January 13, the committee — comprising forest and irrigation officials and experts — set up by the state wildlife board (SBWL) discussed the issue, but experts warned that the major dam could spell doom for tigers and humans by flaring up man-animal conflict.

In the last decade, over 140 villagers have died in wild animal attacks in Chandapur district alone. As per the latest estimation, Maharashtra’s tiger count has gone up from 190 in 2014 to 312 in 2018, with Tadoba’s landscape having more than 88 tigers. Construction of Human dam would lead to deprivation of space for tigers.

BJP MLA Sudhir Mungantiwar, on whose insistence the Friday meeting has been called, said, “The issue was discussed with the CM during winter session of assembly in Nagpur. The proposed dam in Sirkada village in Sindewahi will benefit 160 villages along with Chandrapur, and develop irrigation potential for 46,117 hectares.”

During Mungantiwar’s tenure as forest minister in the last government, however, the project was opposed by the SBWL. The four-member National Tiger Conservation Authority (NTCA) committee too, in its report on project appraisal submitted in November 2014, opposed the project.

Apart from Mungantiwar, the meeting will be attended by ministers Vijay Waddetiwar, Jayant Patil, Sanjay Rathod, and others. The ministers did not respond to TOI’s calls, and Kharge chose not to comment.

The major dam will need diversion of 1,925.55-hectare forest land and felling of 1,50,791 trees. The Ministry of Enviornment, Forest and Climate Change (MoEFCC) granted Stage-I in 2004, despite warning by the-then principal conservator of forests (PCCF), wildlife that the dam’s canal and submergence area is a viable corridor used for free movement by animals between Tadoba-Ghodazhari-Bramhapuri.

“This corridor also assumes importance because the huge water body of Irai project near Mohurli has already deprived TATR of viable buffer zones, due to the submergence of pristine forests cutting off of the corridor to high forests of Bhadrawati. Construction of canals will restrict the movement of animals and even if passes are given, it is unlikely that animals will use them,” the-then PCCF’s report said.

Wildlife biologist Aditya Joshi said, “The submergence will break the only linking corridor for tiger movement between Tadoba-Ghodazhari-Umred-Karhandla. The tigers will be forced to cross the agricultural fields, which might in turn increase encounters with humans and lead to more conflict.”

Conservationist Prafulla Bhamburkar said, “The dam falls in the eco-sensitive zone (ESZ) of Ghodazhari, as well as TATR. Additionally, the Tiger Conservation Plan (TCP) of TATR has been approved and thus the proposed forest land is part of the legally notified corridor now.”

“Is there a need for an additional dam? Since the inception of this project in 1983, several irrigation schemes like Gosikhurd, Irai, Ghodazhari, Asolamendha, Nalleshwar, Chargaon and others have come up in Tadoba landscape. Massive mining activity around Tadoba has already destroyed corridors,” said Deepak Dixit, chief of Prakruti Foundation.

“On September 8, 2009, the-then union minister Jairam Ramesh had asked ex-CM Ashok Chavan — who is now a minister in the Thackeray government — not to go ahead with the project considering isolation of Tadoba. However, the same government is now pursuing the project,” said environmentalist Debi Goenka.

Project Puzzle

967.37ha out of 1,925.55ha proposed area is now part of Tadoba buffer

WII says dam site is major corridor joining TATR with Kanha through Navegaon-Nagzira passing through buffer area

Gosikhurd and Nalleshwar irrigation projects almost complete

Command area of these projects includes part of Human project command area

After submergence of this forest area, vital functional corridor will be severed

As per guidelines for taking up no forestry activities in wildlife habitats, approval of Standing Committee of NBWL will be required

In view of above, project needs to be reviewed afresh

Title: Balasaheb never compromised with his ideals: Amit Shah’s tribute to Shiv Sena founder comes as jibe for Uddhav
Content:
Union home minister Amit Shah (ANI photo)

Remembering Balasaheb Thackeray Ji on his Jayanti. Balasaheb Ji was a brilliant intellect of his time, always mesme… https://t.co/1hZpfv0dKt — Amit Shah (@AmitShah) 1579762861000

Tributes to the great Balasaheb Thackeray on his Jayanti. Courageous and indomitable, he never hesitated from raisi… https://t.co/KXT7U7wQ9P — Narendra Modi (@narendramodi) 1579748075000

NEW DELHI: Leaving no occasion to corner BJP’s former ally Shiv Sena, Home minister Amit Shah on Thursday recalled its founder Bal Thackeray as someone who never compromised with his ideals, in what was seen as an attack on the current Sena leadership for aligning with Congress and NCP to form government in Maharashtra.“Remembering Balasaheb Thackeray Ji on his Jayanti. Balasaheb Ji was a brilliant intellect of his time, always mesmerised the masses with his oratory skills. He always stood firm and never compromised with his ideals, Balasaheb Ji’s life and his values will continue to inspire us,” Shah tweeted.Prime Minister Narendra Modi also paid tributes to the Sena founder as he tweeted: “Tributes to the great Balasaheb Thackeray on his Jayanti. Courageous and indomitable, he never hesitated from raising issues of public welfare. He always remained proud of Indian ethos and values. He continues to inspire millions.”While BJP continues to accuse Sena leadership of compromising with the ideals of party’s founder Thackeray, there have been several embarrassing occasions for Uddhaav Thackeray since taking over as CM, whose proposed visit to Ayodhya is being seen as a desperate bid to revamp the party’s hardcore Hindutva image.The announcement of Thackeray’s visit to Ayodhya followed yet another controversial statement of senior Congress leader Ashok Chavan who said his party formed the government in Maharashtra with Shiv Sena on the appeal of Muslims.BJP national spokesperson Meenakshi Lekhi was quick to welcome Thackeray’s decision to visit Ayodhya on completion of 100 days in office and asked if Sena would take Congress along. Rajya Sabha member Sanjay Raut added to the discomfiture of Sena’s allies by tweeting that it wanted its alliance partners to accompany them. “Rahul Gandhi also visits several temples,” Raut said.

Title: Kerala: Woman jumps to death from highrise
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Residents and visitors at the apartment complex near Kathrikadavu railway overbridge look down from the spot w... Read More

KOCHI: In a suspected case of suicide , a 38-year-old woman died on Thursday morning after she reportedly jumped from the tenth floor of the apartment complex where she stayed with her mother and nine-year-old daughter.

The deceased was identified as Elza Leena Maria, a native of Thiruvalla and a resident of a flat in a high-rise apartment complex near Kathrikadavu railway overbridge . The incident happened around 6.15am and her body was found by her mother and daughter on the extension of the second floor of the building. Police said that her estranged relationship with her husband was suspected to be the reason.

According to the North police, she was staying in the flat on the tenth floor of the building. On Thursday, she went out as usual for morning walk on the corridor. Though her daughter also joined her, she asked the girl to go inside and study. At that time, the woman’s mother was busy in the kitchen. A few minutes later they heard a loud thud outside. When her mother and daughter ran to the common corridor, she was not there. On looking downside, they saw her lying on the floor unconscious. Though they alerted the neighbours, police and doctors, the woman was later declared dead.

“Prima facie, it is a case of suicide. The victim used a bicycle to step on it and climb over the high railing of the corridor. Her mother later recovered a suicide note from the apartment and it hinted that she was depressed over the past few months due to the marital discord. She was reportedly undergoing medication for depression too. Her husband was staying in Chennai after being separated from her. Though she joined an aviation academy at Kaloor two months ago as a communicative English tutor, she left the office on Friday after expressing her intention to resign,” said police sources.

Meanwhile, the nearby residents said that Elza was a jovial person who was very active in the activities related to the Church. But they also said that she was not pleasant over the past few days.

North police registered a case of unnatural death under Section 174 of Code of Criminal Procedure. The body was later released to the relatives after conducting postmortem.

As the news of the incident spread, several people gathered around the building and nearby roads. They were later dispersed by the police.

Title: Melavalavu case: Convict gets leave for son’s marriage
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Madras high court has permitted one of the released convicts in the Melavalavu massacre case to visit Madurai for three days to attend his son’s marriage.

K M Ragunath, son of one of convict Manikandan, in his petition, stated that based on an interim order of the high court dated November 27, 2019, his father along with the remaining 12 convicts have been residing in Vellore district . Ragunath said that his father is complying with the court order without breaching any conditions.

He said that his marriage is scheduled to take place at Sivankoil at Melur in Madurai district on January 30. Since his father’s presence is required for his marriage, he sought to modify the condition for his father Manikandan for five days from January 29 to February 2 so that he can attend his marriage.

Hearing the plea, a division bench of justice S S Sundar and justice A D Jagadish Chandira granted permission for Manikandan to visit Madurai to attend his son’s marriage for three days from January 29 to January 31. The judges adjourned the case to January 30 for further hearing.

It maybe recalled that a public interest litigation (PIL) was filed by advocate P Rathinam, appearing as party-in-person challenging the GOs passed for the premature release of the 13 convicts involved in the case. The case involves the massacre of six dalits at Melavalavu on June 30, 1997, by members of another caste following the election of a dalit as the village council president. The state government released all the 13 convicts citing good conduct in November 2019.

Title: Madras high court sets aside OPS kin posting as milk producers’ union chief
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Madras high court

MADURAI: Madras high court has set aside the order appointing O Raja, brother of deputy chief minister O Panneerselvam, as chairman, and the interim board members of Theni District Milk Producers Cooperative Union. Petitioner V P Ammavasai, president of Palanichettipatti primary milk cooperative society, said a GO dated 22.8.2019 was passed by the department of animal husbandry, dairying and fisheries for bifurcating A1301 Madurai district milk producers cooperative union into Madurai and Theni districts.

This meant that there were only six members in the Theni district milk producers cooperative union. The petitioner said that according to the Cooperative Society Rules, 17 members are mandatory for constituting a valid executive committee. He said a meeting was convened on August 24, 2019 and O Raja was appointed chairman and 17 members appointed executive committee / interim board members without following rules. This was based on the order of Theni deputy registrar of the milk production and diary development department on August 26.

Hence, the petitioner moved the HC Madurai bench seeking to restrain the chairman and other board members of Theni district union from functioning. A division bench had passed an interim restraining order on September 12 and the state government filed a petition seeking to vacate it. On Thursday, a division bench of Justice M Duraiswamy and Justice T Ravindran observed that the authorities concerned have cited the wrong provision of the Act based on which the interim board was constituted. Hence the judges set aside the August 26 order of Theni deputy registrar and remitted the matter back to the authorities to pass orders on constituting an interim board or regular board in accordance with the Tamil Nadu Cooperative Societies Act, other rules and by-laws.

Title: Habeas corpus plea of two people rejected
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: Madras high court has dismissed a habeas corpus petition (HCP) filed by a person alleging that the ‘Q’ branch police who have illegally detained both his brothers are attempting to frame them as accused in the SSI Wilson murder case.

In the petition, S Basheer, a resident of Tirunelveli district , stated that his brothers Zakkriya and Hazeeb were taken away by the ‘Q’ branch police officials without any valid reasons. He further stated that though both his brothers do not have any past criminal record, the ‘Q’ branch police are attempting to implicate his brothers in the Wilson murder case. Stating that his brothers are in illegal custody since January 10, the petitioner filed a habeas corpus petition before the high court Madurai bench seeking to produce them before the court.

When the petition was heard on Thursday, the state government informed that Zakkriya and Hazeeb were arrested and remanded in connection with another case and not in the murder case of SSI.

Taking note of the submission, a division bench of justice T Raja and justice B Pugalendhi dismissed the petition.

Title: DMC to install checkpoints to check on vans with uncovered garbage
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Dehradun: The Dehradun Municipal Corporation (DMC) has decided to install two checkpoints to check whether the vans carrying garbage are covered or not. The checkpoints would be installed at the Shimla Bypass road and the Prem Nagar region. “The DMC is taking steps to ensure that the waste in the garbage vans shouldn’t go open or uncovered. The garbage vans carry the waste to the Shishambara plant but we have received complaints that the waste is going uncovered and it is falling on the roads. Therefore, we have decided to install two checkpoints,” said DMC commissioner Vinay Pandey.

Title: Unrest brewing in Cong over KPCC’s jumbo list
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Severe unrest is brewing within Congress over the jumbo list of office bearers which has been submitted for the high command’s approval. Upset over the developments, two senior leaders of the party V D Satheesan and T N Prathapan have asked the party high command not to consider their names for any post.

Meanwhile, the party high command was not ready to accept the list submitted by KPCC, which comprised six working presidents, 13 vice-presidents, 36 general secretaries and 70 secretaries. Since the high command was not ready to accept the list, the senior leaders from the party who have been camping in New Delhi for a week have now returned.

Prathapan and Satheesan who spoke to AICC general secretary Mukul Wasnik made it clear that the sharing of posts between the groups has brought sever shame to the party. Satheesan was considered for the working president post and Prathapan for the vice-president post.

The group managers had sabotaged the attempt of KPCC president Mullappally Ramachandran to avoid a jumbo committee. Mullappally even had to surrender before the diktats of the group managers from adopting ‘one man one rank’ post.

Apart from the existing working presidents Kodikkunnil Suresh and K Sudhakaran, four more were added to the list to balance the group equations. V D Satheesan from the ‘I’ group and P C Vishnunath from the ‘A’ group were included. However, K V Thomas lobbied for the working president post and his name was included as the high command nominee. To give a representation for the Muslim community, the name of T Siddique was added in the last minute.

For the vice-president posts, 13 were considered to accommodate the senior leaders from both the groups. It also featured MLAs and MPs. V S Sivakumar, Adoor Prakash, Thampanoor Ravi, Sooranadu Rajashekaran, A P Anil Kumar from both the groups have found place in the vice president list among others.

Title: Chennai: Three-year-old girl falls into well, dies
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: A three-year-old girl drowned after falling into a well at a relative’s house in Thirumullaivoyal on Thursday.

The deceased has been identified as Mithra, daughter of Hemkumar and Saranya of Tiruttani. The couple had another child recently. The incident happened when the family of four were visiting Saranya’s sister and her husband at Saraswathi Nagar in Thirumullaivoyal.

Police said Hemkumar and his brother-in-law were away to see a doctor and Saranya and her sister were at home with Mithra and the infant. Police said Saranya was feeding her newborn child, when Mithra was playing inside the house. “She had chided Mithra, asking her not to run inside the house. Mithra told her mother she was going to sleep with her grandfather and left the room,” a police officer said.

Saranya began looking for Mithra after a while but could not find her. Since the surrounding wall of the well was too low, Saranya peeped into it on suspicion and found Mithra floating in the water. Neighbours rescued Mithra and rushed her to a hospital where doctors declared her brought dead.

On information, the Thirumullaivoyal police registered a case and sent Mithra’s body for post-mortem. A police officer said there was about 10feet of water in the well.

A case has been registered and further investigation is on.

Title: Gujarat HC junks levy of IGST on ocean freight
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Gujarat high court (File Photo)

AHMEDABAD: In a major relief to coal importers, the Gujarat high court on Thursday struck down the Centre’s decision to impose Integrated Goods & Service Tax ( IGST ) on ocean freight by holding that its two notifications issued in 2017 levying the duty lacked “legislative competence”.

Various coal importers had challenged two notifications issued by the Centre on June 28, 2017 by which 5% IGST was levied on the estimated component of the ocean freight paid for the transportation of goods by the foreign seller, and this tax is recovered from the importer of the goods.

The bench headed by Justice J B Pardiwala has held the two notifications ultra vires to the provisions of the IGST Act. The bench said, “We have reached to the conclusion that no tax is leviable under the Integrated Goods and Services Tax Act, 2017, on the Ocean Freight for the services provided by a person located in a non-taxable territory by way of transportation of goods by a vessel from a place outside India up to the customs station of clearance in India and the levy and collection of tax of such Ocean Freight under the impugned notifications is not permissible in law.”

The coal importers submitted before the high court that the IGST can be levied on service provider or service recipient, and not on the importers, for they pay customs duty. The imposition of IGST amounts to double taxation because it sought to tax the importers so far as ocean freight is concerned. The importer is not a recipient of service of transportation of goods. The high court also accepted the argument that both, the service provider and the service recipients, are outside India and such a levy goes beyond the mandate of Section 1 of the IGST Act, which extends to the whole of India and not outside India.

Title: 1 each from Telangana, AP top BArch, & Planning in JEE-Main
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Hardik Rajpal

HYDERABAD: One from Telangana and one from Haryana scored 100 percentile in the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) - Main for bachelor in architecture (BArch), while a student from AP topped in bachelor of planning (B Planning), results of which were declared on Thursday.

Hardik Rajpal, a student of Narayana Junior College (Madhapur), shared the top spot with Haryana’s Aarzoo. The national topper from AP in B Planning is Kanumuri Bheemeswara Vijay Varma. Jogi Kapil Dev from AP emerged as the topper in BArch in persons with disability category by securing 99.77 percentile. Total 1.38 lakh students had appeared for JEE-Main for BArch and B.Planning on January 6.

The 18-year-old from the state, who was preparing for JEE (Mains) for engineering, said that he cracked the BArch paper without any special preparations. “I was not expecting to emerge as the topper. While I studied maths for the engineering test, I had not prepared myself for drawing and aptitude,” said Rajpal.

Although the student appeared as the country topper in BArch, he has other plans for his future. “I will wait for the JEE (Advanced) results before I weigh my career options. If I get better score in engineering test, I may prefer to secure admission in one of the coveted engineering institutions,” said Rajpal.

Title: AIADMK, DMK gearing up for crucial poll battle at Vadipatti
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Madurai: The AIADMK and the DMK are gearing up for another poll battle as the elections to the posts of chairman and vice-chairman of the Vadipatti panchayat union are scheduled to be held on January 30.

There was a close fight between the AIADMK and the DMK to bag the coveted panchayat union chairman and vice-chairman posts in the 13 panchayat unions in Madurai district. The elections to the posts of chairman and vice-chairman were held on January 11.

The DMK won the posts in Madurai East, Madurai West, Alanganallur, Usilampatti and Sedapatti panchayat unions. The AIADMK on the other hand won, Thirumangalam, Kallikudi, T Kallupatti, Chellampatti, Melur and Kottampatti unions. As both parties have six panchayat unions each, the victory at Vadipatti is crucial, as the party that wins the union would become the winner in the district.

Among the 13 unions, the election at the Vadipatti panchayat union was not held on January 11 due to lack of quorum. The panchayat union has a total of 14 union ward members, and rules specify the presence of eight members to conduct election.

The DMK has six ward members in the union and the AIADMK has seven. One is an independent candidate.

The state election commission has announced that election would be held at the panchayat union on January 30. Sources said that the DMK is also trying to rope in the independent candidate this time by making him a bigger offer. tnn

Title: Gujarat HC refuses to quash FIR against anti-CAA protesters
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representational

AHMEDABAD: The Gujarat high court has refused to quash an FIR filed against some protesters of the Citizenship Amendment Act observing that the investigation into “the serious offence” is under way and at a very nascent stage.

The court held the accused have not been able to establish that the HC should use its special powers to quash the FIR in this case.

Four protesters including Amarnath Vasava were arrested in Chhapi town in Banaskantha district of north Gujarat, where the protesters had gathered in large numbers.

The authorities had withdrawn permission to hold the programme at the last moment and detained Vasava and three others from their hotel in the morning of December 19, 2019.

After the protests, police booked people including these four for rioting, unlawful assembly, creating rift between communities and criminal conspiracy.

The protesters approached the HC saying that they had been in police detention at the time the alleged trouble took place. Still they have been implicated in the case. Cops had taken them to the venue at the insistence of the mob.

The HC observed that their submission is attractive, but the cops had to take them to the venue due to demand of the mob, which had already started damaging property.

Two of the accused delivered speeches and shouted slogans, though there was no permission to hold the programme, the HC said.

Title: Rivals misled youth, minorities and women: Amit Shah
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Amit Shah

NEW DELHI: Addressing his first election rally in Delhi, Union home minister Amit Shah said the opposition had misled the youth and the minorities on CAA, which was all about giving citizenship to persecuted minorities in the Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh who dream of a peaceful life in India.

“Deputy chief minister of Delhi Manish bhai shamelessly said that they were with Shaheen Bagh protesters. They have tried to disturb peace in Delhi and instigated violence. Will Delhi remain safe if they come back to power?” Shah asked, seeking support of the crowd in favour of the CAA.

Complete Coverage on Delhi Elections

He also blamed the AAP government for trying to save those who allegedly raised anti-India slogans at JNU in 2016 by not granting prosecution sanction to Delhi police to file chargesheet against them.

After his speech at Matiala, Shah went on a “padyatra” in the neighbouring Uttam Nagar constituency and ended the day with another public meeting at Nangloi Jat.

Shah’s speeches in both Matiala and Nangloi Jat started with local issues with the home minister invoking CAA, Ram Mandir, abrogation of Article 370 and 35A in later part of his address. He also blamed the AAP government for obstructing the Ayushman Bharat scheme — which promises free treatment of up to Rs 5 lakh every year to the poor — and giving pucca houses to slum dwellers under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana from being implemented in the national capital for “vote bank politics”. Shah alleged that CM Arvind Kejriwal feared that those who benefitted from the scheme will vote for Modi in the elections.

“BJP’s record is to work even without being in power in Delhi. For 4.5 years, Kejriwal said Modi didn’t allow him work. Now, he is saying the last five years were good. We have to apprise people about the projects that have been left incomplete by AAP government and also tell them that this government didn’t implement Centre’s public welfare schemes like Ayushman Bharat and Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana,” he said.

Shah said 112 government schemes launched by the Centre were not implemented in Delhi. “AAP government is the biggest obstruction in the implementation of these schemes. Remove this obstruction and make the BJP government in Delhi under the leadership of Modi and enjoy their benefits,” he said.

Shah blamed AAP government for supply of contaminated water in the city. He said Modi government had promised to give “mineral water” type supply through tap to every household in the next five years and blamed Kejriwal for trying to take credit for it.

BJP national president J P Nadda and state unit chief Manoj Tiwari addressed two public meetings each in various parts of the city. At Palam, Nadda slammed Congress for backing the Shaheen Bagh protest, saying the then Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Manmohan Singh had urged deputy PM L K Advani in 2003 to grant citizenship to minorities who had migrated from Bangladesh. At Tughlaqabad, Tiwari said by taking the decision to regularise unauthorised colonies, giving ownership rights to its residents and launching ‘Jahan Jhuggi Waha Makan’ scheme, BJP had proved it was the only party “standing” with the poor.

Title: Dozen injured as SUV overturns in Amreli
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Rajkot: A dozen-odd people were injured when the SUV they were travelling in overturned between Chhabhadia and Bhingrad villages of Lathi taluka in Amreli district on Thursday.

“The accident occurred when the driver of the SUV applied sudden brakes in order to save a biker going ahead,” said an official from Lathi police station.

The injured were shifted to the hospitals in Lathi, Damnagar and Amreli. The victims were on their way to Toda village from Dhamel village to attend an engagement ceremony.

Title: Plea: Ensure police involved in vehicle checks are armed
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: The state government has been issued notice on a plea seeking to ensure that police personnel involved in vehicle checks in the state are armed.

In his petition, K K Ramesh, a litigant from Madurai appearing as party-in-person, moved the high court Madurai bench seeking the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) or State Human Rights Commission (SHRC) to take action in cases where police personnel are killed or injured by anti-social elements during vehicle checks.

He also sought that senior officials should ensure that all the police personnel who are involved in vehicle checks or law and order duty are carrying arms. He further sought to install CCTV cameras at all the check-posts situated at the inter-state borders and the visuals should be monitored through a control room.

When the petition was heard on Thursday, a division bench of justice M Duraiswamy and justice T Ravindran issued notice to the state government and adjourned the case to a further date. TNN

Title: UAPA case: CPM dist panel goes on backfoot
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Kozhikode: Two days after UDF hinted that it will take up the case against Allan Shuhaib and Thwaha Fasal, who have been arrested for alleged Maoist links, CPM district committee went on backfoot, saying that the party is still in the process of verifying the details regarding the case.

Addressing a news conference on Thursday, CPM district secretary P Mohanan said the party had not got a chance to hear from the youth as they are still in judicial custody. “We need to check the facts pertaining to the case in detail. We have certain limitations as the youth are in custody,” he said.

Asked about chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan’s remarks on the issue, he said that Pinarayi’s statements may have been based on the information provided by the government machinery.

Mohanan’s assertion is contradictory to the statement by the chief minister who categorically said at different occasions that Allan and Thwaha were Maoists. He had cautioned against whitewashing the youth and presenting them as innocent.

Mohanan said that there will be a natural delay in party’s examination on the Maoist links of CPM workers. “And the party will act as per the finding of the examination,” he said.

It may be recalled that CPM state committee member P Jayarajan also had said that Allan and Thwaha had links with Maoists. In a reply to Allan’s mother Sabitha Shekhar’s Facebook post, Jayarajan had said that party has found out that a wanted Maoist had stayed with Allan in his hostel room.

Meawhile, later in the day, Mohanan issued a statement saying that the media has misquoted him. “Certain media channels are misrepresenting that I have said the chief minister’s is the police version and I have contradicted the CM,” said his statement.

“I said that the government can only proceed in the legal way and what the chief minister said should be taken in the that sense. This statement is being given in the news as P Mohanan said something against the chief minister,” Mohanan said.

He added that both the party and the government have the same view on UAPA. Chennithala’s intervention is just a political drama because as many as 132 cases were framed under UAPA when he was the home minister, he added.

Title: KIYG 2020: Gujarat slips one place, but medal tally up 33%
Content:
Illustration used for representational purpose

AHMEDABAD: Gujarat slipped one place in the Khelo India Youth Games (KIYG) 2020, which were held at Guwahati in Assam, but registered a sizable increase in the number of medals won, as compared to the previous edition. The state ranked ninth among all states in the games which concluded on Wednesday.The Gujarat government, meanwhile, has chalked out a plan aimed at securing one of the top three positions in KIYG by next year. Chief minister Vijay Rupani, while on a video call with the Gujarati contingent last week, had expressed his desire that Gujarat should finish among the top three states and Union territories in the youth games.Government officials said Gujarat’s showing would have been much better, but Mana Patel, who was expected to win four gold medals in swimming, was injured in the first round of the games. Also, certain events in athletics were not part of the KIYG 2020, which impacted Gujarat medal tally.Principal secretary, sports, C V Som, said that 16 of the 20 players who participated in the judo events, got medals. Our medal tally has increased to 52 in 2020 as compared to 39 last year. “Players from Gujarat have excelled not just at the national level, but in international events as well, in disciplines like swimming, table tennis, badminton, shooting and athletics,” Soma stated.The official said that consultations will be held with all the 180 participating players as well as the 10 coaches to chalk out a strategy to improve the state’s performance in upcoming sporting events.

Title: 503 MPs yet to file details of assets
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Dehradun: The Lok Sabha secretariat, in an RTI disclosure, has revealed that several Union cabinet ministers , including Amit Shah, Nitin Gadkari, Nirmala Sitharaman, Rajnath Singh, Prakash Javadekar, Piyush Goyal and Dharmendra Pradhan, have not furnished details of their assets and liabilities within 90 days of taking oath of office and secrecy in Parliament.

Kashipur-based RTI activist Nadim Uddeen had sought details of those MPs in both upper and lower houses, who have submitted details of their assets and liabilities to the Parliament office, and those who haven’t. In the reply, the Lok Sabha secretariat stated that as on December 10, 2019, 503 MPs hadn’t furnished the requisite details, with only 36 MPs, including PM Narendra Modi, Ravi Shankar Prasad and Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank, having done so.

Speaking with TOI, Nadim Uddeen said, “I’d asked for detail of those MPs who haven’t taken oath yet, as well as details of assets and liabilities furnished by them after they took the oath of office and secrecy.”

As per the RTI reply two MPs, Himadri Singh and Atul Kumar Singh, hadn’t even taken oath, as on July 31, 2019. Nadim Uddeen had filed the RTI online on October 24, 2019. The Lok Sabha Secretariat information cell responded on December 11.

Replying to the RTI query, the Lok Sabha Secretariat stated that the Ethics and Privilege branch maintains the declaration of assets and liabilities of members. The RTI reply has the entire list of MPs who have given their details and those who haven’t.

Among cabinet ministers, those who have given their details are minister of agriculture Narendra Singh Tomar, law minister Ravi Shankar Prashad, minister of women and child development Smriti Irani, minister of Parliamentary affairs Prahlad Joshi and HRD minister Ramesh Pokhriyal Nishank. Among prominent Opposition leaders who have not furnished their assets and liabilities are Sonia Gandhi, Rahul Gandhi, Shashi Tharoor, Farooq Abdullah, Akhilesh Yadav and Mulayam Singh Yadav.

“Both ruling and Opposition parties talk of transparency, but they are nowhere close to practicing it. The rule is very clear that details should be given mandatorily, but no one seems to be bothered about it,” said Nadeem Uddeen.

Title: Gujarat: Factory driver stabs labourer to death in Bhavnagar
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

RAJKOT: A labourer in a steel factory located in Tanasa village of Ghogha taluka in Bhavnagar district was killed by the factory’s driver on Wednesday evening over a personal enmity. The accused was arrested on Thursday.

Police said the accused driver, Jaipal Parmar, stabbed Bharat Koli to death as the latter had allegedly complained to the factory manager about the work performance of Parmar’s brother, Harshad, who had joined the factory as a labourer recently. Koli had criticised Harshad’s work as poor.

According to the police, the factory management on basis of Koli’s complaint, had sacked Harshad. This incensed Parmar who also allegedly threatened Koli over phone after Harshad was terminated from his services. Parmar then decided to kill Koli.

“On Wednesday when Koli came out of the factory in the evening, Parmar stabbed him in the back. He was rushed to Sir T Hospital in Bhavnagar where he died shortly after admission,” said P R Solanki, sub-inspector with Ghogha police station.

Parmar was arrested from his residence in Vavadi village of Ghogha taluka.

Title: CAA stir: Political parties hold peaceful protests, others must be vetted, Ahmedabad cops tell court
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representational Image

AHMEDABAD: The city police on Thursday explained before the Gujarat high court why they grant permission to political parties for rallies in support of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) or to oppose it, but refuse permission to those lacking credentials.

After they refused permission to hold a protest rally in Jamalpur, two petitioners – Mudita Vidrohi and Mijahid Nafees – complained before the HC that the state administration straightaway grants permission to the ruling party for rallies in support of CAA but refuses permissions to those who want to oppose the new citizenship law.

In reply, the city police claimed that this argument by the petitioner “is thoroughly misconceived”. It claimed that the rallies taken out by the BJP and Congress were both peaceful and the law and order situation was not threatened anywhere. The affidavit by assistant commissioner of police, I J Patel, said, “None of the instances (of rallies hosted by the ruling dispensation and the opposition) relied upon by the petitioners serve as a precedence which have threatened either law and order or public order. Moreover, permissions to such processions, if any given, are fact based and depending upon the credentials of the hosts.”

Justifying denial of permission to gather 10,000 people to protest CAA in Jamalpur, the police questioned the credentials of the petitioners so far as their assurance to maintain peace in the area. The officer cited statements of residents, who requested cops not to grant permission to this protest programme fearing disruption of peace.

To question the credentials of the petitioners, the police repeatedly cited the incident of the Shah-e-Alam protest held on December 19, 2019, which turned violent. The violence that took place in Shah-e-Alam was cited to refuse permission of a rally from Jamalpur Gate to Khamasa. It was reiterated that a huge crowd of 10,000 cannot be managed by police.

Title: Madurai: 44,000 residents record feedback for Swachh Survekshan survey
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Representative image

MADURAI: With just one week left for the citizens to give their feedback for the Swachh Survekshan 2020 survey, as many as 44,000 people have registered their inputs. Swachh Survekshan survey is conducted every year to ascertain the cleanliness of cities and towns and rankings are given based on various factors.

Officials and workers from Madurai Corporation have been reaching out to the people for the past three weeks asking them to register their feedback, which is crucial in determining the ranking of any local body. Officials said the corporation has not been performing well in terms of ranking in the Swachh Survekshan results due to poor documentation and citizen feedback. This time around, officials left no stone unturned in terms of documentation, and that has been reflected in the first and second quarterly results released last month, in which Madurai had performed well compared to other cities in the state.

Dr S Vinoth Raja, assistant city health officer of the corporation said that they have formed teams, which have been reaching out to college students, residents at temples and other areas where people gather. Public are sensitized on the importance of feedback and help is being provided to download the app required for recording it. After feedback, they will be field visit by teams for direct observation. Some of the areas will be randomly checked and photographs will be taken to provide marks under direct observation category.

Officials said that out of 6,000 mark, a major chunk of 1,500 is allocated to citizen feedback. The civic body has asked people to come forward to record their feedback in next one week. The user needs to input details such as state, city and mobile number to get an OTP on their mobile phone. In total, there will be eight questions. In order to give feedback the user should have lived in the city for at least six months.

Residents can record their feedback through SS2020 VoteForYourCity app, or Swachhata app, or www.swachhsurvekshan2020.org website.

Title: Jamnagar: Two kins arrested in woman’s murder case
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

One of the accused

RAJKOT: The brother-in-law and the cousin of a woman were arrested for her murder in Navania village of Lalpur taluka in Jamnagar district on Wednesday night.

Police said the accused, identified as Haramsinh Ajnar (29) and Dilipsinh Bangel (27), had killed Nanki Tadavi (27) by hitting her with scythes on her head on the night of January 20.

Tadavi’s husband Kanvar had lent Rs 5,000 to the accused. When Kanvar left for his village near Jhabua in Madhya Pradesh, he had an altercation with the accused when he demanded return of money from them and they refused.

“After Kanvar left, Tadavi started asking the accused for the money, tired of which they decided to bump her off,” said D S Vadher, sub-inspector Meghpar Padana police station.

Earlier, the crime was undetected. However, after the return of Kanvar, he gave a statement to the cops, identifying the accused as the suspects.

The accused were arrested from Kanalus railway station of Lalpur taluka where they had gone to board a train to Madhya Pradesh.

Title: As mercury rises, watermelons, tender coconuts arrive
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Madurai: As the afternoon temperature starts climbing and hovering around 35 degrees Celsius, summer coolers such as watermelon and tender coconuts have started arriving in the city.

“The rise in the afternoon temperature is indicative of the hot summer that we are going to face this year,” said T Swaminathan of Anna Nagar.

The retired teacher says that there were days when winter afternoons were considered best for walks in Madurai, but not anymore.

Selathayee, a vendor who sells watermelon near the Mattuthavani bus stand, said that the fruit was selling for about Rs 25per kilogram as the supplies were just starting.

“The inside of the fruit has not become that red or tasty, but it is good to tackle the afternoon heat and many people are buying it regularly,” she said.

Fruit Vendors Association secretary S Muruganantham said that about 10-15 tonnes of watermelons are arriving from Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka to the Madurai market every day.

In the coming days it will go up to more than 100 tonnes. This year the supply is going to be good, he said.

Meanwhile, tender coconut sales have also started picking up and the vendors say that the bigger ones with more water are selling for Rs 60.

“Customers are not complaining as the heat in the afternoons has increased,” said T Kannan of Pudur.

Wholesale tender coconut dealer V Sampathkumar said that the city was only receiving about 40,000 to 50,000 tender coconuts per day, predominantly from Theni district.

“Traders are finding it hard to make a living after the demonitization and now the supplies have also dropped due to water scarcity,” he said. The low supplies were a reason for the high price, he said.

Meanwhile, doctors said that people should keep themselves well hydrated this season as the afternoon temperatures are rising. Tender coconuts and watermelons are good for all seasons in Madurai, they said.

Title: Telangana: Tribal co-operative society gets Rs 3 crore GST shocker over sand mining
Content:
Representative image

ETURUNAGARAM: T Sammakka, a tribal woman who survives as a farm labourer in Mulugu district’s Eturunagaram town, got the shock of her life recently when GST intelligence officials slapped a Rs 3 crore tax evasion notice on her.The director-general of GST intelligence for Hyderabad zone in its notice told her that the cooperative society she was heading had mined sand worth Rs 24.5 crore and had a tax liability of Rs 3.4 crore, an amount she had not even dreamt of in her life.According to the authorities, the Eturu Grama Prajala Isuka Quarry Labour Contract Cooperatie Society Limited had received the money from the Telangana State Mineral Development Corporation (TSMDC) towards sand excavation services.The rules state that any sand mining contract and related activity in scheduled tribal areas must exclusively be given to local, scheduled tribal persons only. Sammakka and other members of the society say they had subcontracted the sand-mining to larger companies for which they received around Rs 1 lakh each into the bank account. Also, they had no clue of the vast transactions that were taking place in their name.A TOI investigation in this tribal region on the banks of Godavari in Telangana found out that most cooperative societies that got sand excavation contracts immediately subcontracted the work to construction and infrastructure companies in Hyderabad and Warangal . Sources said that it was likely that the society members were given a pittance compared to the earnings from the sand mining.Sammakka, who belongs to the Koya tribe, told TOI, “I took over as president after society elections in April 2016. We subcontracted sand mining to five companies and had no role in excavation thereafter.”She further said: “For every meeting that we attended, they paid us Rs 500 each and we signed the documents. All the accounts of the society are taken care of by officials of Euturunagaram Integrated Tribal Development Authority (ITDA). In three villages, there are 600 members of the society, each getting between Rs 80,000 and Rs 1 lakh.”Sammakka’s neighbour Seetha Lakshmi said, “Huge sand mining happened right in front of us. But we didn’t know the amount of sand excavated. What the members of the society got was a pittance.”Officials at the Mulugu district registrar of cooperative societies’ office revealed that Sammakka’s society was registered on February 16, 2015. The district collector, after approval of the district sand committee, handed over the sand mining contract to TSMDC. The mining corporation in turn gave it to the tribal society. The society now says it only passed this on to the other companies.TSMDC has agreed to pay Rs 150 per cubic metre to the sand societies for excavation work. The Society has given subcontract. As per the subcontract, the scope of the work includes excavation of sand and transportation it to nearby stock yard and loading the sand into the truck as specified by TSMDC.The subcontractors paid Rs 70 per cubic metre to the Society. It was estimated that around 67.5 lakh cubic metres at Eturu and around 56 lakh cubic metres of sand at Thupakulagudem was available as per contractThe transactions were from March 2015 to December 2016 during the service tax regime, and the society neither obtained service tax registration nor paid the tax. Chityala Arun Kumar, one of the members of the society, appeared before GST officials and said, “Society has given the contract for excavation to five subcontractors. We are not registered with the service tax department hence we did not pay any service tax. Due to lack of awareness and clarity on applicability of service tax on the excavation of sand we haven’t paid the tax.” He added that he would get back after consulting other society members.ITDA officials said that Rs 80 was being paid to subcontractors per cubic metre by the societies and they get a profit of Rs 70 per cubic metre. It said 18.1 lakh cubic metres of sand had been sold by the Eturu society for which around Rs 27 crore has been paid to the society in which Rs 14 crore is paid to subcontractors and society got Rs 12.7 crore profit.

Title: Govt decides to acquire land for semi high-speed rail corridor
Content:
This story is from January 24, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: The state government has decided to initiate procedures for acquiring land for the Thiruvananthapuram-Kasaragod semi high speed rail corridor, which was accorded in-principle approval by the ministry of railways. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan here on Thursday.

According to the project’s feasibility study report, the government has to acquire a total of 1,226 hectre land. But, the railways ministry has now agreed to use its surplus land in places where the new rail comes parallel to the existing railway line. Thus, the semi high-speed rail project would get around 200 hectres of land from railways.

The government will have to acquire the rest of the land, and for speedy work, the meeting decided to open acquisition cells immediately. The meeting was attended by public works minister G Sudhakaran, chief secretary Tom Jose, transport principal secretary K R Jyothilal and Kerala Rail Development Corporation (KRDC) MD V Ajithkumar.

The project, estimated at Rs 66,000 crore, is being taken up by the KRDC, wherein the Indian Railways and the state government have equal share. The project is being implemented with loans expected from international financial agencies, and discussions are on with German Bank, Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank and Japan International Cooperation Agency. tnn
